Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: robsarahsadventures
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas & New year for 4 nights. We found the hotel easily, just turn left on leaving the station. The hotel was very modern & the rooms were comfortable. There was no character but as a modern build it offered everything we needed in a great location. The room was well set out & the facilities in the room were good. A few minutes walk gives access to the centre of Amsterdam. The breakfast was good & the restaurant was light & airy & gives lovely views across the City. The only criticism is that the hot items on the breakfast buffet were at best luke warm. All in all a good choice for comfort & location.

Reviews.Title: “Central, new and trendy hotel in Amsterdam - very convenient”
Reviews.Author: robfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with 3 friends on few days away. There are lots of pluses to choosing this hotel. First, centrally located right next to the Centraal Station, so no dragging luggage through Amsterdam's bumpy streets. Second, its very new and clean and on the lines of a trendy American hotel. There is a slick bar/lounge at the top of the hotel that offers the best views of all of Amsterdam. Some very cool amenities are the AppleTV on a Mac screen - can integrate your iPod, etc. - first time I have ever seen this in a hotel. Bathrooms are also very new and well fitted out. Service at the front desk was great too. I will definitely stay here again and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: urbancliffy
Reviews.Content: Very ordinary Reception area, lacking any indication it is a 4 star Hotel, just one long desk as you enter from a very unimpressive entrance. Just a few benches not a flower arrangement in sight. Very commercial. Reception staff really helpful. Standard rooms are well equiped with all you require for 3 or 4 nights. En suite recently refurbished is good. Excellent showers, plenty of good quality towels soaps and creams.Lots of rooms back onto the railway and these can be noisy if you are a light sleeper. Restaurant can get hectic at breakfast seemed to be a shortage of trained staff, tables not cleared dirty table mats not changed (yet another Hilton that does not use side plates or saucers) Another hotel that hasn't heard of providing hot plates for guests. Overall probably lacks good management direction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chubes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Doubletree Amsterdam Centraal for 4 nights in April. The walk from Centraal Station is about 12 minutes with heavy luggage.Hotel sign was not obvious, so luckily, we found the right direction to walk. We had a room facing the Amsterdam Eye and Centraal Station. If you are a super light sleeper, opt for rooms not facing the Eye. But as my room is on 8th floor, it did not bother us at all. The initial room had a broken door latch and a malfunctioning iron. After 4 calls to housekeeping and reception, no one came to look at the items. At the 5th call, the staff decided to change our room. The 2nd room was fine, except that the TV was not working. We informed the front desk and this staff merely smiled and said he noted and will send someone up. He did not even write down my room number. As expected, no one came and we have to call front desk again. On one of the days when we came back to room at 5pm, the room was not made up yet. Poor staff who came later apologized profusely for the late cleaning as there had been many rooms to clean that day. Other than these, overall experience at Doubletree was ok and I would expected a higher standard and sincere service from a Hilton subsidy.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dani764579
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a long weeked trip with my husband. We choose this property because of it's great location. The property looks great and the front desk staff were friendly upon arrival. They even upgraded us to a nicer room because of my husbands Hilton Honors status. The room was nice. We had a nice city view but we noticed there were no wash cloths in the bathroom or soap of any kind. We got washcloths the next day but our soap dispenser never was refilled. Luckily we had brought some from home. On the second day we had a problem with the lights in the bathroom and it took almost 24 hours before they were fixed. We also had a problem with the toilet and we repeatly called the front desk but noone ever came to fix it. We ended up having to use the bathroom in the lobby! Despite the bad service we had a good time. We ate breakfast downstairs several times and the food was very good. We also had drinks at the Sky lounge. The staff was great and so was the view. If you are looking for a convienent place to stay I wouldn't rule out this hotel but they obviously have some issues to work out when it comes to maintenence and thier maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on same side as Grand Central station - very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel and rooms are clean and modern and the hotel has free wifi - all good. When I checked in I mentioned I was a light sleeper and asked for a quiet room. However I was only able to get on 6th floor and told my room was on the side facing the railway - the hotel is directly adjacent to the main railway station in Amsterdam. I was told that if I wanted a room facing the other side I had to upgrade to deluxe for another â‚¬30 per night! Very disappointing. I wasnt prepared to do this. The noise was however terrible and disturbed both my nights' sleep.. the sound proofing is pretty poor and trains run almost all through the night. Colleagues in other rooms also complained about the same problem. I ate in the restaurant for dinner one night, it was ok. Breakfast was very crowded and the amount of hot food buffet n was too small for the number of people wanting it, which meant eg that there was no bacon or sausage available. I care primarily that rooms are clean and that I can have a good night's sleep. The hotel failed to deliver on a good nights sleep and I do object to having to pay a premium to guarantee just this.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaw104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend break and had an excellent stay. Our room was comfortable (we were particularly impressed by the iMAC which provided not only TV and radio but also internet access) and the staff were very efficient and professional. The hotel is very conveniently located, being a 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station. We did not sample the breakfast since it was expensive (24 Euros per person) but since it is so close to the city centre, it is very easy to find breakfast at a local cafe. We did visit the Sky Bar on the 11th floor and we thought this was excellent (we recommend visiting there even if you are not staying at the hotel). The view is unique for a city which contains few high rise buildings. The level of service and quality of drinks (and accompanying snacks) was excellent. A good choice for a citybreak, or on business.

Reviews.Title: “Newest hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: YYCTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel next to Central Station? Must eat at sky lounge at top of hotel. It over looks the entire city. Perfect location to all tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: arnaud d
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel ideally located. It litterally takes 3 to 5 mins (depending on your shape!) to walk to the more lively center. Hotel staff very helpful: I've forgotten my keys twice and there was no problem to get a new one. Room was fantastic with a sublime view of the city center. Great room service. The cookie given on arrival is excellent. I recommend it very warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leena1985
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel as a group of four ladies and we had a very warm welcome to the hotel and had lovely warm chocolate chip cookies handed to us. Our rooms were pleasant and clean. We was placed on the 10th floor and had a terrace at the end of our terrace which was had brilliant views of the whole of the Amsterdam. It's a 15minute walk to Dam square but 2 minutes away from Central Station. There was only one minor complaint I had which was having a room on the station side which means it was a little noisy at night and can disturb sleep, but I guess as we were on the 10th floor it weren't as bad as if we were on the lower floors. We paid 100 euros per room per night which was totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMan101
Reviews.Content: Really one of the nicest city break hotels I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree by Hilton = fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MichaelVanDervort
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week of vacation in March 2012. It was fabulous. Our suite had a breathtaking view of the Amstel. Centraal station and all attractions in Amsterdam are in easy walking distance or take a tram. If ou are a Hiltonhhonors member, they treat you like royalty. Spacious rooms, iMac tv/computers and an excellent buffet (tough pricey if not comped). Only drawback was the rooms overlook main train tracks, which we found charming but would bother some travelers.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marianoua
Reviews.Content: After travelling for hours we arrived at the Double Tree hotel. Very nice hotel, good location, clean with large rooms. Yet, even if we arrived at the hotel at 9.00 a.m they didnt give us a room until 15:15!! The skylounge at the top of the hotel is amazing and drinks are very good-not very expensive. The breakfast was very very expensive (24,50 euro) so we didnt even try it. However, the hotel overall is very good and is next to the central station. The ticket for the airport is arount 4 euros (15-20 min approx.). The red light district is about 5-10 minutes walking from the hotel so you can go anywhere on foot! for sure I recommend it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “family visit”
Reviews.Author: lynniemac13
Reviews.Content: lovely stay (2nights) in 2 rooms with our two young teenage grandsons. reception staff are very welcoming and grandsons particularly appreciated the warm cookies that you are given as you arrive (and anytime after that if you ask!) restaurant staff too are friendly and helpful. I wanted a poached egg with spinach and before you knew it I was presented with it! very tasty it was too. the rooms are newly renovated and with Imac's too - grandsons very happy with that. only downside is location. its handy for most attractions but the noise for those rooms on the station side is not nice. I didn't get much sleep on either night as trains thunder by and I mean thunder. so if you want sleep ask for a room on the amsterdam side of building. if you want a view go for river side - its really nice to look out the window at boats going by! horses for courses.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unless you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Maximtoo
Reviews.Content: Great location. Cool design. Impossible to sleep with the pounding music from the top-floor disco literally vibrating the water in our glasses. Even lower floors are not immune to the boom-boom-boom. Also, don't pay extra for the touted "city view." Ours turned out to be a view directly into another guest room about 10 meters away. Guess it beats the alternative: looking out over the trains that pass within a few meters of guest rooms on the other side. Great, friendly staff. Too bad they can't do much about the noise and views. For these prices, suggest you find better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Dimm_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The doubletree is very close to the main train station in very easy walking distance. It is quite new and the area is just being finished off but there was no building work. The room I had was wonderful. It had a brilliant view of the city from a balcony. I had a great sleep and the only thing I struggled with was using the TV. it was an Apple TV and I just couldnt get it to work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nettles547
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel over easter and had a wonderful time. From the minute we booked in the staff could not have been more helpful. It was our anniversary and my husband's birthday. We had booked a standard room without breakfast as it would have cost 50 euros per day for breakfast which we felt was a bit steep, and there were plenty of places outside to choose from.However, the receptionist spoke to a colleague and upgraded us to a city view deluxe room, which included a free mini bar and full breakfast !! We appreciated this very much and had a fantastic stay. The mini bar was replenished every day with beer, coke, bottled water, pringles and nuts. The breakfast was superb, everything you would want. The staff were fantastic, our waiter, Tranuosfillios (hope spelling right) had to have a special mention as he was tremendous. Nothing was too much trouble, he was very attentive, courteous, always had a smile and it was a pleasure to greet him each morning. We have stayed 3 times before in Amsterdam but can honestly say this was by far the best hotel yet. The sky lounge on the 11th floor has wonderful views over the city. I would thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel and can't thank the staff enough for making our stay so special. Well done Hilton !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marlew76205
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night at this hotel, its new and has a great location, only a few steps from the central station and within an easy 10 to 15 minute walk to all of Amsterdams tourist sites.If you are going on a River cruise its also minutes from where the ships dock. The staff was very helpful and the rooms clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: LondonFlorita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this modern hotel (formerly Mint Hotel) Friday to monday in early January. We got an amazing deal online. I dont care for cookies but the warm signature cookie on check in was amazing. I mac in every room is excellent. We had a corner room, with access to a balcony overlooking the City - amazing (I presume an upgrade but they never mentioned when we checked in). I hear standard rooms are compact, but who travels to Amsterdam to stay in the room. Gorgeous hote in a fantastic location (couple of minute walk from Centraal station). Bathrooms modern and spotless, shower only. Although we had breakfast included, we never made it any of the three days. Loved our stay here and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: Caroline K
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, the maid was impeccable, staff very helpful and friendly, the mac in the room was great for looking things up/checking the weather. I was really impressed. It was also great to step off the train and a few minutes later be at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: b00mer15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Easter weekend in 2012. Overall the hotel is fantastic. It is right across the street from the Centraal Train Station which is extremely handy. Finding a hotel in the somewhat confusing "Canal Belt" would prove very difficult if you weren't familiar with the area. For us, being new to Amsterdam it was perfect. We had a room that faced the city and had floor to ceiling windows. We had a fantastic view. The room and bathroom were new and modern and of quite good size. There was an IMac computer in the room as well as free Wifi throughout the hotel. The breakfast was not included with the price we paid and was 25 Euros each so we only had it once. It was nice and had lots of selection but you can get much more for much less eating at one of the cute little cafe / bakeries not far away. All in all it was a great stay for us and would definitely stay here again if we were to return to Amsterdam. Would highly recommend booking museum entrances / bike tours in advance. Sometimes it can save you a few Euros but also lets you skip lines. You can print directly from your room and pick up at the concierge. We did this for the Keukenhof, Joyride Bike Tour and the Van Gogh Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: dlreynolds
Reviews.Content: Five minute walk from central station. Staff very friendly and efficient. Room faced the city was large with floor to ceiling windows. Our friends had an interior room that was smaller. Room and bathroom are modern, updated and clean. Good breakfast buffet, really liked the Sky Lounge. Easy walk to city center. We were 4th floor and had no problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Some niggles but A* concierges made up for that”
Reviews.Author: tiaraflipflops
Reviews.Content: Small beds, thin walls, construction work, always 5 mins further away than you think, but oh the wonderful staff (and breakfast, and the cookie!) made it all worthwhile... Location - if you're coming from Central Station, come out station main doors, turn left and walk 5 mins and you'll see it. Lobby is tucked right round the back, you walk past all the bar & restaurant windows and turn the corner to finally see the entrance door. Watch out for mad cyclists, trams and cars coming from every direction! Personally I found the location a bit of a pain, you always had that 5-7 min walk after coming off a tram or train. I'd have preferred to be in the centre of the town rather than at one end. But it was easy being near the transport hub, esp for getting to and from the airport. Check in - smooth and easy. Very helpful Dominik also gave us lots of info, a useful map and of course the famous warm choc cookie! Room was ready for us even tho it was only 12.30ish. Room - we had 2 interconnecting rooms, altho bit of a glitch that it took them 20 mins to come and unlock the door! Both rms nice, one much larger as on corner. However the beds were disappointingly small, seemed like a 5' double, I think a hotel of this price range should be a 6' double, so we didn't sleep that well. Stylish furnishings, pleasant and v clean bathrooms. Not much storage space, good tea tray, metal shutters on windows bit industrial. Aircon quite noisy and gave a bright glow at night, had to stick an elastoplast over the display! We'd asked to be away from trains, and were v pleased to be on front of hotel. Would have preferred to be higher up to avoid construction works right outside. Walls thin, could hear other guests coming in at 2am. Breakfast - outstanding buffet with smoked salmon, all usual cooked stuff and in addition lovely cod nuggets. Hot choc for kids, and even warm waffles. Waiting staff so friendly. Guest Services - best feature of the hotel. All concierge staff were helpful, enthusiastic, knowledgeable, with perfect English. Paul and Akos both particularly good. They sold us I-Amsterdam cards, and tickets to museums like Van Gogh so we could avoid their queues, gave us discount cards for others, and free drinks vouchers for evening meals out. Helped plan a queueing strategy for the Anne Frank house, and successfully showed us on the map how to walk round the town while keeping our kids away from the Red Light District! Just brilliant. Wish I could still ring them up now to help with normal life! Enjoy your stay. Hope some of this is useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: levtahor
Reviews.Content: Got into Amsterdam on a late train and was very happy to be staying at this hotel, which is right next to the central station. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Room was sufficient. I received a room looking out into the internal shaft of the hotel, which was non ideal but generally size and cleanliness was good for Amsterdam. Internet worked reliably, if slightly slowly. iMac in each room seemed like a bit of a gimmick and I think that this investment could be better spent elsewhere. I also think that 25 Euro for breakfast is ridiculous, though this is not the only corporate hotel with this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: SmarterTools I
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern, clean and the staff was friendly. The rooms were incredibly small and all aspects of the hotel were over priced. The fitness room was nice and the location next to the train station was convenient. The "king beds" were actually separate double twin beds which were very uncomfortable as they are on wheels and rolled around the room. We asked maintenance if there was a way to lock the wheels but they said no. We tried pushing the beds against the wall but still struggled. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, slick in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dxb09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel as part of a stag trip to Amsterdam. Hotel was well located. 5min walk from the centraal railway station and also within walking distance of many of the attractions or at least good transport links to these ie metro, tram, train. Check in area was very busy but there were plenty of staff there to deal with everyone so it made the check in process quick and straight forward. On check in we were all given fresh cookies - absolutely delicious! Rooms were a little compact but were adequate for our needs. They were spotlessly clean and very modern. Room had safe, mini bar, iron and a nice shower. The highlight was the iMac with tv and Internet included. Really handy and something unique which I haven't seen in any other hotels before. Went for a drink in the sky bar before hitting the town. Views were great but at â‚¬8 a pint of Heineken I don't think it's worth it!! Didn't eat dinner there but had the breakfast buffet. At â‚¬25 it is expensive but in fairness it was a buffet with plenty of variety of food which was good. On a whole I would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Excellent staff too! Oh, and chocolate chip cookies!”
Reviews.Author: soverdi
Reviews.Content: The friendly reception desk gave us an upgraded room after I requested a room with city view. Maybe my Silver level membership with Hilton Honors helped. The room had an iMac that provided internet access as well as TV and music. There were bath robes and slippers, and the room included a mini bar, though just the basics, beer, soda and snacks. Finally, a European bathroom where water does not spill from shower to the floor! No tub, but shower had a door. It is ideally situated next to Centraal Station. We just walked to most sites. You'll only need the tram if going to the museums, if you don't want to walk. The chocolate chip cookies are still warm when they give it to you upon checkin. I LOVE THIS HOTEL! Only thing is it is above rail tracks, so sometimes you hear the trains rolling, though it wasn't often.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: flaljee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at over 8 hotels in central Amsterdam including Radisson Blu, NH Schiller, Park Plaza Victoria, Grand Amrath and Crowne Plaza and this one by far is the most impressive. It used to be the Mint hotel until a fee months ago when it became the Doubletree. A few minutes walk from Central Station, and Dam Square, the hotel offers free wifi, a iMac in your room, great 24 hour room service and a generous fitness center. The rooms are fresh and immaculately annointed with modern fixtures and has a clean layout. The use of space is admirable. I can't commend Hilton enough for maintaining this hotel and its standards since taking over. I think I've found my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, location can't be better. Room a bit smaller than expected.”
Reviews.Author: costaricantraveler08
Reviews.Content: Yes, Amsterdam is a very nice city, and this hotel is a great way to spend the time there. Location can't be better. 100m from the Central rail station. Literally next door. You just hope of the train and to the hotel, and you are ready to enjoy the city. Nice 1st floor bar and restaurant. Excelente after hours cocktail bar at the top, so good that even locals come. With an excelent view of the city. Room is tradicional good european decoration, with everthing you need even with a 22in Mac laptop with internet that worked as TV too. Great if you are not traveling with your own computer. I was traveling alone for business so the room was good enough, but the only thing I would of liked was the size fo the room. If I would of be traveling with someone else it woule of been small. I know rooms in Europe are smaller than other continents, but for such a good hotel and the rate I would of liked a bit more space to move around. All the room including bathroom was for sure less then 18m2.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ISCA13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Amsterdam staying at this hotel. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming presenting my wife and I with a nice warm chocolate cookie on arrival. We were offered and accepted an upgrade to an excecutive room which sounded good but in reality I don,t think for us was really worth it. The upgrade came with a free breakfast which I had already paid for. A free paper each morning this was good. A free mini bar restocked each day which was not as good as it sounded as the contents were 2 bottles of water, 2 bottles of beer, 2 cans of coke, a small tin of pringles and a packet of nuts. Not to bad for me with the beer but not for the wife as she dosnt drink the stuff. A small bottle of wine would have been better. We also had to ask for the mini bar to be re-stocked the next day when we came back after a day of sight seeing The room was fine with a good view although not much drawer space for clothes. The sky lounge on the top floors had magnificant views but you paid for this in the price of the drinks. Breakfast was ok all in all a good hotel. Even with the few little problems we would stay again as it is well located and has very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: lulu12391
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our second trip to Amsterdam I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough . We arrived on a Friday lunchtime and were delighted to learn our room was ready . Although we had requested a city view room by e mail on arrival we were told that there were none that day and our room faced toward s the other rooms in the hotel but were reassured that being on the 10 th floor there would be worry of train noises ..and they were right ! Our room was clean bright and well equipped . The bathroom was small but ample and the shower warm and powerful ! I must congratulate Hilton on there courteous staff in Amsterdam who were not only helpful ( guest services saved us a huge que at the van goth museum by selling us the tickets at reception )but cheerful and pleasant in there approach to there work . We only ate breakfast at he hotel but this was delicious with a large variety of hot and cold foods. French toast is a must . The sky lounge although slightly more expensive than drinking in the bar downstairs has spectacular views over the city and delicious cocktails to sip as u watch the sunset . The location of this hotel is perfect . 5 mins by foot from central (if that )and 10 mins walk to the eateries of the old town. Although it is within close proximity to the station I did nt hear a train once in the 3 days I was there . Will definetely use Doubletree on my next visit to this wonderful city .

Reviews.Title: “Central and Super”
Reviews.Author: GourmetEssex
Reviews.Content: A simply great hotel with fabulous facilities and the nicest staff anywhere in the world. Great accommodation and a terrific position, near to the Centraal Station and yet on its own little island. Easy to find, fantastic rooms and suites. Ours was simply lovely, overlooking the river, but also the railway lines. An occasional rattle from the trains was more than compensated for by the great views. The restaurants and bars, especially the Sky Lounge, were lovely, and once again the staff were fabulous. Guest services directed us to the best (not the most expensive) restuarants in the city and explained the tram system and where to go generally, as we had not visited the city for over twenty five years. We cannot wait to go back. This time it will not be another twenty five years. Breakfast was a bit chaotic despite the efforts of the manager, but with an hotel filled to capacity and everyone wanting to be fed at the same time, all in all it was very good indeed

Reviews.Title: “I"m surprised to see that there is no free bottle mineral water”
Reviews.Author: ipodster
Reviews.Content: Read great reviews from other travellers on this site that this hotel is good. Also provided free bottle water in room. Didn't see them though when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: FergalB
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. Location is really convenient - 2 minute walk from Centraal Station Amsterdam (just turn to the left as you exit the station!). Staff are, without exception, friendly and polite and rooms are well equipped and immaculately clean. Having an iMac in each room is certainly a bonus and internet access is free...Hotel is 5 minutes walk from the city centre and I only had to use a taxi once during my stay as I was easily able to get to wherever I needed to on foot.... I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's newest hotel and perhaps second best after IC Amstel”
Reviews.Author: borwukNewYork
Reviews.Content: For the record: I never think very highly of Dutch service sector. My experience is that Dutch hotel staff usually has no problem to say 'no' or demand senseless fees for a child roll away or demand outrageous WiFi fees. So further introduction of Hilton values is a welcoming development. Suite room is very nice and cool. Instead of regular TVs, there were two iMacs in the room where you can either use an iMac or watch TV. location is very good. Minutes walk to all the trams and subway and Centraal Station. We used points and despite our gold Hilton Honors status were given no upgrade and our room had no view but to an inner atrium. However, there were complimentary drinks in the fridge. Some rooms will have great views of the city. There were some cleverly designed public use balconies where you can enjoy watching the city. Espresso machine in the room. although I am happy to report that it's been a good Starbucks year in Amsterdam. Both LeidsePlein and Rembrandtplein now have Starbucks. Warning only for the near future: Due to some construction Ooesterdoksstraat is closed in the middle and if you come by car and want to self park, you either need to know the place or have some kind of GPS or Google Maps etc....because the entrance of the parking is far on the other end of Ooesterdoksstraat, again due to construction. It's a huge underground for all the nearby facilities. Follow the sign for the hotel and you can park right under the hotel. There is direct lift to the lobby. Late night, you will need your key to open the door to the hotel lobby lift. Parking is expensive. â‚¬30 or more depending on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Waterways, Cycle craze, Happy days”
Reviews.Author: WheelPhill
Reviews.Content: Perfect location next to Centraal railway station. Walk in 3 minutes. Excellent friendly staff. Efficient check in & out. English is widely spoken. Bedroom was clean & tidy. Wide choice of foods for breakfast from cereals, yogurts, cooked English/Dutch to cold meats & fish. Thankful it was included in our package. Booked a short break with Easyjet. Amsterdam is a fascinating city. Do hire a bike; the seperate cycle lanes make cycling safe. Have a canal cruise to appreciate the architecture. Visit the Van Gogh & Rijks museum. And travel by train. We managed a visit to Haarlem & the seaside [Zandvoort aan Zee]. The Dutch people are very friendly and are always willing to help wandering travellers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sfleis2
Reviews.Content: We were given a room facing the city and had a lovely view. Free internet in the room is a first for me. We were treated very well. the location is convenient as to the closeness to all trans. It is far enough away from some of the noisier sections and we appreciated thsat as well. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the city, so convenient!”
Reviews.Author: 9Key
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here and really enjoyed it. The front desk staff were very helpful and tolerant of two Americans traveling in Europe. They spoke wonderful English! Parking was very expensive - about 75 euro a night - so we found a service that picks up your car at the hotel and parks it somewhere for you for only 50 euro for two nights. You call or email them and they bring your car back to you in about 15 minutes. Very convenient! Ask at the front desk and they can hook you up. Our room was on the 7th floor and faced to interior courtyard and was quiet as a crypt. We loved it! We had read that the exterior room has nice views but were loud. There is an iMac in the room that is free to use. It provides your TV and Internet access, including a mouse and keyboard so you can surf and check email. You can print from the iMac and pick up your papers at Guest Services - no charge at all! Great for printing maps for the next leg of your journey. There is free wifi throughout the hotel. It is very fast and does not require a password like most hotels. The hotel is located just a few steps from the Central Station where you can can catch the trams that run all over town. You are just a few blocks from some great restaurants and bars! We loved it here and will probably stay in this hotel on our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BASE FOR CENTRAL AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: christine d
Reviews.Content: Very near to Central station.(5 minute walk) Try to book a harbour view room, nicer view and less train noise but to honest after a few hours we didnt notice the trains . Room smallish but functional and very clean and cosy.Comfortable bed with nice linen. Not enough tea and milk replenished although hotel very willing to bring up if you ring down but we bought a small supply which was easier. Shower excellent and towels changed daily, bed linen alternate days.Breakfast excellent lots of choice and food in hotel also very good.(We ate in 1 night).Drinks in Sky lounge expensive but free nuts and nibbles.Staff very friendly polite and helpful.Would recomend hotel for comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: kawoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! I understand hilton corp took over this from Mint Hotel group so there are many leftovers from the existing brand - which I love. Hilton could learn a thing or two. This is now my preferred hotel in Amsterdam after many a stay at many less than average properties - Hilton Amsterdam (middle of nowhere for me!), Radisson (nice if you get a business class room but otherwise rooms are mehhh), Renaissance (superb, just not a hilton family property sadly), Marriott (good depending on location for you). And then there's the Doubletree - wow. Was given a suite which was just amazing - apple TV and PC in the bedroom and lounge room, very contemporary design which I loved, the room service food was amongst the best i've ever had - wow, the toiletries were White Company which were great and the bathroom was amazing. The skybar superb, the breakfasts - amazing including the seperate package waffles, mmm, the wifi super fast and nice. The staff - also friendly. There are only a couple criticisms a) You can't pay for parking on your bill - it's a seperate facilty unfortunately b) the skybar staff were funny about billing things to your room - to the point where I had to stop my business meeting, go down to the lobby, put my card with reception and then have reception call them. I mean what hotel F&B facility does this sort of thing, i mean seriously. But this won't fault my 5/5, finally a Hotel in Amsterdam I love - can't wait to come back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong season, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RachImo
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel to be greater by a lovely member of staff who gave me a warm cookie. Considering it was absolutely freezing weather it was a welcome treat. I cannot fault the staff, the room or the facilities. I would return for another visit any time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend, nothing was ever too much trouble. Could not fault a thing, thank you Doubletree for your perfect location, a”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl1807
Reviews.Content: Well I think my title says it all really. For my boyfriends 40th birthday we decided to head to Amsterdam for the weekend. After reading previous reviews I'd noted that Station facing rooms could be noisy so I emailed the hotel explaining of the birthday celebrations and requested a City facing room and to my surprise we were kindly upgraded to a King City Suite with no extra charges. We arrived around 11am Saturday morning, the hotel is just a 2 minute walk from the main train and tram station. The journey from the airport was around 10mins and only cost about 5euros each. We received an extremely warm welcome from the hotel staff, were offered a daily newspaper request of our choice, drinks vouchers and a late check out of 2pm on our leaving date. And to top that we were handed our warm cookies (amazing!) and off we went to our suite. The suite was perfect, very clean and modern, almost like we had our very own little apartment. Huge TV linked to iMac in the living room area and the bonus of a second iMac in the bedroom. Floor to ceiling windows in both the living area and the bedroom with the best views over Amsterdam. The bathroom was also very clean with a bath and shower and lots of complimentary goodies from the White Company. We didn't manage to hit the gym but did have some lovely drinks in the Sky Lounge. We chose not to have hotel breakfast either as we preferred to explore Amsterdam for breakfast instead. The hotel staff had our very best interests at heart, a quick call down to Concierge for additional coffees, milks and the famous cookies and they were there in a flash. We also needed advice for an Indonesian restaurant and Long Pura was suggested to us, we were shown details on the Internet with advice of trams to get and after we gave the green light the call was made to the restaurant on our behalf and all sorted for us (restaurant was also a big hit, thank you!!) The location of the hotel is perfect, just a small walk from the main tourist spots but not in the thick of it allowing you the peace if required. Thanks again to Doubletree Amsterdam, you made both my boyfriend's birthday very special as you did my trip away celebrating it with him.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMcG_12
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best city-break hotels we have stayed in. Although our double room lacked any view it was well appointed and very quiet. The continental breakfast was excellent. The location is very good - easy walk from the train station and within walking distance of all the sights and nightlife whilst avoiding noise. However the best asset of this hotel is it's wonderful staff who are so friendly and attentive that staying there is a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The Bright Light of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kenmbender
Reviews.Content: We booked a five night stay via Living Social. Having never been to The Netherlands, we felt this would have been a perfect opportunity. It was. The hotel was in the best location, clean, comfortable and the staff was great. Check-In was quick (it took longer to walk over from Central Station than to complete the check in). We had just arrived from the flight from Miami, so sight seeing was not at the top of the list that night. We dropped our gear off at the room, then went to the restaurant to grab a bite to eat. The food was great and the service even better. I had the Fish and Chips while the missus had the Curry Chicken. My dish would be more accurately described as "a fish and some chips". The portions were huge. I didn't even finish. The hotel is a short 2 block walk from Central Station, so trams and trains are easily accessable. It is about a 10 minute walk to Dam Square and about 15 minutes to the Red Light District, China Town and Newmarket. Most of the Tram Lines converge on Dam, so it was certainly a hub of activity. The room was well kept, although service was a little lacking. Through the 5 night stay, the bed sheets were never changed and the rubbish was never completely cleared out - the usual assortment of tissues, newspapers and empty water bottles each took a couple days to be removed from the trash cans. We had an issue with the wireless internet. It doesn't work to well in that area of the hotel (8th floor). The provided pc worked well, but our personal machines were almost useless. We had to sit in a chair by the door of the room to receive a signal. Another downside to the room pc is that it doubles as a TV, so you cannot watch TV and use the pc at the same time. This was not a deal breaker since we were on vacation, but it would have been nice to be able to do both at the same time. The bed was comfortable for the most part, although it was on casters with no locking mechanism. After the second night, we noticed it rolling around, so we wedged it into the opening of the headboard and used a towel under one of the wheels to keep it steady. The lack of a top sheet was confusing. They use a comforter as the top sheet, which combined with the unstable air unit can make sleeping either hot or cold. The air unit works, but is not fine enough to get it into a range to accomodate everyone. It has 5 settings from hot to cold. Since we were out most of the day, this wasn't that big an issue, just something to mention. An issue we did have, which is not really the hotel's fault is mystery knockers. Three nights, we had a knock at the door with no one there. Once, when I answered the door, a member of housekeeping was just down the hall. I know she didn't do it, but when asked, she claimed no ideas - it took about 15 sec to answer the door, so the assumption would be that she saw somebody. Another time, there was a knock with no one there (through the peephole), but a short time later when we opened the door, there was a bottle of water. Just strange. I do want to give props to A'kos. He is with the Front Desk Staff. We leaned on him heavily for 'touristy' questions. He was always pleasant, helpful and went out of his way to make sure all of our questions were answered. On his recommendation, we did a day trip to Brussels and were not disappointed. The Front Desk Staff were fantastic, but A'kos was exceptional. If travel to Amsterdam is in the future, The Doubletree is certainly at the top of the list to stay. If we make it back, short of a boutique hotel, this would be the choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SandAM_10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night weekend away at this hotel. Booked with Booking.com and pleased with value for a hotel of this standard, with breakfast included. Excellent location with easy access from Schipol airport which is a quick 15 min direct train ride to Centraal Station, then 5 min walk from station to hotel. Hotel was spotless, rooms very comfortable and modern and the staff were very well trained and always pleased to help. Staff in Bar Lobby were great too. Plenty of variety for breakfast. Complimentary iMac in room is a bonus. We had a city view room and the soundproofing meant we didn't hear a thing from the trains wich ran immediately next o the hotel. Would highly recommend for a break in Amsterdam. Thank you Doubletree by Hilton Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, cannot fault it!”
Reviews.Author: neeson1987
Reviews.Content: After reading all the excellent reviews before arriving in Amsterdam, I had high expectations of this hotel which were exceeded on every level. The location is literally perfect, a 3 minute walk just left of the Centraal Station and a 5 minute walk to the city centre area and Red Light Distict. Yes you can hear the trains go by due to the close proximatey of the hotel, but this did not bother me. Being in a prime city centre spot, you would expect the general noise of the hustle and bustle of the city and I would prefer the rumble of the trains than nightclub music, drunk louts or car traffic. The hotel itself is impressive, the architecture, the style, it just oozes trendiness. The Sky Lounge on the top is a must. Yes expensive, but for your first night as a little treat it is a must. The cocktails are amazing, the bar snacks delicious, the views amazing and the ambience very stylish. I must commend our barman Pierre for his great service and friendly banter. The rooms themselves were beautiful, very clean and bright with floor to ceiling glazing. One tip, with a clutter-free style they liked to hide everything away, like the kettle and hair dryer. After two days I realised that the hair dryer was hidden in the bottom drawer under the safe inside the wardrobe! The free safe was also an excellent touch. The reception staff were also very friendly, spoke very good English and will go out of their way to help. Arriving at 9.30pm, we were not expecting the famous warm cookie as it was late, so when we did it was very appreciated! If you are into exercise, bring along your trainiing gear as they have a free 24hr gym that my husband used twice. All in all, when I next return to Amsterdam I will no doubt be staying in this hotel. Modern, clean, trendy, great staff and great location... What more do you want!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location close to Amsterdam Central”
Reviews.Author: nomad401
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived in Amsterdam via train and having not made a hotel booking prior decided not to chance one of the 3 star hotels (which are very hit & miss in Amsterdam), and book into the 4 star Doubletree due having stayed in one in NYC and finding it excellant. Check in was very easy as the staff speak fluent English and are very open to tourists, and at 129Euros/night, we stayed for 3 nights, we actually got a better deal than what I had seen advertised online. The room was spacious containing a King bed, desk and chair, round table and armchair, closet, brand new very clean bathroom and a Mac monitor through which you can acess the internet or TV channels included in the room price. We also had free wifi in the room although the signal was quite weak and I could only use it while sitting near the door to the room which was my only disappointment. The housekeeping is also very good and ecen if leaving your room late (we left one day at 1pm) they will still come back and fully clean the room (some hotels I have noticed will not clean after a certain hour or will only do a part clean eg change towels). One of the extras that Doubletree provides which isn't a necessity for me when I travel but a welcome touch are the high standard toiletries which they provide. They quality is cery good the soap doesn't dry out your skin and the shampoo/conditioner is suprisingly useable. The location of this hotel is perfect - 5 minutes from the train and 5 mins from central Amaterdam/red light district. Despite what connotations the name suggests the red light district is actually a very safe and colourful part of Amsterdam with the streets been busy with all types if tourists till the early hours, and lots of quirky shops & eateries not just those focusing on the more controversial things Amsterdam is famous for. Overall I would certainly stay in this hotel again due to the location, friendly staff, good rooms and overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: saraflo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for 4 days at the end of February 2012. We booked with Travelzoo when the hotel was called the Mint. We were a bit concerned when the hotel changed owner not long after it opened but everything was great. From our check in when we received a welcome hot cookie each until we left we have nothing but positive things to report. The staff are friendly, helpful and always smiling. The breakfast was fantastic it sets you up for a day sightseeing and you will not need much at lunch time. The hotel is right beside central station and it only costs 4.50 euros for the train to the airport. We found the hotel very convenient for getting around the city whether walking or using the hop on hop off canal boat (we were able to buy our tickets for this at reception). If you are bothered by train noise ask for a room at the front of the hotel. The hotel was fully booked when we were there but we never felt that the staff were under any pressure at all, everything we asked for we got without any hesitation. Definately would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EssexJoEssex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in February. Itâ€™s a nice, clean hotel. We had a room overlooking the train tracks, and you can hear the noise, but it wasnâ€™t that loud, and didnâ€™t disturb me at night. However, we were on floor 10, so I would imagine that it could be way too loud on the lower floors. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast, and they offer a croissant, and hot drink for EUR 7 which you order from the breakfast card that you hang on the door, and then collect from the downstairs bar. I thought that the iMac in the room was a bit gimmicky. Our one didnâ€™t work when we arrived, and reception came up to fix it straight away (the wires had been pulled out at the back), but then again the next day it was playing up, and you couldnâ€™t turn on the keyboard. I also found the free wi-fi to be sketchy. Sometimes it worked, sometimes it didnâ€™t. Also, no prices for the mini-bar in the room. The hotel is in a great location â€“ just across from Central Station. I would stay here again, but with a city view!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the train station.”
Reviews.Author: Esperanto-uk
Reviews.Content: Busy reception at check-in & check-out but quickly processed. Very handy to the station. Rooms are a bit sparten but very comfortable. A short walk to alot of the sites. Would stay there again, though it is on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JessDan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in Feb for my partners birthday, did request a city view room but it was not provided, did get a free cookie on arrival which was nice! 15 minute walk to Dam square, literally facing Centraal Station, â‚¬4.80 for a single to Schipol Airport on the way back. Sky Lounge was very lovely, floor to cieling windows but is expensive. The nuts are free though so thats a bonus We stayed for 3 nights and our room was cleaned perfectly each time, however no milk was left for tea/coffee in the mornings which isnt great ( esp as we didnt book breakfast ) i called guest services to request some milk around 10am on the second morning....none came....we went out for the day and went out for a meal..woke up the next morning and called again, was assured someone would be straight up with milk- still nothing, at this point we just made do water from the bathroom as it seemed to be too much trouble. This aside- overall a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Railway/Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: Colin_B58
Reviews.Content: All the positives have been covered in the previous report, which I agree with. The major negative which cannot be ignored is the sound proofing at the rear of the hotel. The check in was very busy and none of the rooms were ready for any guests, all the guests were being check in but being asked to come back in an hour or so for room allocation. We had requested a city facing room, on return and although a HH member we were given a room at the rear of the hotel as the hotel was full! We stayed on the 8th floor and the rumble of goods trains was audible through the night, commuter trains then started 06.00. There was construction noise that started one morning at 07.15, a continuous pile driver which continued until we left the hotel after breakfast; point being, not the construction but the fact is the double glazing and sound proofing didnâ€™t do what it is supposed to do. I wonder if the Management or person who wrote â€œsound proofed roomsâ€� on the hotel site has every spent the night in a room at the back of the hotel. I have stayed numerous times at the Mint hotel, Leeds, (same hotel, same rooms etc) the hotel is also situated between a railway station and a canal, however there was never any sound issues when I was in a railway facing room!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory all round”
Reviews.Author: GillnAndy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, professional yet friendly new hotel which we were lucky enough to book at a very reasonable price. Only approx 200 yards from the station so no taxi / tram needed to get you there and about the same into the center of Amsterdam. Rooms were spotless, good quality toiletries and the inclusion of bathrobes and the IMac Tv/Pc a very welcome extra touch. Floor to ceiling windows, queen size bed, no charge for the room safe and no noise from corridors. I would recommend including breakfast, there is a huge selection, all of which is delicious but if you don't take the inclusive option, the charge is a hefty 24.50 Euro! The sky lounge on the top floor is also worth a visit, especially at night when the whole of the city is lit up but beware the cost of a small bottle of beer 4.50Euro and wine 8.50Euro - you do get a generous portion of nibbles with it though. Would definately stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it for a special treat”
Reviews.Author: jocypri
Reviews.Content: I umm'ed and ahh'ed for about 2 weeks whether to pay the price to stay at this hotel, but eventually decided that whilst it was expensive in general, it seemed to be one of the cheapest 4 star hotels in this district of Amsterdam with good reviews. When we came out of Central station late and tired, and the hotel was right there infront of us, any doubts i'd had went out the window. The staff on reception were very friendly, and we got a free cookie each (standard Hilton) and a free upgrade - unexpected but very welcome! We stayed in a Queen Deluxe room on the 3rd floor. The room was massive, with a floor to ceiling window overlooking the water and the city. The bathroom was sleek and modern with a great boiling hot power shower. We couldn't hear any noise from the corridor or other rooms which is always a bonus. We went straight up to the 11th floor Sky Lounge and that was awesome - pretty much 360 views over the city, and actually very affordable (about the same as London prices) with a good selection of local drinks and nice jazz/lounge music. Really a lovely place to sit, relax and chat after your flight or a hard days sightseeing. The buffet breakfast the next morning had a fantastic selection of food - a full selection of fry up hot things, a juice and cereal bar, all sorts of breads, cheeses, meats, pastries, fruit, tea coffee etc. I'd definitely recommend including this on your room price - though there is also a few cheaper room service options also available. Overall i'd say book this hotel for a special occasion or special evening.

Reviews.Title: “Easy train to airport & within walking distance of everything”
Reviews.Author: DebraAtShopLaMuse
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from this hotel - March 5 2012 First the not so good: My husband and I bought a Living Social deal that included 3 nights, a canal tour, a bicycle rental, two welcome drinks and daily breakfast. The two welcome drinks and daily breakfast were not written on the voucher and they were not fulfilled by the hotel. That's somewhere between $80-90 that my husband and I lost on this deal. The Doubletree sold well over 100 of these vouchers and they knew exactly what each person should receive - shame on them for not delivering what was promised. I've already emailed Living Social as well. I know this comment is very specific to me personally ... but should just serve as a reminder for anyone buying vouchers to make sure you get everything that you paid for. Now the good: You just couldn't ask for a better location. Based on the reviews here I asked for a city view/high floor. We were in room 418 so it wasn't exactly high but it did face the city and for us it was just perfect. The room was spacious and clean. The water pressure was great. We only used the Mac for TV watching as we had our iphones and ipad with us - the free wifi is priceless. One nice point of difference from other hotels - you can email something to their printer right in the lobby and it will print for you for free. We had drinks in the Sky Lounge one night and went back the next day to take pictures of the daytime view. The front desk staff were pleasant enough. About 15 minutes after we checked in a woman came by and gave us two free bottles of water - nice touch. The tap water in the hotel was great - no taste at all. We bring our own large water bottle whenever we travel and we just filled it up at the tap in the bathroom. To put everything in context - we weren't in the hotel very much so we didn't use much of the hotel's amenities ... just the lobby bar for coffee and the Sky Lounge for drinks. All in all - the reason you stay at this hotel is for its location. It is a perfect base to see everything in Amsterdam. It's a 5 minute walk from Central Station ... and that's a 15 minute train ride from Schipol Airport (I think it was 4.60 Euros per person one way). We had to leave early Monday morning for our flight and there were trains running every 15 minutes even at 5am. In the context of ease of transportation my husband said this was one of the easiest, stress free trips we've taken. I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent facilities, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shlomi31
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing - few steps from all attractions. The room equipped with iMac - super ! Room is a little bit small - price around 159 euro - breakfast not included - breakfast is outstanding- very good Cleaniness - need some improvement - there were some spots on walls that were not cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1774
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel with some good views. The city bar on the top floor has some great views of the city. The standard of this hotel is very good and what you would expect from Hilton. The service needs work, check in and check out was fairly chaotic despite the warm cookie on arrival! Weekend Breakfast is also chaotic in terms of clearing away both from occupied and unoccupied tables. This seemed to improve on weekdays. The worse part was the cleaning of the rooms, rubbish left outside the room for most of the day and Coffee cups left half full. The lifts are quirky and seem to have a mind of there own! Overall a good hotel would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: missussmithy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the start of January for a birthday surprise for my husband. Firstly, the location is brilliant - about 2 minutes walk along the road from Centraal train station (trains cost under Â£4 for a single ticket from the airport). Our return flight was in the early morning so it was great not to have to arrange transfers. Its location does mean that some of the rooms look onto the railway track. We didn't have any problems with noise although you could request a city view room if needed. The hotel is also a 5 minute walk from the main boarding point for the canal boat tours and it's easy to get around on foot - just think of the main streets as fanning out from the station, with smaller streets interconnecting, and you'll find your way home. Inside, the hotel is modern, clean and minimalist although its a bit of a walk from the lift to the rooms at the far end of the building. The staff are really helpful and had the warm cookies ready on check-in as a Doubletree standard. Rooms have comfortable beds, spotlessly new bathrooms with White Company toiletries (yes please!), but the star of the show is the iMac with free internet access, great not just for watching TV but for double checking live flight info etc. Breakfast was brilliant with a huge buffet selection of hot and cold food including smoked salmon and eggs cooked to order, and delicious coffee. They also had mineral water available alongside the fruit juices, a really small and simple thing but to me, much more convenient than having to request a glass of water from staff. I'd also recommend the Sky Bar on the top floor which had amazing views of the city, especially at dusk to watch the buildings slowly light up. All in all, we found the Doubletree was a perfect place to stay to make the most of a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in February 2012. The hotel is new and situated just next to Amsterdam Central station, which makes the hotel very convenient for business or city trip. Likes - free wi-fi - good bed - big imac in the room - spacious and modern room with all amenities you need Dislikes - noise of the trains (was staying at the back of the hotel, overlooking the rail tracks)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mirja_sekulovic
Reviews.Content: Warm cookies at check in are a nice touch...the reception staff is nice but very inexperienced. None the less, the stay was very nice, no problems with the room, the bathroom very clean and nice. Would definatelly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: niki1l
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam with my partner and my parents in Feb 2012 for a 4 day break. We picked this hotel for location it is just 2 mins walk from Centraal Station. It is great for the canal bus( which gets you to most areas easily,costs about 33 euros per person for a day passs)and Dam square is just 5 mins walk. We arrived at the hotel mid morning the reception staff were lovely as were all the staff we encountered. We were given 2 rooms on the 3rd floor. We nearly died when we opened the door to 315 was so small and dark. We phoned reception and the moved us to another room (524) which was much bigger and brighter. My Mum and Dad had asked to be moved aswell. This is the fist time any of us have asked for a room change. Our room was great modern, clean and had a small window we could open. Only one thing I would get rid of the small green cushions with the stains. I felt sorry for my Mum and Dad the got room 507 if you don't like noise this isn't the room for you it looks onto the Station. They are in their late 60's and got very little sleep because of the trains. We did offer to swap with them. Breakfast was nice enough. Again Staff an asset to the hotel. Didn't have dinner in the hotel so can't coment. In Amsterdam there are too many restaurants and not enough time. The Floating Cinese Restaurant is 1 min walk(Well worth a visit). We probably would not stay in this hotel again unless we knew what room we would be in. My Mum and Dad certainly wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic view and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Byron130
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Trivago website and got a bargain. The location of the hotel is ideal. It's a 3 minute walk from central station (turn left out of the station and the hotel is right there), a short walk into the town centre and a 3 minute walk to catch a taxi, tram, bus or boat - perfect! The staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful and the warm welcome cookie was very much appreciated. The keycard you have to use in the lift to get to the rooms is a bit tricky to get the hang of at first but a clever bit of security once you know what you're doing! Our room was 518 and the floor to ceiling windows led to a fantastic view as soon as we walked through the door so we were extremely happy. The room itself was clean and comfortable, a little smaller than I expected but big enough for myself and my boyfriend. The free internet / TV was a bonus and we used this to look up a few of the sights we were interested in visiting. Something you should be aware of though; I'd read a lot of reviews on trip advisor of people saying they received a free bottle of wine in their room because they were there for theirs or their partner's birthday. Well we too were there for my boyfriend's birthday and although the staff knew this and even commented on it when we checked in the wine in our room was not free. There was a bottle of red with glasses on the side but we were a bit wary as to whether this was free or not so we looked in the fridge and found a bottle of white, lots of mini bottles of spirits, cans of fizzy pop and bottles of water. We wanted to be sure the bottle of red either was or wasn't for us so we rang the help desk and they told us it wasn't a complimentary bottle and it would cost Â£12. That was fair enough (we didn't drink it!) but it does make me wonder if other people may have been charged for thinking the wine in their room was free and have not yet looked at their bank statement!! The Sky Lounge is well worth a visit for the views if nothing else, we didn't eat or drink up there as it was very pricey but if you have the money it looks like a lovely place to dine. All in all the Double Tree is a great little hotel (if you get a room high up with an amazing view like ours at least) and if we got a good deal on price again we would definitely stay here for a second and third time if not more.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: rosmannhp
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a sat lunchtime and the rooms took ages to be ready, and then finally at 18:30 the room we wanted was still not ready, so we opted for a room with twin beds... the view was amazing, the iMac well appreciated. Throughout our stay we had a little fight with the beds as they are on casters and had a habit of moving around a bit... The real beef we had with the hotel was the price of the breakfast, 25 euros pp is taking the p*&%, but there are quite a few outlets nearby so it wasn't a biggie! The location and the views make this hotel. Staff are friendly and very helpful, i think the main problem is the inefficiency created by systems (i.e check-in and housekeeping). the sky-lounge is brilliant for the views, the food is very good although prices a bit steep. Def would stay there if theres a deal on :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: G-Carlin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Centraal Station just before lunchtime and went to leave our bags at hotel. Turn left as you leave the station and the hotel is 5mins away - the reception is at the very far end of the building. The receptionist was helpful and told us that we could have our room early. We booked a twin room and it was on the 7th floor (near the free icemaking machine..nice touch). Room was a good size and very clean as was the shower/toilet. There was no prices listed for the items in the mini bar - and certain things (eg spare toothbrush, mouthwash etc) are chargeable. We were facing the station and could hear the trains but it wasnt a problem - I think if you were on the lower floors that it would be. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we didnt experience any queues at check in or check out, I could imagine it could get rather busy depending on the no. of guests staying. Continental breakfast CANNOT be faulted - but the cooked breakfast was a huge disapointment - I would have been unhappy to pay the 24 euro charge for this - there are loads of eating places just across the road which are a lot less expensive. Note to kitchen manager in the hotel - bain maries are not the way to go for keeping food warm and items kept running out and had to be replenished - which is frustrating when your halfway through filling your plate! The waiting staff at breakfast were fantastic, nice and cheerful. The sky lounge is an expensive experience - brilliant views, cocktails very overpriced. All in all we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel and would give it 8/10 (the breakfast and expensive drinks in the Skylounge let it down slightly). We booked through Travel Republic and flew from Edinburgh using Easyjet - got a great price for this (yet again) through Travel Republic. Would recommend the restaurant Cau if you like argentinian steak houses. Its up near Dam Square - check it out on Trip Advisor. Just watch when you get the bill as they tried to charge us for a larger ribeye than what we ordered - this was quickly sorted out and we even returned the next day for lunch. Stayed for 4 days and had a blast !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: portygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally situated for access to tourist sights, although a fairly long walk to the museum district. The room was modern and spacious for European city standards with remarkable views across the city. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. The staff made this hotel extra special with everyone being so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmanuel75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located just beside the train station. At check in we were offered an upgrade to a club room with balcony and city view at a discount as requested. We were able to check in early (10:30am). The room was small but very well designed and had everything we needed: haidryer (in drawer in room cupboard), safe, minibar, Mac computer/TV, kettle, wireless internet, comfy bed. The room was very quiet and we had a very good sleep. We had a few glasses of wine in the evening at the Sky Lounge bar. Itâ€™s a shame the drinks are so expensive otherwise it would be great. The service is friendly though and on the second evening my partner was given a glass of wine for free. We also had dinner one evening at the City Cafe as it was pouring rain. The service was a bit slow but as my partnerâ€™s glass of wine took a while to come the waiter took it off the bill which we really appreciated. We had delicious burgers and desserts. The price was reasonable for Amsterdam. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definitely stay there again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed large business hotel by station”
Reviews.Author: TimfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi, comfortable rooms with Mac computers and being next to the station made this a very convenient and pleasant hotel for a business trip, although it's not a district full of Amsterdam charm. Staff were friendly and efficient. The bar on the roof was pretty cool. Only downside, one thin duvet in middle of winter and no extra bedding in the chilly room didn't help when the heating was hard to figure out. My windows were also absolutely filthy, but then there wasn't much of a view.

Reviews.Title: “Four day young group trip to the 'Dam”
Reviews.Author: SarahBailey99
Reviews.Content: As a group of 11 couples and friends, we booked this trip nearly a year in advance via a travel deal company. This hotel had an excellent location next to Central Station which meant we could travel from the airport to the station within 20-25mins. We arrived a little early to check in, however, one room was available which meant we could pile or cases in to the room and freshen up. We ventured out for a short visit if the city (excellent location if you dont mind walking around for most of the trip like we did. If not then there are trams next to central station which can be used instead). When we returned, we were meant to have all our rooms on one floor however, this wasnt possible unless we wanted to wait a little longer, instead we opted for another floor. The rooms were clean and tidy, modern, with Mac compture/TV screen which proved handy and it was possible to contect the iPhone or iPod to play music through it. The showers were lovely and modern too. The Sky Lounge had some beautiful views over the city and was a nice meeting point for us in the evenings to grab a drink before heading in to town for a bite to eat. The prices of the drinks were usual slightly overpriced hotel prices but hey-if your on a short break one an evening won't break the bank! On arrival at the hotel we all recieved a complementary warm chocolate cookie which as delicious! On leaving the hotel, we were able to store all our luggage in a safe room with the staff and could access if needed. Check out was swift and easy as checking in. Just to note-my friend looked on trip advisor about the hotel before going and saw negative comments about the hotel being next to the train line for the Central Station. They had a room on that side of the hotel and claimed to have not noticed the trains passing and was perfectly fine for them. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Stylish, modern, helpful staff and lovely rooms and location made it ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an overpriced limited selection of food in City Cafe.”
Reviews.Author: Sharonkp66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the rooms bright and fresh. The railway wasnt too bad if you are given a rear room. The biggest disappointment was the poor service and selection of food in the City Cafe. We had the 2 course selection priced at â‚¬28 euros which was nothing special and the portion sizes were minute. The menu selection was not good and the meals were very poor value for money and not very tasty. We waited 5 minutes to be served as the waiter appeared to be flirting with a young pretty guest oblivious to us standing in front of him. We were then shown to a table for 2 in front of a pillar despite a restaurant 90% empty and waited again too long to be served. Great hotel but wouldn't recommend the restaurant , a much better selection within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: A great hotel a few hundred yards from the Centraal Rail Station and handy for the Old Town. Hotel prides itself on a warm welcome and good service. It succeeds at every opportunity. Room is of good standard, as new and with all the essential items available including free WiFi. Didn't bother with breakfast as there's such a choice of coffee shops all over Amsterdam. Did have 3 excellent dinners at the hotel where food is very good although portions are modest in size - well I for one would always take quality food and presentation over quantity. Would be more than happy to stay here again if I happen to pop back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: DeanMadge
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that has recently rebranded from a mint hotel to a doubletree by Hilton. I'm writing this review from my mac computer in the hotel room overlooking Amsterdam and the canals with the floor to ceiling windows in my room. Arrival at the hotel was good and we were checked in early and both given a huge warm chocolate cookie with was so nice we brought a tin before leaving. The rooms are great and the only down side is the bed was a little low and I felt the bedding could have been of better quality. Really powerful shower with White Company products, bath robes, iron board, Mac computer etc meant you had everything in the room you needed and more. We didn't use the restaurant other than for a takeaway coffee as we felt the menu was a little limited and not really that appealing. i would have no problem recommending this hotel as its in a great location (2 mins walk from the train station) good quality and really nice to come back to. If visiting Amsterdam I would recommend the Supperclub for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: DuffymoonWarrington
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights ,5 min stroll from station.Arrived at 10.30 and told our room was already for us,reception very polite and efficient booked in within 5mins with a lovely warm chocolate cookie each to take to our room.Stayed in club balcony room on 10th floor with city view the room was beautiful large queen bed with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space, apple tv and free internet,mini bar,ice bucket,kettle,iron and board,hairdryer,free safe.Large bathroom with separate shower and very deep bath,robe and slippers supplied .Balcony had table and chairs and a large glass safety rail with great views over canals and the city.The room was cleaned everyday and tea and coffee etc topped up.The hotel had a number of bars and restaurants and a skylounge bar which all looked very nice but we never tried them also there is a free gym.Cannot fault this hotel and its staff and would recommend it to anyone,this was our fifth vist to amsterdam and our first time staying at the Doubletree and it wont be our last.The only thing i would say that needs looking at is the photos of the balcony rooms as the ones on the website do not do them any justice at all

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lisaovestoholiday
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights easy 5min walk from station, we booked our stay via a hotel website 4 weeks in advance of travelling we got a good price, on arriving at the arrivals time stated of 3pm we only had one room reserved instead of the two that I had confirmation for. At time of booking I requested city views but this was never advised to the hotel and as they had let everyone book in early that day had no city view rooms left so we ended up on an inside room in middle of hotel with no outlook. There were no cookies left either !!! The room was spotless and bed was comfy shower was great and plenty hot water, I mac in room was good. None of the music channels on tv worked though. Air conditioning did not work room was roasting. Breakfast was 25 euro per head per day, on first morning all hot food was cold, on second morning dining room was busy but we had an hour to eat but no food to be had at all except cereal tried on 3 occasions to check if food had been refilled but it had not been and the other 30 to 40 other people all wandering about were doing the same thing.so we gave up and left, 3rd morning we did not attempt breakfast . Sky bar was lovely with good views

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: roosterza
Reviews.Content: We arrived too early to get into our room, but the staff were very accommodating and processed our booking and allowed us to leave our luggage in safe storage. As the hotel is so well located, we could go explore for a few hours around central Amsterdam, before getting our room key. The other benefit of it's location is that you can get there easily by train from the airport, as the hotel is right next to the station. Our room was spotless, with a great view of Amsterdam, a comfortable bed and a well-appointed bathroom. The Sky Lounge on the 11th floor is a fantastic place for sundowners or nightcaps, with wonderful views of Amsterdam. The hotel was quiet and we had a lovely stay ... the only reason I have given it a 4, rather than a 5, is that our air conditioning didn't work, and we had to ask twice for it to be repaired.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST CHOICE, THE BEST STAY”
