Reviews.Author: Marina G
Reviews.Content: - At our arrival, they gave us warm cookies which was really nice. - Very friendly stuff; they had special ones to explain guests all the routes, things to visit and good recomendations of restaurants and other services; everything according to our likes (specially Salvador). - Breakfast so so so so so good; if you find it included in your deal it's really amazing, otherwise, it would be a little bit expensive. Nice amount of juices, breads, sausages, eggs, potatoes, bacon, little crÃªpes, mushrooms, yogurths, croissants, salmon, little chocolate things typical from the Netherlands; between so many others. - The bedroom was very clean, comfortable, well-decorated and full provided of anything you may need ranging from Listerine and little teeth-brushes to tea machine, sweets, iron and many amenities. BUT, THE ONLY FACT I DIDN'T LIKE: they have no hairdryer, which is really unbelievable in a 4* hotel; and maybe, the bed wasn't big enough even though it was really comfortable (with two different kind of pillows). - It was a perfect detail to give guests free wifi for the iMacs in everybedroom and the good disposition for everything (for example: printing. We needed to print something fastly and in 2 seconds a staff brought it to our bedroom). - THE BEST FACT: the situation. It is something wonderful to go out from Central Train Station after a long and tired travel and have the hotel in less than 5 minutes by walk on your left. The Old Amsterdam streets and Red Light district is just on the other side of the bridge (3 minutes) and you have lots of restaurants, coffes, fast-food places and so on. - We still can't believe how lucky we were as we found an unbelievably offer which gave us breakfast and bed for 85 euros with Logitravel; this means, if you find a good offer it will be perfect if not, I hardly recommend to pay for the Doubletree by Hilton becouse it has all you are searching for when it comes to travel. FROM 1 TO 10, I WOULD GIVE THIS HOTEL AND HOW WONDERFUL IT MADE OUR STAY A 11!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sandra Marshall
Reviews.Content: Lovely comfortable hotel, friendly staff. good quality beds and bed linen towels etc. The only downside is the noise from the trains, however I think if you had a forward facing room you may not have this. My shower door did not close, I reported this to reception who said they would send someone up, after 25 minutes no one had arrived so I had to have a quick wash and leave as I had arrangements to go out.. I was surprised when the following morning I found it had not been fixed. I telephoned reception again and told them I was very disappointed, they sent someone immediately who was able to fix it, he could not apologize enough. Later that day they sent up some water and fruit as a an apology. The bar at the top of this hotel offers great views of the city. We ate in the restaurant one night the food was okay but not a great deal of choice and portions quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: BernaManila
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel right beside Amsterdam Centraal Station, no need to drag your suitcase a long way if traveling in and out by train. if you want peace and quiet in the night this is the place for you. Room is clean and bright! The staff are friendly and willing to help. Of course...love the warm choc chip cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Getting to know Sherry”
Reviews.Author: passiveagressive
Reviews.Content: We found the Doubletree to be a very nice, modern hotel and a great place to stay while burning off the jetlag for a couple of days.Although we were hoping for some immediate European charm which can only be had at old established properties this hotel welcomed us to Europe in such a way as to spoil us (almost)for the rest of the trip.The rooms were brand new with a Mac computer and free internet.The bed was great and we had an awesome view of the city over the water.When we arrived we were offered two huge freshly baked chocolate chip cookies which was strange but welcome.Sherry hit the sheets right away and I went to check out the sights in my overly ambitious way and stumbled upon the red light district immediately as it is just a hop skip and a jump away.That was an eye opener!!I scurried back to our room and lo and behold my precious was sound asleep in bed.We ventured out and everything was close at hand to see ,so a very convenient location indeed.The breakfast buffet was a huge surprise as it was probably the best one we indulged in on our three week tour.We would recommend this clean well appointed hotel to anyone wanting a modern oasis in a great fun city!!

Reviews.Title: “Trains!”
Reviews.Author: chrish1919
Reviews.Content: Good facilities, nice room, friendly staff - loved the sky bar. Shame about the noise from the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, topped off fabulous weekend!”
Reviews.Author: hellsbellsWatford
Reviews.Content: We can not fault the hotel, from the moment we arrived and was upgraded to a balcony room as it was my husband's 40th, it only got better. We had the most beautiful view over Amsterdam, good room service and guest service - as we couldn't operate the Imac computer/TV! The room was immaculate and comfortable, although a little small and no sign of the dressing gowns as mentioned in the hotel details. However, very comfortable, with lots of lovely touches and relaxing. The Sky lounge was also a good place to chat while looking over Amsterdam. The breakfast, although it got a little crowded, had a good selection of food. The staff throughout the stay in all areas where friendly and pleasent and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel looked like something out the Jetsons! but refurbished in a modern and comptempoary style. The hotel was well located from both the station and the centre of town and made it an ideal choice. We would very happily stay there again! Thank you Hilton for helping to make a memorable and fabulous holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and recent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: X-O75
Reviews.Content: This hotel right by the station is quiet and very nice. The building and rooms have been renovated recently so it provides a nice and contemporary atmosphere. We had a corner view room facing canal and the city, very nice. Size of the room (junior suite) was nice with a sofa part. Furnitures are pretty nice and new so fair enough! Bed was quite small (queen size only). The hotel is just outside city center so very easily reachable just walking. Very good price/quality level!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Fola O
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Doubletree by Hilton (formerly The Mint Hotel) Amsterdam with my family of 2 adults, a 15 year old and a 10 year old. The hotel is quite central and new and only 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station. It is also walking distance of many of the sights such as Madame Tussaud, the outside shopping areas, the indoor shopping plaza, red light district (we gave that a miss though), numerous affordable restaurants, the Canal cruise etc. The staff were very attentive. The rooms were quite nice if a bit on the small side. The Sky lounge has a beautiful view of the city in the evening. The beds are quite comfortable and there was free internet (MacPC/TV), which the children enjoyed tremendously. A few negatives - The hotel backs onto the multi Centraal Station railway tracks (14), so at all hours of the day and night you had trains arriving and departing. It took some getting used to. The hotel food was expensive. On checkout leave your room 30 minutes early as the queues get very very long. I must say though that I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place from which to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nick w
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a wonderful weekend break in Amsterdam staying in the Doubletree by Hilton Centraal Station hotel. From the moment of our arrival when we were greeted with hot cookies to the time of our swift and hassle-free departure we had a wonderful stay. We were on the 7th floor with a room facing out towards old Amsterdam. The room was immaculate and as shown on the website pictures. Having access to a free and fast internet service courtesy of the iMAC was great and it also doubles as your TV. There were complimentary teas (including peppermint which is a rarity) and coffee in the the room together with a hair dryer, ironing board and iron and a well stocked mini-bar. There were even spare adaptors if needed. The room was air conditioned but my only minor gripe was that the room could get quite warm (this was february) even with the air con on. However, you could open a small window which helped bring the temperature down. The breakfast was great with a huge selection of hot and cold foods to choose from at the self-service bar. Room service was quick and courteous and you are liteerally just 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station. The hotel also had additional desk staff on at departure to avoid any delays. Tip: when walking to the hotel from the station keep the hotels downstairs cafe and restaurant to your left and walk past to locate the hotel entrance (it feels a little like you may have missed the entrance but you haven't - just a few metres more). All in all, a great stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: edthered7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for the football at Ajax hotel is in a great location for the train station and the Metro which you can take direct to the stadium, hotel even sells metro tickets. room was great, Apple tv is fantastic and the bed is the most comfortable i have ever had whilst staying away. staff all very helpful, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel In A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in January in a Club Room with balcony. The hotel is handy for Central Station where you can get a tram, red light district is about 10 mins walk and 5 mins to Nieuwmarket. Our room had a city view and we were on a high floor with excellent views. Our balcony was much bigger than we expected and it would defintely worth it in the Summer months. One thing though was that the room next door had a table and chairs on the balcony but we didnt have anything so we couldnt sit out. The room itself was quite small, it was fine for one night. The bathroom was really nice, a good size and soft fluffy towels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Tourist_Dub
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend break and was very impressed. The hotel is lovely, very stylish with fantastic views (we had a room on the 7th floor). The location is ideal - only minutes from town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next to central station”
Reviews.Author: carole62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night break in feb 12, great hotel staff very friendly and willing to do anything for you. room comfortable not massive but ok apple imac computer/tv very handy. The best part of the hotel is the skylounge on the top floor amazing views of the city and area, drinks pricey but you do get some lovely nibbles and the view is worth it alone. Being so close to central station means you can be in your hotel within about 30 mins of landing at the airport and it only costs 3.80 euros each, taxi is about 50 euro. Great area for getting round amsterdam. We where on a room only basis and the breakfast price is horrendous at 24 euros each which would make it nearly Â£130 for breakfast for the 2 off us for 3 mornings, so we gave that a miss, plenty of cafes and restaurants accross the road.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault - Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stopped here for 3 nights over valentines and absolutely loved it. We contacted the hotel before arriving and asked if we could have a city facing room which we got without a problem. The room we got given was huge and faced out onto the city with a lovely view. We arrived late so they had ran out of cookies but we were given vouchers to collect them the next day and they were worth the wait. If booking I strongly advise to get the breakfast included in your stay as it was unbelievable. Never have I experienced such a choice of items, they had everything from fry ups items to fruit, cereal to toast and a selection of cold meats an cheeses. The pancakes and french toast with maple syrup were our favourite. The hotel also has a sky lounge on the top floor which is a very smart bar with excellent service as with the rest of the hotel and the view is amazing. it is definitely worth a look up to check out the view and have a quick cocktail. If you are looking for a cheaper drink however there are 2 bars downstairs which are slightly more competitively priced. Overall we found the stay excellent and would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent service and location perfect”
Reviews.Author: Andy j
Reviews.Content: I am not going to go waffle on, this hotel is an example of what you would expect from the Hilton. The staff were excellent the location was perfect and my room was superb, even complete with an imac 21.5 The roof top bar had an amazing view and although a little pricey (again what you would expect from the Hilton) it was worth it to sit and have a beer with that scenery!!!! Overall a great place to stay and explore Amsterdam from with easy access to the transport system and a warm friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCat87
Reviews.Content: Located right beside central station, it is so handy for transport to and from the airport and also for exploring the city. Staff were very friendly and we got delicious free cookies on arrival. The room itself was an ample size and clean. Each room has a window from floor to ceiling. Our room faced the railway tracks but this didn't bother us. The bed was comfy too! The sky bar is something else, the best location for a drink in amsterdam, it is pricey but worth it! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: Mem0le83
Reviews.Content: We had to leave on the 4th of February, but because of the snow the flight company delete our flight. In the following days we didn't have electricity, water and telephone lines. We contacted directly the hotel. The hotel didn't want to know any reason and they debited us half of the total. It's a very bad hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!! We no longer make reservations at a hotel Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mskatie1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for New Year 2012. We paid premium rates for 2 of those nights, you get that anywhere for New Year, but given the spectacular views we had from a secluded & romantic little balcony on the 9th floor, of the most awesome fireworks I had ever seen, it was worth every cent. The normal room rate is exceptional value for the quality of this hotel. 100 metres from the station... just a tip, don't go out of the station area. Turn left at the station exit & walk along the pathway. It's so close. The food & drinks at the hotel are good & well priced, but just across the road is everything you want in the way of food & drink & canal cruises etc. It's away from the busy streets of Dam, but a short walk to anywhere you want to go. You choose when you want to be part of the hussle & bussle, & when you want to retreat from it. Views are fantastic, even if it's not a 24 hour fireworks display. This was my 2nd trip to Dam, one of many for my French boyfriend, & both of us will stick to this hotel for future visits. I really couldn't fault this hotel. Has everything you want & very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tx_Traveling_Lite
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during a short visit to Amsterdam. The hotel location is excellent - just a few minute walk from the train station. The hotel has poor signage, and it was confusing to find the entrance. Our room was very large and nice, although cool. When we reported the problem, they quickly brought us a portable heater that solved the problem. The view from our room looking out over Amsterdam was great. Overall the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was freindly and helpful. The breadfast buffet was sensational.

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree Amsterdam is Fab”
Reviews.Author: kimkirby9
Reviews.Content: We still here (Room 725) but I couldn't wait to get home to review it. Hotel RIGHT BESIDE CENTRAAL STATION - We arrived early - booked in not a problem, asked for a river view high floor room - again not a problem. Every member of staff we encounter are extremely pleasant, helpful and nice. Room is fabulous, just like the view, fallen asleep like a baby, bed extremely comfortable, room great size, having this IMac in our room is a godsend keeping me and my daughter connected to home while we away. Sky lounge bar is a must - view is spectacular especially at night. I could go on and on and on but I wont - just know if you are coming here you are in for a treat - having seen some "hotels" in Amsterdam we feel like A Listers here. And as for the welcome cookie I couldn't get to taste mine as my 13 year old daughter ate the both of them. SERMON OVER

Reviews.Title: “Yummy cookies!”
Reviews.Author: Bugsyboodle
Reviews.Content: Booked through an agent and at the time of booking this was the Mint Hotel, before arrival we were informed this had changed to Doubletree at Hilton - result for me as I had Hilton Honours card. We stayed for 3 nights in January 2012. We arrived before midday as we had caught an early flight but it was not a problem checking us in and the warm cookie was very welcomed! We had been given a city view as per my earlier request. An hour or two after check in we got a courtesy call to check everything was ok with check in and the room, this was a nice touch. The room was not big, not small but well appointed and neat and tidy. The beds were very comfortable, we spent a lot of time sleeping in them so I can vouch for that! The bathroom had a shower only, fine for us and had White Company toiletries. We had no conditioner so I just asked the maid and she gave me one no problem, really helpful when you travel hand luggage only and are restricted on liquids. Each room has an iMac which was very handy for Internet and plugging in my iPod. I used the free Wi-Fi no problems from my phone, this was very handy. Breakfast consisted of continental and hot selection. Sometimes they were a little slow at filling up the bread etc and you had to ask them to do it but the choice was good and the food tasty. We didn't drink in the bar or eat dinner so cant comment on the food although the menu was displayed and the food and drink looked a little pricey. The restaurant was always pretty empty so maybe reducing the prices may bring in more clientele. Location was perfect, a couple of mins walk from the station and pretty close to everything else Amsterdam had to offer. We walked everywhere from the hotel - just look out for cyclists as they clearly have the right of way and dont they know it! Would defintely stay at this hotel again so long as we get a decent package deal like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic City.”
Reviews.Author: gazzaman69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just today returned from Amsterdam following 3 nights in the Doublletree Hilton Hotel, to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. Our initial greeting was superbly professional. An immaculately groomed young man asked if he could help at all as all the reception staff were busy. When I advised him we had a reservation, he apologised that we may have to wait whilst other guests were being checked in or were checking out. We were duly seen by a young lady (who spoke excellent English) within a minute! The process was very informative, professional, courteous and personal. It made my wife and I feel like special guests. The free giant chocolate chip cookie on check in was also a nice touch and first impression. Every single member of staff was friendly, polite, extremely smart and couldn't help enough. We had breakfast every morning in the Hotel's City Cafe which was delicious and set us up perfectly for the rest of each day. The variety of cooked food, cereals, juices, fruit, breads and tea and coffee was outstanding. We had already pre-booked and paid for breakfast and although this may be cosidered expensive at the rate of 24 euros if you haven't paid and then subsequently wish to do so, you can literally have as much as you like of whatever you like! We had a superb Anniversary Dinner in the City Cafe restaurant on Tuesday evening which was not only reasonably priced but was of first class, excellent quality. Both the food and service(thank you Martiin) were exceptional. We were looked after very well. Our room was fantastic. Modern, spotlessly clean, warm, welcoming and with the imac computer and TV combination we were immensely impressed. The maid service each day was excellent and we had a call each day from a lady who came to ensure that the room service had been to our satisfaction. It had! Our room was on the 6th floor and although centrally facing (towards the inner court of the unusual hotel's shape) this did not detract one iota from our satisfaction. The Sky Lounge bar was a little expensive but this was more than compensated for by the beautiful views on a night overlooking the City, canals and surrounding buildings. The hotel is located just a 3 minute walk from the Central Rail station. The train ride from Schiphol Airport to Centraal Station could not be easier. At a cost of 4.3 euros each for a single journey ticket it was both inexpensive and took less than 15 minutes. Saves on pretty high Taxi fares so you can enjoy that superb breakfast after all! From check in to check out, our stay at the Hotel was one of (if not the very best) accommodation experiences in many years together and travelling to many Cities. If we do return to Amsterdam, we will definitely book the Doubletree again. Thank you all for a memorable stay in a beautiful City.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Telboy83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from the 3rd to the 6th of feb for my girlfriends birthday.Frank from reception was great and he gave us a free upgrade to a suite (thanks Frank) the rooms were lovely and spacious, beds are cosy!!! iMacs in both rooms free Internet coffee machines!!! Too much!!! The skybar has beautiful scenery! Also book b+b breakfast before hand cause you'll be paying 25 euros each, each day! Well that's all thanks doubletree for a great stay and Frank for the service. Terence & Jennifer room 406

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Hard to pay?”
Reviews.Author: baits28
Reviews.Content: The Mint is a great hotel! Ask for a city facing view though! We were lucky enough to be given a third floor (which has a smoking terrace and amazing views of the city!) The iMac was a very nice touch too! The let down for me was a lot of hassle over trying to pay with a UK Visa chip and pin debit card. Basically the mint declined my payment several times before I had to suggest to the receptionist to try using the chip and pin hand set (sigh). On the day of arrival I did not want to be harassed by reception repeatedly just because THEY cannot take a card payment correctly... Otherwise great stay, Room service is a total rip off, so no matter how tired you are... just walk to one of the many near by restaurant's. Sky Lounge good for snack's and a quick drink (pricey but worth it for outside roof terrace). All in All a great comfortable place to stay, clean and very central.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect located in the city center”
Reviews.Author: drozer
Reviews.Content: Slept here 2 nights for a business trip. The hotelis new, clean and the rooms are great. The sky lounge is one of the best places to be in the evening. Reminds you of the old club 11 that was more or less on the same location. Some small remarks. When the bar closed staff continued to serve drinks for unreasonable amounts of tip. Rather greedy behaviour. And next to that trains are pretty close. You'll hear them at night. When you pick a room take the city side. Next to that do not sleep on floor 10. Nevertheless, fabulous place!

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL LOCATION FOR VISITING THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: iainwhg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights(27th-29th Jan) and could not have wished for a better location to visit the beautiful city of Amsterdam. The hotel is ideally placed for those arriving by train taking only a couple of minutes to walk to it. Staff at the reception were very good and made us feel welcome. We had a couple of housekeeping issues regarding our room(item left in the room by a previous resident and no room service menu) both of which were addressed by reception staff to our satisfaction. I cannot fault the hotel and as stated by other reviewers the view from the Sky Lounge is great. I will certainly use the hotel again and look forward to returning to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ipcollins
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Hilton Hotels around the world (Gold member) and I can honestly say this is the best Hilton I have stayed at. It is very easy to find from Centraal Station (about 5 minutes walk) and provides a great place to explore Amsterdam from, with most main tourist destinations within walking distance or easy to jump on the trains at Centraal. The hotel is very modern and I loved the iMacs in the room. I stayed in a suite overlooking the city and the view was fantastic, but it had nothing on the view from the Skylounge. It was extremely cold when I was there so I didn't stay outside long, but long enough to enjoy the majestic views over the city. We had some drinks in the Skylounge and then dined downstairs in the restaurant. The food was great and reasonable priced. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating and even gave me a warm cookie on arrival - nice touch. This is definitely my hotel of choice in Amsterdam now.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel in Amsterdam. We arrived 11am on a Friday, worried that we would have to wait for check in at 3pm but were welcomed very warmly, given our room immediately and even handed two warm (and incredible!) cookies as a welcome gift! Small touches like the apples and orange juice available at Reception, London Tea Company teabags in each room and free WiFi made our stay here one of the most pleasurable we'd had. Its central location, wonderful views and luxury accommodation meant it was perfect for our romantic weekend break. (But we wish we'd have known that we could rent bikes directly from the hotel before we checked out!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: KandJ080212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in mid Jan 2012 and I cannot fault them at-all. The staff bent over backwards, couldnt do enough to help, the rooms were beautifull. From reading other reviews on this site, we had been advised to ask for a city view room, which we did, but unfortunatley they didnt have any available, so we ended up overlooking the train tracks, which do be honest, didnt bother us at-all, we could hear the trains in the background but they certainly didnt bother us or interupt our sleep. Whilst at the hotel, a visit to the "SkyLounge" on the 11th floor is a must, we had to drag ourselves out of there to visit the city, as everyone in our group was more than happy to stay in there all night, the staff, service, food, drinks, atmosphere, where all out of this world, & thats not to mention the view!! stunning, absolutely stunning!!!! One thing to note, I like a bit of fresh air in the room while im sleeping and we thought the window didnt open because of the height we where at (7th Floor), but we noticed on the last day, that behind the curtains, at the side of the window, there is a small metal door / window thing that does open, it only opens about 3-4" but is more than enough to get some air through the room, pity I hadnt noticed it earlier. Overall an excellent stay, great VFM and I definatley would return.

Reviews.Title: “great location for 2 days”
Reviews.Author: mpinkas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 days. Hotel is very clean and staff is very helpful, except for the female bartender in the evening- she was a little rude. The hotel is next to Centraal Station, which is a very easy ride from the airport. It's the other side of a canal from downtown/ old city amsterdam, so it was very quiet at night, but just a 5 minute walk into the heart of old town. Since we were only there for 2 nights, everything we wanted to see was withing walking distance (at most 20 minutes). I would definitely stay there again on a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rafiki103
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Doubletree over the weekend with my wife. We had requested a City view room, on the basis of a number of reviews on TA however - the request was ignored by the front desk - and when I asked specifically, I was simply told there was no availabilty...it was quite a cold, rude welcome from the front desk lady, however, luckily, she was the only bad egg in the basket! We were able to check in quite a few hours early, treated to signature cookies (nice touch) and shown to our room. The room was on the noisy side - non city view, which is a big shame - the trains run all night and they really do make a fair bit of noise, apart from that, the room is great - comfy bed, great shower, all the amenites, iMac computer/tv - small screen, but great for checking out places online etc. Free wifi - throughout the hotel - clean room, small but nice bathroom. I can only imagine the view being fantastic on the other side - you really do need to be lucky! The Sky Lounge bar is stunning - amazing views, very nice modern minimalist decor, there's an outdoor terrace - which would be great in the summer... prices are high though! expect to pay â‚¬16 for a cocktail and â‚¬7 for a coffee. The breakfast was included in the rate and was really good - a great spread - better than most european hotels - with hot and cold breakfast items, good service and friendly staff. All in all - it was fantastic - I think if I'd have got the city view and there was no noise, it would be 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lou0082
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam with my partner for a midweek break. Stayed at Doubletree from Jan 22nd to 25th. We were given beautiful warm cookies at check in, which I thought was a lovely touch. I requested a room with a city view and was not disappointed. The room was lovely, well decorated and clean and the bed was really comfortable. The sky lounge is a great spot for a nightcap. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful and recommended some wonderful tours, attractions and restaurants. I would definitely recommend Doubletree for a couples break!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: TKHAL33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions, once for business, and once for vacation. On Both stays the staff was very helpful and friendly. I was upgraded with no hesitation to a suite because of my Hilton loyalty status. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The Hotel is very open, and has lots of natural light. The views on the city side are amazing. The Sky lounge is a very trendy bar where many locals come to have a drink. Overall the service is by far the best that I've had at any Hilton Brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to discover amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kevola74
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. few minutes walk. yet not in the center where there is noise. perfect views of the canal and St nicholas church and Amrath hotel. the rooms are very modern, with all you need to make a comfortable stay. The WIFI is great for business travels. There is an iMac in each room which also serves as a TV. walking distance to discover amsterdam . Great and friendly hotel staff. Highly recommended. Hotel stay price was very good, but i found the mini bar, its restaurants a bit expensive for the portion they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but close to railway to noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Samso_DH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in January on a B&B basis. Location - very close to train station, popular canals, streets and shopping area. Hotel - Clean, comfortable but would recommend a room facing away from the train lines as they are very noisy from 7am every day. Good selection at breakfast buffet and option of late check out available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short trip to the doubletree for my husbands 30th birthday, what a lovely hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and rooms were modern and clean, also plenty of choice at breakfast time. We visited the sky lounge on the 11th floor, it had a nice chilled atmosphere but we only had one drink there as it was VERY expensive!! All in all great hotel in great location, would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: holidaypal36
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to Amsterdam and we would most definitely come back. We had previously booked to stay at Mint Hotel but it was subsequently taken over by Hilton. From our friendly arrival greeting and cookies from Maurice to the room cleanliness and attention to detail from staff it has been a pleasure. Although hotel may not look inviting from outside the interior is very warm and welcoming. Location is excelllent as all amenities and attractions are within walking distance as well as Centraal station which is very handy for transport to and from airport. We would without doubt recommend this hotel and will look forward to staying again if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erica T
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay at this hotel and couldn't fault it.The deal included flight from Bristol, three nights stay at this hotel and a canal boat tour, all for Â£189. Booked through Qwerty travel. Excellelant deal all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaroLille_France
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Doubletree Amsterdam. We enjoyed a drink at the beautiful Sky lounge Bar. The brand new building is very nice and the view from our room was amazing. The hotel is perfectly situated close to the city center and the train station. Nevertheless, when we order food at the room service, the waiter made a mistake in our room number and we waited 45 minutes before calling back and finally get our order.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you wake up hungry!!”
Reviews.Author: trevorjmahoney
Reviews.Content: We had a living social deal for the DoubleTree (formally the Mint). The deal included three nights, breakfast, a canal boat tour and 24hr bike rental. This was unbelievable value at â‚¬230 total. This made it approximately â‚¬30 B&B / person. Speaking of B for breakfast, it says continental, but this is far from it. Breakfast at the DoubleTree is an overload of deliciousness. There is hot and cold food. I'd suggest that this is more like a brunch. WRT the rest of the hotel: the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean as well as equipped with iMacs and the location was good being close to central station. It was a few min walk across to some of the canals or down to the popular Leidseplein area but if you don't mind the walk it's a great spot. They have the SkyLounge which, as far as I have been told, is even popular with the locals. We regrettably only went for a look before leaving. the view was fantastic. One caveat might be that our deal was so good it skews our experience on the positive side. At full price, unsure exactly, all the DoubleTree goodness we experienced might be expected or overvalued.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Modern, Clean and Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: charx1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Fiance stayed here on the 31st Dec for 3 Nights. We were delighted from the very start with the location of the hotel , only 2 minutes walk from centraal station. If you take the city centre train from the airport it takes about 15/20 minutes to get to centraal station, when you leave the station you turn left and walk straight up the road for 2/3 Minutes and you will see the hotel on the corner in front of you. The hotel is huge and you could not miss it. On entering the hotel we were checked in within 5Minutes, the reception staff were very friendly. The room was lovely, not very big but OK for a short stay/romantic break. The room was spotless clean including the bath room. There was a well stocked mini bar also ( very expensive) but comes in handy.The bed was very comfortable. There was an apple computer in the room and there was also free wifi which we really made use of, listening to music etc. Our view was over looking the river which was nice. We had great nights sleep on the 3 nights and had no problems with any noise. The Location was another brilliant aspect of staying at this hotel. When you leave the hotel you cross over the river and the centre is right in front of you, this is where you find all the shops/ bars/ restaurants and coffee shops. The red light district is only about a 5 minute walk away and you can also find lots of bars and coffee shops here also. No need at all to get any taxis when you stay at this hotel. The Anne Frank musuem is about 15min walk from the hotel also. I reccomend a visit to the Heineken Ice Bar where you can go the 'Ice Experience' which includes a 3D show and free beer/cocktails. The Hotel Restaurant didnt have a very wide choice of variety and it was very expensive but there is also a bar where most people ate and they have a good selection of foods and its not too expensive. The hotel bar is not very lively but its perfect for food and a few drinks but if you want a good night out I would reccomend the Red Light Distrct or the centre. Overall we really enjoyed our visit to Amsterdam and the hotel really contributed to this. Its a bit more expensive than the rest of the hotels in Amsterdam but well worth it as you get what you pay for. A lot of the Hotels in Amsterdam are more like B&B'S or hostels but the Doubetree truly is a luxury Hotel. I would defintitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: EnglandNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly. Very very clean and prestine. It is smaller than ant room we've stayed in before, but adequate. Lovely i-mac in room. Only a shower which kept filling up in the bottom. Lounge on top of building to see over Amsterdam. Didn't like the breakfast for 24 Euros-not a lot there when we ent for breakfast, wasn't topped up. We didnt have cookie on arrival as weren't any, but we did on departure-nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Unreal hotel, made our trip to amsterdam more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: sparmac
Reviews.Content: This is a top class hotel, staff, food and rooms were great. The imac in the room is a great extra and free wifi throughout the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree was no double-cross”
Reviews.Author: TravelsfromMadAve
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at The Mint Hotel, a newly branded UK hotel chain (formerly City Inn) in Amsterdam, their first foray outside of the UK. We arrived, however, to learn that it had been taken over by the Doubletree just days before (after the Blackstone Group, owners of the Hilton chain in the US purchased the Mint Hotel group). Not a place I would normally choose to stay, but I figured they couldnâ€™t have messed it up that quickly, and they didnâ€™t. The hotel is situated right by Centraal Station. The location is somewhat away from the city centre, but itâ€™s right by all of the tram lines so there was no problem. You enter the hotelâ€™s modern reception area. The decor is sleek, minimalistic and the cool music in the background tells you that you are (or you want to be) in the trendy spot in town. While there was a slight confusion around our reservation, it was quickly resolved and we were all settled into our rooms quickly. The hotel has a lobby bar, a cafe and the Sky Lounge which provides some of the best views of the city. There is an outdoor terrace off of the Sky Lounge but it was too cold in January. There seemed to always be some action in the bar, one afternoon there was a band hanging out after what was clearly a late night. The restaurant was acceptable, but having only managed breakfast there one morning my experience was limited. Our first attempt to visit the SkyLounge was aborted when we tried to get into one night and were turned away. A bit strange to turn away your hotel guests, but we did manage to return later that night to a much quieter scene and again, beautiful views of Amsterdam. The rooms are small but clean (except for the accent pillow on the bed which was stained and oddly enough, never switched out). The rooms all have Macs in them which conveniently operate as a computer, your TV and a radio. The bathrooms were very modern with slate flooring and Groehe faucets. With any luck Hilton will maintain the level of service and amenities that were introduced by the Mint and it will remain an exceptional value in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Hope⪻ay
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, central for everywhere in Amsterdam Rooms are lovely, but even with an upgrade they are still small. Lovely White Company toiletries. We had a lovely view and the balcony is a bonus. Breakfast is fantastic. You wont need to eat till teatime. Will def re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELRHJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel in December. We were very impressed indeed. The staff were very helpful. We had to change rooms due to a problem with a leaking toilet and they upgraded us to a club room automatically. The rooms are lovely- the only problem with the inital room that we were in was that is was rear facing and consequently was noisy due to the train traffic. The location is perfect; out of the immediate hustle of the centre but reachable within a few minutes walk. Perfect if you are travelling to Amsterdam on the train. Will be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Danny972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right near the train station Amsterdam centraal. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The room itself is a little small but not crowded. Who loves a siting or lying bath will be disappointed as there is only a shower. The lighting in the bathroom not quite enough. A little dark when standing before the mirror and shaving. The hotel is proud to advertise that the rooms are equipped with an I-MAC computer but when you want to use it is a little problem because the screen is fixed to the wall and a bit far. Watching TV is a little problem because the screen too small if you want to stay in bed and watch. Breakfast is delicious but very standard with not a large selection. Overall a good hotel in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: helcatengland
Reviews.Content: Just stayed Tues to Friday, booked at very good rates through Easyjet, Asked for quiet room and got one, White Co toiletries, Apple tv/computer.wifi, good breakfasts, brilliant shower, Hotel is near station, walk out the front, turn left, less than 5 minutes just past the I Amsterdam sign. Everything seemed new and there were lots and lots of friendly capable staff,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: JAMESYBOYNIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night trip to Amsterdam. Hotel is superbly located beside Amsterdam Central Station (just turn left and walk five minutes form station's entrance/exit). It is about a five minute walk to the city itself. It is also possible to walk to all the city attractions, including the zoo and Anne Frank House (both worth a visit). We were given an early check in and were immediately impressed with the bedroom and its facilities, including Apple TV/Computer. Oh, love the choc chip cookies on arrival. Yummy!!! The room was clean and modern. I had issues with the noise coming from the train station on the first night, so I asked to relocate rooms. This was easily completed. Thank you for this, as I am a light sleeper. Staff were friendly and helpful. I can not fault this hotel and can't wait to return to it. Amsterdam is a fabulous city with so much to see and do. It is expensive though, so account for that. Despite this I love the city, its atmosphere and its people. If you haven't been, book it and go. It is unforgettable in more ways than one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth I
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its own promotional literature but what made it so enjoyable for us were the staff. Not wanting to pick out individuals, nor groups of staff it would be wrong not to mention the staff at breakfast time. Their genuine interest, graciousness and friendly hospitality was exceptional. Congratulations and well done!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bectoria
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 3 nights at this hotel, and I'd definitely return on a similar good rate deal (we for 3 nights for the price of 2 on a BA package) Just 3 minutes walk from Centraal Station (you can see it on your left as you come out the front doors) and a couple minutes more from the heart of town the location couldn't be better. We had read previous reviews and requested a room facing the city rather than the train lines, which we were granted. I had told the hotel prior to our arrival that we were celebrating my partners birthday, and he recieved a beautiful little strawberry cake from room service, which was a lovely touch. The room was light, comfortable, modern and spotless. Amenities such as iron & ironing board and a decent hairdryer, not to mention the iMac TV/Internet facility, were very welcome. Too many hotels skimp on these things. Along with a great shower and comfy bed there's really nothing to criticise here - If I had to find something I'd say the storage is a bit stingy, but the presence of the ironing board meant I didn't mind living out of the suitcase. The view from the skylounge is amazing - well worth the drink prices for a look & to take a few pictures. We didn't use the city cafe or lobby bar so can't comment there. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: TheBences
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on Xmas Eve and really enjoyed our stay. Reception staff were extremely helpful.Our room was very well set out and the toiletries were first class. The TV was also an Apple iMac computer so we had free internet access as well.Contrary to other reviews we visited the Sky lounge upstairs and found the staff there very efficient. As soon as we sat down they brought over an assortment of complimentary snacks while we browsed the menu. The view was lovely from so high up. The hotel is a short walk from the railway station, very convenient. Definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Doubleetree excellent first impression”
Reviews.Author: rocktrips
Reviews.Content: Just checked in less than 1 hour ago. Check in was very quick with no delays. As I've stayed in several of Amsterdams 5 star hotels I was not sure what to expect here but let me assure you if first impressions count this hotel will be a pleasure. I got a spacious room on 10th floor overlooking the City. The room also has a large balcony, yes a real balcony that you could have a party on. The room has everything I need. Its clean, bright and airy as well as having all the usual things you expect. Thankfully the safe is large enough for a large laptop (you wouldn't believe the amount of hotels I've stayed in that cant fit a laptop in the safe). Nice touch is a tooth brush and razor already in the room..(usually have to call room service for these). IMac TV is fine, but personally I prefer a larger screen...but for those of you who dont want to bring a laptop/ipad it also doubles up as a Mac computer...handy for browsing. Yes WiFi is also in the bedroom and so far its speed seems reasonable (I can use it for Netflix so connection speed is very good) Bed is perfect , nice white linen but the real bonus is that because the balcony has a full glass door I can lay down in bed and still see out to skyline and rooftops of Amsterdam. Bathroom is what you would expect for this quality standard of hotel, no bath though..I havent tried the shower yet. Hotel location is fine, (just across from the Amrath where I've stayed serveral times and always get a great room, and also close to NH Barbizon which is another decent Hotel). Ive stayed in the Krasnapolsky several times also which is in a better city center location but there the rooms are hit and miss). But the distance from Doubleetree to Dam Square is 5 minutes or a 10 minute tourist stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartg03
Reviews.Content: January 2012 long weekend at the Doubletree hotel. Great location with easy walking distance to the centraal station, canals, river boats, red light district and most sight seeing attractions. Dissapointments - rooms do not have baths and there are no spa facilities. There is a gym which was nice to have on site. Make sure you visit the sky bar on the 11th floor. Great views!! We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, good location and staff were very helpful, skylounge was great and reasonably priced for amsterdam. Couldn't fault it

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: lynsey w
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the hotel. Here are some of my thoughts: You can see the hotel when you turn left out of the station but there is no sign to tell you which hotel it is until you reach the front door! Arrived about 11am and could have checked in straight away but we decided to wait for a city view room, returned at 1pm and after a 5min wait were given this room - Frank that looked after us was very helpful and great customer service skills - the warm cookie was also good. Rooms are small, not much storage space in wardrobe to hang clothes! Once in our room we noticed a bottle of red wine on the shelf, then a mini fridge, fully stocked. Also found shoe polish, mouthwash, spare toothbrush etc. However, there was no information on the price of anything in the mini fridge. I requested a price list from Reception and realised you had to pay for the mouthwash etc too, this also told you to fill out a form to say what you had used - didn't have this either! However, when our adapter plug broke was great being able to borrow one from reception free of charge. Breakfast was ok, at busy times I would advise ordering your hot drinks when they seat you or you may wait a while. Also some tables are too close together! Also better drainage needed in the showers, was worried this was going to overflow! Skylounge - overpriced. 7.50 euro for less that half a glass of wine! The view is good though. Overall, a great trip, great hotel, excellent location - we walked everywhere and the staff are brilliant! We will definitely return to this hotel, hopefully to do our Christmas shopping - the shops are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fayelovescroyde
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the perfect location right next to the train station (5 min walk) and not far to walk into the centre of Amsterdam. However no noise from the train station whatsoever. Rooms are basic, but clean, modern and the iMac and Wifi is a great extra. Staff are very helpful, booking us restaurants and by the time we had come back from being out for the day they had pushed a confirmation under the door with a map on of how to get there. They couldnt help us enough. Breakfast is great, wide selection to chose from. Room cleaned and services every day for the 4 days we were there. Would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great facilities and location BUT - avoid the Skylounge”
Reviews.Author: inGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We spent four days here recently and the hotel is generally very good. The staff at check-in were very friendly and efficient, the room was fantastic with an amazing view of the city and lots of nice touches such as an Apple iMac in the room with free internet. The room was clean, comfortable and we also found the downstairs lobby bar to be very reasonable priced with a great selection of drinks and friendly staff. In fact the lobby bar sells most of the same drinks as the Skylounge on the roof - but they are significantly cheaper. I would have given the hotel 5 stars had it not been for a visit to the Skylounge. It is a decent nightlife spot with a good view of the city but it is overpriced and more than a little pretentious. After spending 60 Euros on food and drink I clearly signed the bill and even tipped the waiter. Upon leaving we were chased by a member of hotel security who followed us into the lift and demanded to know our room number. I suppose he was just doing his job but I also notice that other reviewers have commented on similar incidents so they should really do something about how staff communicate with guests if they need to check something. Possibly they have a recurring issue with people charging to the wrong room or similar - but they handled us very poorly. Having random members of staff demand your room number doesn't seem like a smart policy for a hotel that also advises guests not to give out their room numbers for safety. So a good hotel - but with room for improvement. If they tone down the over-zealous security and realise that the rooftop bar isn't the exclusive haven that they think it is I would likely return. In the meantime there are a lot of other great hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: william21Cheltenham
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at Doubletree by Hilton. Our room was on the 6th floor with amazing city views. The room was quiet & comfortable with extras such as Apple TV/DVD player/ Computer with free wifi. The staff were friendly & professional. The hotel is within walking distance of all the sights & very near the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend location and room”
Reviews.Author: englishgirlabr0ad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a long weekend in January and we couldn't fault the hotel at all. For the price we paid it was fantastic - a great view overlooking the canal and the city, brilliant location within easy walking distant to the main areas and Central Station and a really lovely room. They gave us an early check in which was great and we were very impressed with the room. The bathroom was brand new, possibly the best shower I've ever experienced and all the amenities you expect in a hotel of this standard. The ice bucket, mac computer and tea making facilities were the icing on the cake. A great hotel for a couple to stay in, the room was nice enough that you could spend plenty of time chilling out in comfort with his and hers robes! A note for anyone wanting to bring their laptop - there really is no need as every room has a brand new mac which does everything you could possibly need it to. Overall a fantastic hotel we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juliana O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel right from the 26 to the 29th of December and had a lovely experience. Differently from other hotels of the Doubletree by Hilton chain, the lounge was opened to the public and offered the best view of the city (at some other Doubletree hotels I've been to the lounge had to be booked for private events). The staff was helpful and friendly. It is a few minutes from the Central Station (walking distance), but it is not that close to the city center or tram stops. But we would definitely stay there again for the great view of the lounge and the way we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic romantic break at great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SammyNGary
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Amsterdam last week and had really great time. Got a train from Schipol airport for 4â‚¬ each run every ten mins to central station. Hotel walkin distance from central station. Arrived at 11am and was able to check straight into room which was a relief. Hotel staff very friendly and hotel really nice. We stayed on the 7th floor and looked out onto the city was fantastic. Room spotless everything you need iron hairdryer tea/coffee making mini bar everything!! Imac was great too bbc 1 and music channels and internet at touch of a button. Didnt eat at the hotel but the menu looked very tasty. The skybar was really good great views. We stayed for three nights and had great time. Amsterdam lovely place did a lot of walking. Ann Frank house good be prepared to que. Madam Tussads not that good but adds something to the list. Good shopping malls bit pricey. Hundreds of places to eat we ate at a place called Cau which was a steak place was gorgeous and reasonably priced. Also ate at a place called Het Melkmeisje and had ostrich!! Was absolutely gorgeous would definately recommend. Also had surf and turf being half a lobster and steak at Looks which was only 20â‚¬ bargain!! Very posh and romantic. Went to a nightclub called Escape was good night make sure to take ID as will not let you in without we turned up without and grabbed a tram bak to hotel to get it they let one of us in for free for makin the return trip back which was nice. Overall 10/10 for whole stay :-) hope this review helps others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveller E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel a week ago for 2 nights and I wish I have booked for much longer than that! The location is amazing just right beside the central station, 5-10 minutes walk to everything! The receptionist, Denise was very helpful and gave me a nice room over looking the canal and I also received a lovely warm cookie! The room was just simply perfect with a view to die for, I couldn't believe it! Everything was brand new, comfi bed, lovely bathroom and excellent amenities in the room. The Sky Bar at the 11th Floor was my all time favourite place in this Hotel. The view was unbelievable and the staff couldn't made me feel more welcomed! The food was amazing and the service was just great!I can not remember names but everybody was just great! Breakfast was fantastic too with a large selection of warm and cold dishes. All together I can not wait to come back in the summer again and would highly recommend this Hotel to everyone who is planning to visit Amsterdam- this is your Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: zltm089
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the mint hotel/ doubletree by hilton. All I can say is that the rooms were suberb. Very friendly staff at reception and breakfast was a delight. Unfortunately, room service needs to improve as our expectations were not managed. Food took longer to arrive and had to keep chasing. Also we were told that the kitchen is closed after 45mins of putting our order. However, the rooms and freindliness of the reception/ breakfast team make up for it. Extremely good value for money and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend bolthole”
Reviews.Author: colette67
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend stay in the Mint Double Tree Hotel in Amsterdam, Great location a few minutes away form Central Station very easy to reach from Schipol and handy suitcase wheeling distance from the entrance of this very beautiful building - nicest train station I have ever seen. Mere minutes away from bustling Dam Square but also very close to the quaint pretty canalside walks and the quieter districts away from Dam and Red Light District. Took the Canal Boat Trip but at 75 mins thought it was just that little bit too long - a 60 minute cruise is plenty time to spend there. Had a very tasty meal in the Blauw Aan De Wal restaraunt - expensive, contmeporary place with dark wooden floors stark white walls and a choice of two starters, mains and desserts but a nice romantic location once you walk past the graffitied alley to reach it! Try the local drink Janaveres in the American Eden Hotel Bar/Cafe huge high ceilinged, dark wood furniture and nice views out onto Liedsplein. Any number of small cute little bars all dotted along the cobblestones you will be spoiled for choice - walk around the Red Light Area at night rather than during the day. Double tree Mint hotel - lovely 4 star - rooms compact but comfortable - hot breakfast just ok - continental breakfast was better - but great staff and a nice Sky Lounge although expensive at 16 euro a cocktail with a lovely birds eye view of Amsterdam from there. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A leading light”
Reviews.Author: tmarks123
Reviews.Content: I know hotels very well, its my job to and I have to say this is a hotel is what many other hotels should aspire to!! I stayed here from the 5 to 8 Jan for my birthday and all round the hotel was superb. Lovely rooms, a greay Sky Lounge bar and a breakfast worth writing home about! Staff are superbly well trained and are very friendly and hospitable. Will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GerryBBelfast
Reviews.Content: At the start of December 2011 we spent a few days at the Mint hotel now Doubletree hotel. The hotel is located across from the central train station, quick to get to and easy to find. It is the perfect location, for your visit to Amsterdam and from here you can walk to quite a few of Amsterdam's attractions. Check in was reasonably. We requested a city view room (as we had read the other reviews regarding noise) but were informed there weren't any left, we felt its only a few nights no worries, but as it turned out we had trains coming through the room on the hour every hour and every half hour in between, and we were on the ninth floor. We got little or no sleep and when we requested a change of room there none available, due to a conference being held at the hotel. That was the downside. The room itself was lovely it was very clean and comfortable with all the up-to-date technology, free films were also available; you just had to ask at reception. There was also tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms which is a plus for me. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and had a shower, no bath. They did provide complimentary bathrobe and slippers. A visit to the sky lounge is a must the views of the city are amazing. Check out queue was very long and some people were getting a little impatient, but it moved fairly quickly, when we had checked out we left our bags at the baggage storage, as our flight home wasnâ€™t till evening. The bags were taken labelled and a receipt given. On return we had our bags in a few minutes, and were on our way. We found the staff to be polite and helpful; nothing was a problem for them. Would I stay here again yes I would but only if I could have a front city facing room.

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: paulswbuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DoubleTree Hilton early in January 2012. You cannot miss the hotel - you turn left after leaving the Central Station and it is the first big modern block you come to. Not that attractive from the outside and seemingly no real Dutch look to it at all. The Hotel reception is spacious and very corporate. The bar is a good size and very modern in its style. Breakfast is served in the large cafe on the ground floor and we found this to be excellent...a huge choice and excellently managed when the cafe is busy. The 4 lifts serve all the floors but to access bedrooms you have to use your door key. We did find that on busy days the 4 lifts were not enough. One was always out of service. The room we had was a good size...excellent bathroom and shower. Each room has an iMac computer that has great sound quality and picture for TV too. One thing I would check if I was going to the hotel again is that the room has a view...ours looked out onto a wall...not really aproblem as in a city like Amsterdam you dont spens a lot of time in the room! However a great view would have been good. The staff at the hotel were great, friendly and efficient at all times, they made you feel welcome. The hotel has an amzing Sky Bar. Panoramic views over the town...almost worth the inflated prices but the bar does have a great atmosphere in the venings and drinks come with small snacks...it is still expensive but worth a visit. In the summer there is a huge patio on the oof too. I would recommend this hotel for a good visit to Amsterdam. The city is not cheap. We come from London and prices are similar. We did a boat trip with wine and cheese which was excellent but overpriced at 30 euros each. Wrap up warm in the winter the Dutch wind is COLD.

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree by Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jimgWisboroughGreen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect position for exploring Amsterdam. It is just a 5 minute walk from Central Station and the main Canal-Bus and Tourist Information offices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Emz19872011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for New Years Eve with my Boyfriend and two Friends. The Hotel is in a brilliant location. Central Station is around 5 minutes walk away, Dam Square is about a 10/15 minute walk, Pubs, Shops and museums are all within walking Distance. There are trams that run all the time, however, we never had to use one as everywhere we wanted to go was within walking distance. The rooms in the Hotel are very nice, the room was cleaned daily and the bed linen/towels were also changed daily, we were on the 4th floor and it was very quiet in the room, we couldn't hear a thing from outside or in the corridor. The Hotel staff were polite and helpful, they give you a warm Cookie on arrival which was really yummy :) The Sky Lounge at the Hotel is lovely with amazing views of the City and the Hotel is very clean. The only negative comment I can make is that the breakfast (which did not look nice at all) was 49 euros for two people for ONE day! Although we knew Amsterdam was very pricey for food and drink we thought 24.50 euro for a continental breakfast was a bit steep so we went out everyday for breakfast instead. The atmosphere is great in Amsterdam and there is loads to see and do there, I would definitely recommend the Mint/Double Tree Hotel as a great stay with easy access to the city and central station.

Reviews.Title: “I saw a mouse...”
Reviews.Author: holiday4jodi
Reviews.Content: but this wasn't a Windmill in Old Amsterdam... this was a 4* hotel!! And actually it was more than one. I suffer from insomnia so came downstairs to read in the lobby bar and it would seem that the mice like to come out and play (they came out from behind the bookcase) at about 5 o'clock. I did report it but the staff didn't seem too bothered and just said they would let maintenance know. Anyway, that aside it was a rather nice hotel - once we got there. We were looking for 'Mint Hotel' and there was no indication anywhere that the name had changed so we felt a bit embarrassed going into the hotel just in case it was the wrong one! It turns out the name was changed 3 weeks previously, it's a shame they didn't bother to notify us beforehand. POSITIVES: the warm cookie they give you on arrival; I asked for a city view room which we got (and the view is amazing); the iMac in the room; fluffy dressing gowns; fab hairdryer (so rare in hotels to get a decent one) and nice bathroom products. The staff were always polite. The view from the Skylounge is great but prices are extortionate so we had just one drink each. Perhaps they should consider a discount for residents? We ate in the City Cafe one evening and the food was absolutely fabulous as well as the service. I think it was 32 euro each for a 3 course menu but once we added drinks, coffee etc the total bill came to 115 euro for two of us (which was absolutely worth it for the standard of food and service). NEGATIVES: very long queues to check in and out (it took 15 min to check in, 30 min to check out); sometimes a long wait for lifts and sometimes the key card wouldn't work!; very limited tea/coffee products in the room (no milk, just 2 tiny cartons of cream - no good in tea and only enough for 2 cups of coffee); all extras are VERY expensive; a lot of talk about the 'Careline' in the literature in the room but no information on how to contact them!; the restaurants weren't open at the times stated on the key card e.g. the City Cafe is not open at 1:00 pm and the kitchens were closed at 10:30 pm, not 11 pm as stated. Overall it was nice but I'm not likely to stay there again. Even though the staff are very polite, you know that you are just a number in this big money making machine. If I was to stay in Amsterdam again I think I would look at other hotels that are better value for money though I would definitely book an evening meal in the City Cafe again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: JonoLion
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have changed names a couple of times since it was built. I stayed there in early Dec 2011 when it was the Mint Hotel, and now it is the DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Central Station! Most confusing for some travellers no doubt. Anyway - location is brilliant, you come out of Centraal Station on the city side and just turn left and teh hotel is 5 minutes walk away. It is a very modern, good looking building. Check in is very efficient. The rooms are great - very comfortable beds, good views to the city, good shower - and each room has an iMac TV-computer. Amazing. If you dont know iMac TVs the on/off switch is just behind the screen on the left! Good, quite nights sleep. Breakfast is help yourself - and good selection of continental. Cost was around 140 euros I think - which for the location and quality is excellent in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality, but got problems with comfort”
Reviews.Author: igorpolonski
Reviews.Content: The hotel's really of high quality, it's brand new, beautiful and it provides best free wi-fi I've ever seen. And the location is also very cool - it's in the center of all the city activities, but at the same time the place is very quite, and that is really valuable considering Amsterdam's craziness. The main problems we had with this hotel - were with the furniture. First, the bed is on WHEELS. So, it moves. With no stops on those wheels, you can move your bed all night long from the wall to the wall. Who the [--] decided, that a bed should be standing on wheels?.. The second problem is a wardrobe. It is very small itself and there's no any other boxes of shelves for clothes. That a real problem, 'cause we had to keep all our clothes in the bag during whole stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Liz D
Reviews.Content: We visited in Aug bank holiday 2011 and found this hotel to be fantastic base to explore the city (2 mins away from the train station). Our booking was lost when we first arrived so the helpful Reception staff upgraded us to a Club Room. We had the latest mod cons in the room including an iMac TV/ PC, and great views over the canals and city. The hotel is brand new, so everything was modern and clean. For even better views though, have a drink in the Sky Lounge. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mum4k9
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay here and we were, overall, very pleased. We arrived late and there was no problem checking in. The room was large and had a nice bathroom (good products too). One complaint is that there is virtually no closet space and almost zero drawer space...tough when you are staying for a few days and donâ€™t want to live out of your suitcases. The breakfast was fantastic and the restaurant service was really good. We also have nothing but compliments for the front desk staff. They were all very helpful and gave good suggestions for activities and dining. The biggest complaint that I have is with the housekeeping. We could not get our room cleaned before 5pm at the earliest! (Even when we made a point of telling the front desk that we needed to have it done while we were out.) Very annoying as we either had to vacate the room after a long day of sightseeing or hang out in the room while the staff was cleaning-awkward! Other than that, I have nothing but nice things to say about this hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hol_88
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a christmas break with my partner in Amsterdam and we stayed at the mint hotel/doubletree for 2 nights. The hotel was extremely quick to get to and easy to find, only a couple of minutes walk from centraal station and we arrived in the morning. The staff were extremely polite and helpful and as our room was ready early, they allowed us to check in straight away,also providing us with warm cookies which we thought was a nice touch! The hotel was clean, modern and the sky lounge bar at the top of the hotel provided breathtaking views of the city. We spent the last night there and regretted not visiting the bar more. Some of the rooms faced the railtracks which i can imagine may have been noisy, however we faced towards the city which had no noise issues. It took around 10 minutes to walk into the centre of the amsterdam action so we found it wasnt necessary to use buses or trams as everything was within a good walking distance. The only slight negative was our checking out experience as the queue was large with people both checking in and out. There was no obvious quick drop off queue which would have been frustrating had we been rushing to catch an early flight. However the staff remained friendly and provided drinks for those waiting in the queue. Luggage was stored free of charge. Overall, our experience of the doubletree hotel was excellent and i would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to be within walking distance of the centre. If i return to Amsterdam, i would stay at this hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: jollyjoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights just after it changed its name. I booked the hotel a while back and later contacted the hotel to upgrade our room and request a room overlooking the city. This was all confirmed. On arrival we were told that the room type we had upgraded to was no longer available, neither was the city view room! We ended up in a courtyard view room looking across to other rooms.The person who checked us in offered no apologises or explanation and I thought we were treated a bit shabbily. We did ask to see the manager but were told that she was not on the premises, did we want to see the duty manager, we said yes but it turned out that he was too busy elsewhere. The room was tiny with nowhere to put a suitcase. We ended up putting it on top of the wardrobe and the amount of dust that cascaded down on us was amazing. We managed to find a room maid who did a quick dust! Please note this hotel has only been open since about June and they sure haven't dusted the tops of the wardrobes since then. We commented on the size of the room and were told " it is a known issue" We seem to have been quite lucky that both check in and out were no problem with no queues. The position of the hotel is great, easy access to the train station and public transport to the rest of the city. The sky lounge is worth a visit for the views over Amsterdam. We have been HHonors members for a long time and this is the first time we have ever been disappointed in a Hilton brand hotel. Would find somewhere else to stay in future visits to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJS22
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night break with my husband in Amsterdam. We booked the Double Tree as a last minute break through Expedia. On arrival at the airport we took the train directly to the Centraal Station from which the hotel is a 2 minute walk (turn left as you come out the station and it is the large, modern, glass building in front of you). Check in was reasonably. We had requested a city view room before arriving but were informed there weren't any left, which was fair enough. However, when we got to our room (munching on the delicious chocolate cookies we were given at reception), we had been allocated a twin rather than a double as per our booking. We rang down to the concierge who immediately came up and helped us move to a double, with that elusive city view we had wanted! The room was clean, comfortable and functional. Nice touches were the iMac computer/TV (which includes BBC channels for those Brits who like to stay in touch!), and the bathroom with its White Company toiletries (although note that the bathrooms are shower only). The bed was reasonably comfortable although not the best I have slept in. Good, detailed information booklets in the room and what looked like an excellent room service menu (although we didn't use this service). We also liked the ice bucket which you can fill up as often as you want from the machine next to the lift (this isn't on all floors though, the note next to the ice bucket tells you where the machines can be found). The hotel breakfast (in the City Cafe) was very good, great selection of hot and cold food and attentive service by staff for tea and coffee etc. We ate in the City Cafe for dinner on New Year's Eve as well which turned out to be a good decision (we had originally booked it as a backup as we were unsure where else we would be able to get a table in town that night). The atmosphere was perfect, upmarket but informal at the same time. The food was excellent and again the service was very attentive. There was a set menu that night but I had a look at the usual a la carte menu as well out of interest and it looked like there were some excellent options available for other nights. Throughout our stay we found the concierge to be extremely helpful and eager to please. Examples of this include booking taxis for us, advising us on restaurants for dinner, and on our travel options on New Year's Eve. The only down side for us was the check out procedure. Check out is at 12 noon. We therefore came down with our bags at this time only to find the longest queue I have ever seen for a hotel check out. The hotel does have a lot of rooms, but we have both stayed in large hotels before and never seen anything like it. We queued for about 30 minutes. There were 4 or 5 staff on the reception desk but there wasn't any sort of system for the queue.
