Management are clearly aware this is an issue because staff from the restaurant came round offering orange juice to those waiting - a nice touch but doesn't really address the issue properly. Therefore don't leave it to the last minute if you are in a rush! Other than issues with check out, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not without issues”
Reviews.Author: Dave.Matt.99
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days in amsterdam over new year 2011/12 and chose the mint hotel as I have used them in the uk. We found out that the hotel had changed to the doubletree Hilton by chance as no communication was forthcoming from our booking agents. On arrival our room as not ready until 3pm (as stated on the website). Our luggage was kept and we returned later to get our room key. Initial impressions of our room on the 10th floor were that it was smaller than expected and that it was noisy as we were below the sky bar on the 11th floor, you can hear per walking around in heels and tables blowing moved. This is poor considering g how much we paid for the room so we rang reception and asked to be moved as the was a new years eves party due the next night unt 3am. The management said they would see what they could do for us. We came home later that night and they had moved us to the 9th floor and a far better room for which I think they deserve credit at a busy time of the year. I would say the worst part is checking in 20mins wait and checking out which was terrible in that there is no option to check out on your admittedly great apple tv. I had to queue for 35 mins to check out which was very poor and a Lot of people were complaining, I would recommend that they ensure that all desks are staffed until they get the automated check out sorted. The staff vary from being really helpful or miserable but overall efficient. I would recommend the Doubletree Hilton Amsterdam as a good hotel with great rooms available so long as you get the correct one, they also need some of the rough edges tidying up which I'm sure in time will happen...I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Virus
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here are spot on - it's an excellent place to stay in Amsterdam. The location is super handy for train travel (to/from the airport and day trips) and not bad for getting to places of interest, museums in central Amsterdam which is easily walkable. A warm signature DoubleTree cookie was a nice touch; I was also offered one at checkout. Dealing with all the staff, from the reception to the maids, was a pleasure and my requests for a high floor city view room and late checkout were met with no issues. I was given one of the oddly shaped rooms on the 9th floor which was huge, very well equipped and had a great layout. The best feature was the panoramic floor to ceiling windows facing the city, St Nicholas church - beautiful at all times and particularly at night. I thought it was sound proof, the only incoming noise was that of the occasional ambulance/police car siren. Another great thing about the room was, as mentioned in many other reviews, the iMac TV/computer and the ability to surf the internet which was handy for checking out various tourist sites, restaurants and opening hours. A fair number of TV channels, including BBC1/2/World News, Discovery, National Geographic, Nickelodeon and other major European language channels. The wi-fi (free) signal in the room was patchy. The bed was comfortable, with good quality cotton linen. The bathroom was very compact but had sufficient counter space, hooks for hanging clothes/towels and the shower (no tub) was excellent. Two bathrobes and two pairs of slippers were provided. The toiletries (hand wash, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel) were by The White Company, very nice. The hotel had been opened for a few months and it showed: the furniture, furnishings, carpet, bathroom were spotless and looked brand new. Sky Lounge on 11th floor is really nice, although the drinks are quite expensive (cocktails â‚¬16, small beer could be had for â‚¬4.50). I booked this hotel on the splendia.com website which offered the best rate online and had no issues with the check-in/rate/payment. In summary, a great new hotel in a convenient location. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Warm n Fuzzy”
Reviews.Author: AbraCaBling
Reviews.Content: We're still currently at the Doubletree Amsterdam Central but felt we couldn't wait to share our great experience. Location - perfect. Out the Central station, everything is already in front of you and the hotel is to the left. A new modern building with modern amenities. What a complete change from the horrific experience we had staying a night at the Westerdoksdijk Central Apartment (about 500m walk to the right from the back of the station). And to think that matchbox of a place (yes, smaller than a standard european hotel room) with a sharing bathroom and entryway with other strangers fisted us a non-returnable 900 Euros! Worse, it's run by the credible Xpatrental.com. Don't go there! But back to the Doubletree...the 10 min wait at the reception was worth it because of the friendly serviced rounded off with warm cookies for both of us. Having stayed at the Doubletree Kuala Lumpur, we now know the cookies are it's signature welcome and it tastes the same. Woot!! :) The room is fitted with modern facilities topped up by free movie DVDs if you ask for them at the reception to be played in the spanking new iMac in the room. The bathroom amenities are by the White Company of London and the water pressure in the shower did wonders for us. Drop by the Sky Lounge if you have time. The view of the city at night is great. Staff there are very accommodating as much as the others we encountered for our different needs. From the hotel, to get around the city is easy peasy as all the trams and buses are within walking distance located at the front of the station. If you get bored of eating at the nice East Dock Lounge, there are plenty of choices also within walking distance. What would be really nice is if they could provide coat hangars by the door so that we can free up some space in the wardrobe but that's not a big deal. If you are in Amsterdam, we highly recommend the Doubletree by Hilton Amsterdam Central as your temporary home - especially in the winter when the cold wind blows, the hotel is a much welcomed sight stepping out from the trams! We hope that they will continue to maintain the standards they have set for themselves. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, lovely experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gina W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb. We stayed for one night only, visiting Amsterdam for the Xmas market and shopping. We were welcomed and checked in as soon as we arrived, despite it only being 10.30am and given immediate access to our superb room. Very modern with excellent mini bar, lovely bathroom (though shower only), and to my husbands delight an Apple Mac with inclusive TV, radio wifi, and dvd. The hotel is superbly situated near to the station and well placed for sightseeing. The only downfall of this hotel is that food and drink are VERY expensive, breakfast was 26 euros per person so we opted to pay for room only and ate out in the may cafes and restaurants around Amsterdam. We did however indulgently purchase a cocktail in the Skylounge late into the evening with superb views of the city and the ambience and candlelight were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel, traveling with friends”
Reviews.Author: Espritcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in October, 4 older college friends. At the time it was The Mint Hotel. Very new, contemporary and sleek. Rooms are very nice, fluffy white beds, marble bathroom (with face cloths - rare in Europe!), refrigerator, coffeemaker, built-ins. A big Apple computer was also the TV, about 22"; wonderful to be able to search the web without any problems, free wifi. Our room was 6th floor overlooking the city. Continental breakfast buffet was nice, though pricy at the time. We loved the Sky Bar (lounge?) especially at night. Food there was fancy, light meals, not any hearty fare. Heinekens are just 4 euros, same in the mini-bars, but scotch was 9.5 euros, and one martini we ordered was 17 euros... check the prices on the menus if that is important to you. Dinner at the City Cafe on the main floor was wonderful... better pate than in Paris, beautiful presentation, attentive but quiet service. Sleek, can dress or go casual. Concierge was very helpful. Only glitch we had time and again was using room keys to access your floor in the elevators. Most time they just didn't work so we waitied for other guests to use their keys. It is to the left of the Centraal Station, but stay alert for hundreds of bicycles and the trams, trolleys and buses, as you must cross their lanes to get to the hotel. In front of the station are the tour offices and origin of many boat tours, trams and buses. Easy to navigate around the city with the hotel map. Highly recommend the Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum, Delft Shops - only 2 authentic ones, rest of ceramics are imported. We took a day trip via train about 40 mins. to Zaanse Schans, an outdoor heritage area with shops and working windmills. Beautiful, bucolic and free, it is about a mile walk from the station, and we didn't see any buses running on a Sunday. Took the canal cruise at sunset - saw the harbor area in daylight, and loved seeing all the bridges light up at night, along with many of the canal houses. Ate outside all the time. English spoken everywhere. Great time, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEG130189
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited the Mint/Doubletree (it was in the middle of changing over) from 19th-22nd December. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. We requested a city view room on arrival (following recommendations from other reviews) and we were given an 8th floor room with a city view that we were able to check in to immediately, despite being three hours early for check in. The room was ideal for our short stay- fairly small but very comfortable. We found the iMacs and free WiFi extremely useful. The Sky Lounge offers wonderful views over Amsterdam, although the drinks are quite pricey! Breakfast was very nice and there was always a good selection of both hot and cold food. The hotel is next to Amsterdam Centraal station, so getting to and from Schipol airport is easy and cheap! The location of the hotel is wonderful for sightseeing as it is close to most main attractions. We were able to walk to Anne Frank's house, Dam Square, the Red Light District and lots of nice bars and restaurants. The only occasion where it was necessary to take the tram was to the Van Gogh museum. Overall, a fantastic hotel - I would definitely recommend it to family and friends and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE - UNPROFESSIONAL MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie Y
Reviews.Content: Actually I visited a lot of hotels and I am very familiar what means good service and professional staff/Manager, because is my job as well!!!!! Last night, that it was my first night at this hotel....at the midnight my boyfriend was very sick and he was vomiting...we called the Operator at the Reception and we asked for a tea...they told us that we will have it shortly...after 20 minutes I personally called again and I asked again for the tea that never comes.....the operator told me " I will send it now at your room".....after 20 minutes I called AGAIN and I asked for the tea because my boyfriend was really bad and we didn't have water at least.....ANYWAY....the tea has NEVER COMES!!!!! At the morning I went at the reception and I informed the manager...Ok he appplogized and he asked me what he can do for me? I said nothing thank you!!! But as a Professional Manager at Toubletree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam you have to offer to your client after this situation at least something as appologise!!!!!!! I couldn't tell him what he must do!!!! This is not my job, this is his job as professional manager or his employers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay at the Mint Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: maltina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a short break to Amsterdam in the beginning of December. It is really nice hotel, staff is very friendly, breakfast was good, checkin was efficient and the iMac in the room for TV and internet and free wifi was just perfect. Really can't say anything wrong about this hotel. it had everything we needed! we also had the view of the city and that made it very special! Well done Mint... :)

Reviews.Title: “Trainspotters paradise”
Reviews.Author: TaxiFaber
Reviews.Content: Rebranding the Mint Hotel to Doubletree seems to have done no harm. Location is super (next to Central Station), and the design great and very modern, though some may find it a bit sterile. Service -which wasn't bad to start with- even seems to have improved. Check-in was warm, friendly and attentive (and the warm cookie given to each hotel guest checking in was a welcome bonus). Getting a room on the top floor was no problem. I went for an IJ river and Central Station view. If you don't like the light but constant rumble of trains go for a city view or ask for a room looking out on the inside garden. If you like trains, here you can inspect most Dutch, and some foreign rolling stock. Yes, an anorak's paradise! Hotel staff -even when just passing you in the corridor- are friendly and make you feel welcome. The nicely designed room really has everything it needs including free WiFi (and more: the Apple IMac is brilliant, but then I'm a long-standing Apple fan). As a TV, especially if you're watching it from a distance, it's not a great success. And careful when you sit on the bed, mine shot halfway across the room (obviously not on the handbrake). The SkyLounge is great for a short visit, taking in the magnificent views (especially on a sunny morning). If you really like special beers go to 'In de Oude Wildeman', near the Nieuwezijds Kolk, ten minutes on foot. And if you feel like a good curry afterwards, around the corner on the Nieuwe Zijds is the Royal Tandoori. Doesn't look like much, but the welcome is very warm and the food hot (or very hot - depending on your choice) and inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Babeso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous and worth every cent! The rooms are spacious and clean! And i must say the shower was the best thing about the room! I loved it! Less than 5 mins walk from Central Station and within walking distance of most places. Very quick checkout for us, no queues. The Sky lounge should be visited but its a tad expensive! Enjoyed my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - dont book through qwerty travel though”
Reviews.Author: milly155
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, some negative reviews on here i would ignore, the staff were very polite and helpful. Facilities good, the bar at the top of the hotel is a must although a little pricey the views service etc are top draw. One negative, nothing to do with the hotel is we booked through qwerty travel who are a absolute shambles avoid at all costs. Find another travel organisation their are plenty with this hotel......

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snapper1949
Reviews.Content: Check in was very easy and quick with a lovely warm Doubletree cookie. We had a city facing room on the 5th floor, nice views. Room - Clean, with iron and board, hair dryer, towel gowns, apple TV with free Wi-Fi, great shower and The white company products. Location was excellent, right beside central station everything was just a walk away (Come out the station turn left) Sky lounge great views and great service, previous reviews were complaining about the price however for the standard of views, service and surroundings I thought it was not too bad. We only had one drink a beer and a glass of white wine, came to 11 euros. with nuts, dried fruit and biscuits to nibble at on the table. Amsterdam seems to shut down at 1am, so coming out of a club and looking for food we found nowhere, so ordered room service. My only complaint is very expensive - 50 euro for a not so nice lasagne and a pizza. My Hotel Tips - Ask for a city facing room, Do not order room service, Go and see the sky lounge but just stay for one drink, The hotel checkout is 12pm but allows luggage to be kept in hotel if requested My Amsterdam Tips - Have dinner at the TA #1 restaurant Brasserie Vlaming - I had steak of deer was cooked to perfection boyfriend has Duck also yummy - 2 main meals 1 sweet, a beer and a wine = 61 euro Eat breakfast at the English tearoom Greenwoods (TA #4- eggs benedict to die for. Go and see the Anne Frank House Do not eat a whole space cake to yourself Bicycles are everywhere Be aware that everywhere in Amsterdam seems to close at 1am If you like clubbing head to The Supperclub on a Monday night - very busy and quite upmarket

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, but irritating issues”
Reviews.Author: helen b
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brilliant, the building itself was spacious, modern. We were upgraded to a junior suite free of charge and the views over amsterdam were second to none- sounds perfect. And it almost was, but not quite. Firstly you have to queue forever to check in, the queues were at least ten people long when we arrived. We got to the front of the queue and were told check in wasn't until 3pm- which is quite late compared to most hotels. Anyway, we left out bags and came back at 3pm. Our room wasn't ready and they didnt have any others available so they offered us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite, which we readily accepted. The room was brilliant, massive floor to ceiling windows looking out over the city, large bathroom, separate lounge area, was really nicely finished with a computer/tv in both rooms. We thought 'brilliant'! After about half an hour we started to feel really cold, so we put the room temp up to the hottest, but half an hour after that we were still shivering. We rang reception and were told to try another setting. An hour later still freezing, so we rang again. They sent up a maintenance guy who said that it's because reception needed to tweak the heating. They apparently did, but nothing happened. After phoning another few times over two days they sent someone up with a small electric heater which did nothing. So we spent a really, really cold three nights there. We actually avoided going back to the hotel because it was so chilly. On top of that, every time we left the hotel our lift key and room key would stop working. We'd make our way up to the room ony for our key not to work and for us to have to go back to reception. Which became pretty tiresome. When I complained about it I got no apology. When we came to check out I'd wanted express checkout. They said i'd get a statement posted under my door. I obviously didn't and had to join the ten person long queue again in order to check out, which I'd been trying to avoid. It was a really frustrating stay at the hotel. We'd stayed in the Mint Hotel in leeds and were looking forward to another good experience at this one. Unfortunately although the building was good, the stay didn't live up to our expectations. When it's freezing December outside, the least you want is a warm room to come back to. I'd recommend the hotel still, but maybe go when it's warmer weather!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault it...”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal to Amsterdam and have just returned - we originally booked as Mint but it has been rebranded to Doubletree - as a Hilton Honors member great news :) Arrived to a very warm welcome - some warm chocolate chip cookies and a room upgrade to a room with a balcony due to my Hilton Honors - room was beautiful with a large balcony and spotlessly clean. Large spacious bathroom and also a balcony with city views. Some people in reviews had complained about noise from the station - i had requested a city view which takes you to the other side of the building so i recommend that. All staff where so friendly - they would not have walked past you without greeting you - a nice touch. Breakfast was lovely if not a little pricey at 24Euros... but im sure thats the going rate in any hotel. Every type of food you could imagine was there and the food was of highest quality. Another tip is reception have a stock of DVDs - you can borrow for free.. excellent for a quiet night in after a long day sight seeing. Just to highlight again i think the staff make this hotel - their sheer friendlness and willingness to do anything that would make your stay more pleasant really made it - well done Mint/Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December - easy check in and booking clerk very thorough with information given about the facilities in the hotel. Very nice room and spotless - safe in room free of charge - ironing board and iron, hairdryer, tea/coffee making facilities, bathrobe and slippers to share during our stay. Any staff we encountered during our stay were very helpful, and the concierge at the front desk was very knowledgable. On our first evening we wanted to experience the views from the sky lounge sited at the top of the hotel - wonderful views, but at a price as the drinks were very expensive. Check out again was effortless,thanks to the staff at reception, despite the changeover taking place of a new system being installed that moming. Overall would definitely stay at this hotel when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “An "Urban Experience". Friendly, close to station, modern and 'just works'”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the night that this hotel stopped being "Mint" and became "Doubletree". The booking systems were manual (paper printouts), the processes were new and everything was in the process of not working smoothly. Despite this the whole experience was friendly and efficient. I hope for Hilton's sake that they manage to hang on to the staff! Modern rooms, wifi everywhere that was a) good and b) FREE (yes!). Beds were great, iMacs as TVs in rooms, great view over the railway lines - it's a real "urban experience". It's a 4 minute walk from the Central Station (although my room was over the tracks), the centre of Amsterdam is walkable, and the food is good. All it needs to be 'perfect' is free mineral water in the rooms. A clean, friendly, efficient, wired, station-accessible and pleasant hotel. What more could one ask? Let's hope Doubletree/Hilton doesn't mess with a winning formula.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: frankandliz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 3 night City Break staying at The Mint (Doubletree) in Amsterdam. Booked through Travel republic and happy with the deal we got for flights and Hotel. Having read the hotel reviews before we booked, we acted on room hints and asked for a city view, high floor room. We were allocated a room on floor 8 and it had good views and did not suffer from railway noise. Reception staff were on the ball and check in was efficient. We were offered help with taking luggage to our room but declined as we only had one small case. The room was fairly small but quite adequate for just 3 nights, storage space was sparse but we were travelling light! The room was immaculately clean and modern, (puts London city hotels to shame!) Every thing that should have worked did work. The iMac system is great. Breakfast was pretty good, lots to eat and service was friendly and efficient. The only down side was that when checking in for breakfast, we were told we were not booked in for breakfast. The matter was resolved quickly and efficiently, though it did get a bit annoying when this happened each morning. I do believe it could have been due to new systems being set up due to hotel ownership change (we checked in the Mint and checked out of Doubletree!!). (quite a bit of corporate identity changes seemed to be going on). The hotel location is a big plus, just a few minutes walk from Centraal Station, and ideally located for exploring Amsterdam on foot or by public transport. Canal cruise boats also nearby. Lots of eating places just a short walk away if you don't want to pay the quite high hotel prices for eating! Check out time was a very civilised 12-00 noon which made for a leisurely breakfast, plenty time to pack and efficiently checking out. Would like to come again in maybe Spring or Summer when I think the City will be even more pleasurable. We think Amsterdam is a great place to visit with lots to explore and this hotel was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WTF - now a DoubleTree!”
Reviews.Author: BritChikOhio
Reviews.Content: I could have been walking around for hours not finding this htoel now it's been named a DoubleTree - nice of the travel company I booked with to tell me (NOT!) let's hope the service is the same..... my biggest fear was NO MORE iMac in the room (as I didn't bring my laptop) but thankfully it's still here : ) The warm cookie upon check in was very welcomed. Right now off to eat some proper food, I'm famished!

Reviews.Title: “Mint”
Reviews.Author: woolie30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December - nice clean modern hotel but our 1st room was above the railways so no sleep that night!! we got moved with no problem the next morning to a room with no view apart from a wall and directly below the skylounge - this was actually more noisy than the trains, chairs behind pulled across the floor and people dancing and walking about in heels (i think this was room 1011), well the next day we were going gto ask to be moved but as this was going to be our last night we just went to a coffee shop and had some cake to help with the sleeping - lol. Apart form all that the hotel is in a great location and very clean and modern (the skylounge bar is a clean fortune - Â£26.00 for 2 vodka and cokes!! i mean come on!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Mint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonKingston
Reviews.Content: Hadn't realised it was changing to Hilton, I hope there is no loss of quality and service as it was fantastic. Echo other reviewers regarding friendliness and helpfulness of staff, quality of rooms and excellent location. Only gripe was quality of internet tv on the Mac, although it was a very welcome surprise to find we could get terrestrial UK channels, the signal frequently froze or was lost. Other than that, a brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mint Hotel.... renamed”
Reviews.Author: THot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was renamed yesterday, December 12th 2011. It has an ideal location just a few minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Station so no need to worry about transport through the City. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms had toiletries, hair drier and Apple computer on which there were TV channels. The room safe was free. The breakfast choice was huge with tea and coffee served at the table and the most non-greasy English Breakfast I have ever experienced. I have read elsewhere that hot food would cost extra but this was not the case. The Skylounge on the top floor had superb views over the city and a very warm welcome form Manager Kim. A bottle of wine will set you back 37 euro, a Martini or cocktail 16 euro and a coffee over 6 euro. If you don't fancy forking out then you should still go to see the view. Chocolates and biscuits come with the coffee and we were given excellent snacks whilst up there. If you have a query you need a reply to promply it's best to telephone rather than E Mail. My reply arrived 2 days later - too late. Highlights - For me it was the Brown Cafe's, (Not to be confused with the Coffee Shops), some of which date back to the 1600's. Take a look at http://dutchfood.about.com/od/reviewsrecommendations/ss/AmsterdamGuide_4.htm Others of note were Pilsner Club,de Hoppe, de Peiper, Some have over 600 beers and their own distillery. The tradition is to overfill your licquer glass until it forms a domiscus so that you have to lean over to take the first sip before picking it up. Tips - If you are returning to the airport by train, call into the information booth at the station the day before to check. We came home on a Sunday and there was work being carried out on the line which meant changing five minutes out of the Central Station. Without being forewarned it would have been a panic. Schipol Airport is massive and the Easyjet gate was a very long walk. At the entrance to Gate H you are asked to stay in the lounge until all details appear on the screen. We did this, proceeding as some as the info appeared and were one of the lsat on the plane. It seems that those in the know ignored this and proceeded further toward the gate to more screens. Apparently, 6 missed the flight. We had a package so didn't pay the room price advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: BarneyMate
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a three night break at the Mint/Doubletree by Hilton, or whatever the name is now. Having read the previous reviews, prior to going, I wasn't overly concerned, but feel, in hindsight, that I should have. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, but, if you are anyway a light sleeper, it is imperative that you request a quiet room. We were in room 905 and were treated to the intimacies of the Dutch train system. Having lost my first night's sleep, the staff did find me a quiet room very quickly, but I was so exhausted that it really detracted from my visit. When I mentioned this to a member of staff, they smiled and said 'but we moved you, which was good', intimating that I was happy to have lost only one night of my short break. The hotel is located in a good position for access to transport and to most, if not all of the main sights. Easily accessible from Centraal Station (literally turn left outside the front door). Coffee is good in the lobby bar, but it depends on who serves it as to what type of coffee you get. It is lovely to take drinks in the Sky Lounge and the food is of a reasonable, but not fantastic standard. I cannot comment on the breakfast, as having arrived to find we'd been booked on a room only basis, they wanted 147 Euro for 3 breakfasts, while others had their breakfast included in a cheaper rate, while we'd both booked through Qwerty Travel's 'deal' - we priced it later and could have saved almost Â£200 and had breakfast included!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN AN IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: bowyerdintlisten
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the mint for 3 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday. as others have said less than 5 minutes walk from central station so no need for taxis. on arrival we were upgraded to a club room free of charge which had great views over the city. the bar and restaurant very welcoming but rather expensive, however a drink in the sky lounge is a must just for the view, its worth a few euros!! great breakfast, plenty of choice but can get rather busy, had to wait 15 mins on the Sunday to get seated, one word of caution, the other couple we travelled with didn't get the upgrade and asked to move as the trains woke them at 5am!!! So insist on a front or courtyard view room. the staff did move them without any fuss so all worked out well. As we were there, the hotel was in the process of being renamed "Double tree by Hilton" All in all, would definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good short stay place. Let's hope it continues under Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: cop27
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a very pleasant stay at The Mint Hotel ,Amsterdam. We don't normally choose hotels of this size but got a special offer from Querty Travel, via Travelzoo. Staff delightful on the whole, young and enthusiastic. Asked for a quiet room as a bad sleeper, faced the courtyard which is unexciting but unimportant at this time of year. Bed standard european hard slab but they placed a duvet under the sheet to soften it a bit with no argument. Bedroom not well designed for this shape as there are varying shape rooms to fit into the actual building arrangement but bathroom good. Meals still need some sorting but really good quality breakfasts, probably best orange juice we have had in a hotel. Any problems were treated seriously and dealt with quickly. Unfortunately, by the time this is read, the hotel will be a Doubletree by Hilton as the group have been bought out. The English television channels were being changed to US ones as we left!! Let's hope the staff do not get the Hilton lack of care attitude, it would be a great shame.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but don't, don't, don't bring a car!”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: Pluses - a good upmarket style chain hotel, clean and comfortable, with Apple computers and free wifi in every room, a sky top bar and plesant restaurant with very good buffet breakfast. Everything clean and cool. Location right next to the main train station, walking distance of canals and many other things. One side overlooks the city the other side the railway. It's in an ex industrial area being redeveloped into somewhere chic. Minuses - our big mistake was coming by car. You just can't find this place, it's in a maze of confusing roads largely due to construction work. The satnav is no use either. Parking is also very expensive and inconvenient. Also, the front desk was terrribly slow to check in and we felt there was a real shortage of well trained staff who could use their initiative or had a real idea of offering service. And the noise from the trains was terrible, I'd guess even worse in the summer when the windows are open. There seemed a shortage of local coffee shops and places to grab a snack, but the hotel did have quite a reasonable coffee shop. I liked it but on returning to Amsterdam I might try and find a more cosy and personal hotel within the older part of the city, that's just a matter of personal taste and an aversion to being kept awake by the noise of rattling trains.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a modern and clean 4++ star!!!”
Reviews.Author: Issues_84
Reviews.Content: Hotel veramente moderno, nuovo e vista splendida sulla citÃ ! When you arrive they are very warm and professional ( everyday ). I was in contact one week before and they where extremly kind and fast on answer my questions and trying to help me. I get a room with city view, it was amazing! I stayed in the room 745, they give you a pass card you must insert in the lift to go to your floor. In the room you will find a frigo a bar and the mac pc/tv. You will hear the train but not noisy! If i'll be back to this amazing city i'll stay at Mint Hotel for sure. You can get the breakfast, dinner ecc in your room, they will sort out your room every day and they will not get in your room if you put outside the door "please do not disturbe". The Hotel is the cleanest i ever stayed and Any your request will be done if possible. They speak many languages, but in my opinion if you travel you must speak a little English, so i don't understand why italians get angry when staff doesn't speak italian, when i go to italy it's quite normal find people that don't speak English, no one speak Netherlands no one speaks portughese so why negative votes just for the languages? Anyway, if you're going to Amsterdam you'll get a good stay here at Hotel Mint. Enjoy this amazin city and Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday break Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MarkandGail_A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here to have a short break and had an excellent time. The welcome was very friendly and effecient, we were quickly checked in and asked if we needed anything. We enjoyed the room which was very very well equiped, clean, perfect for our stay and we looked out onto the city. We enjoyed the bar and the staff were very friendly including on one occasion providing a free cocktail when the "evening cocktail special" was not liked by my wife. We also ate in the City Cafe restaurant and had a very good meal with again a complimentary pudding when the creme brulle sauce had not set. We also observed the restaurant manager de-bone a fish for another customer at his suggestion. The hotel is very is conveniently sited 5 minutes walk from Central Station and therefore very close to the city centre. It is a modern design but has traditional very high service values. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice comfortable modern hotel with very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: karenbeanpole
Reviews.Content: Mint Hotel is a very nice hotel conveniently located next to the Central Station. We arrived by plane and the superb frequent train service took us in about 15 mins into Central Station. From there it was just across the road to the hotel. We arrived at about 11.30am and was told we could leave our luggage there till the official check in time of 3pm when they could give us the room we requested (upper floor quiet room not facing the station). We returned at 3pm and unfortunately the room they'd blocked off for us was not ready. As an alternative they offered us a room on the 3rd floor (instead of the 9th) which we took. Although the view was not as good as it would have been on the 9th floor, it was a very quiet room and very comfortable. Bed was good, pillows a little too flat but adequate. Kettle in room with teas/coffees. Bathroom had a nice big shower and the usual toiletries. What was brilliant in the room was the free wifi and and iMac tv - could use the internet in the room free! The breakfast in the morning was served from 630 to 1030. The choice was amazing for a hotel in Europe. Buffet style except for tea and coffee which was served to the table. There were all the juices, fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurts, all kinds of breads, croissants, danish. Then there was the hot buffet - bacon, sausages, eggs, french toast. There was also smoked salmon, various cold meats and cheeses. Quite impressive! Would recommend this hotel for anyone. Very convenient, nice friendly staff, and more than adequate. The location was brilliant - 10 mins or less walking distance to Dam Square. We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and classy”
Reviews.Author: SorenTrips
Reviews.Content: Chose the Mint Hotel because I'd be arriving late at night so wanted to be near the station. The problem with the Mint is that it is too near the station - the rooms at the back overlook the railway lines feeding into Centraal Station. Although the room was double glazed there was still quite noticeable train clanking well into the early hours. However, that's the only bad thing about the hotel. It's brand new, very well decorated and appointed with superb shower and comfy beds. Each room has a wonderful Apple iMac in it so you can access the internet or watch TV on it. I was very impressed with this feature. All the staff are friendly and helpful, and make an effort to make you feel welcome. The top floor has The Sky Lounge which has spectacular views across the city. We didn't eat in the hotel so have no comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Still plenty of kinks to work out....”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMao
Reviews.Content: This hotel was relatively new (I think it opened in June 2011). The location of the hotel was quite convenient. It was close to the central train station and was close to a lot of attractions in the city. Some rooms had good views of either the canal, the city, or the train tracks but rooms facing the tracks could be loud. The rooms facing the courtyard tended to be dark. There were iMacs in all rooms which served as both the TV and the computer. It was a nice touch but the fan in the iMac got progressively louder and I had to turn it off every 20 minutes or so. Otherwise the room was nothing special and I thought it was a bit expensive for the quality of the hotel. For some reason, the lines at the check in counter and the concierge were always long. But at least the staff was very helpful in general. The bar at the top of the hotel had amazing views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Declan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mint Hotel on my first visit to Amsterdam at the end of September. It was the occasion of my stag weekend and we were a party of 8. The Mint hotel is so convenient to Central Station and everything is accessible on foot. From arrival at reception I had a good feeling, the staff very helpful, polite and informative. My initial feelings were not misplaced as we continued to have a fabulously relaxing weekend. The restaurant was great and the Sky Lounge magical, well we were blessed with unseasonably good weather. On my recommendation my wife and I are hoping to make a trip to Amsterdam in 2012 and plan to return to the impressive Mint Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mint Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kooky71
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Mint Hotel in Amsterdam and had a great experience. As it was my birthday they upgraded us to a junior suite. The room had amazing views across Amsterdam and we were delighted that we had 2 large imacs in the lounge and bedroom. Within an hour of arriving we had cake and champagne brought to the room again complimentary as it was my birthday. The location was fantastic and we loved visiting the Vapiano restaurant next door for cheap Italian food and drinks. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: AlyWales
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around, one of our party had room overlooking railway very loud and noisy room was changed without any hassle. Breakfast good, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel- Ideal City Break”
Reviews.Author: GW21186338
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for three nights & were very impressed. We have visited Amsterdam a few times & this was by far the best hotel we have used. Room was lovely- worth every penny, Location is ideal & Staff were lovely & tried their best to make you comfortable at all times. Only two minor complaints- firstly the towels were quite small (nit-picking now!) & the trains from the station could be heard from our room. However I am a light sleeper & managed to sleep right through the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth every penny! :)”
Reviews.Author: Williams_Like2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be more central! Bit of a walk to rembrant square, but literally a couple of minutes walk to everything else. It's true what everyone's saying about the long check in, we had a 30 minute wait. But staff are all polite, speak perfect English, & were very helpful. We changed our room when we got there, as we got put right above the train tracks, managed 2 bag ourselves the last city view room, which is a must to request! I-MAC in the room is awsome, especially to look up restaurants, bars etc close by! As for the rest of the room, clean & tidy, iron & hair dryer, free tea & coffee, couldn't have asked for more really. Beautiful view from the terrace on the top of the hotel.. very classy bar & expect to pay a lot for drinks, but hey that's the same everywhere in Amsterdam! We only went once, be very nice in the summer! We booked this hotel via last minute.com.. and went for the secret hotel option.. admit that we were worried when we read the reviews of this hotel, apart from the check-in taking abit of time, this is definately hotel I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: 12Knocksinna
Reviews.Content: The Mint Hotel is located right beside the Central Station in Amsterdam, which makes it a great location for anyone who plans to travel into the city by train from Schiphol airport (the quickest and easiest way to get into town). It also means that youâ€™re located right by a central hub for trams, taxis, and buses and that youâ€™ll be in a place where you can easily walk to attractions such as the Anne Frank house or Rijksmuseum. The hotel is brand new and it shows in the furniture and fittings that have been used. Rooms have an iMac that can be used as a computer (obviously) or to play the DVDs that the hotel makes available free of charge. The iMac is also used as a TV so itâ€™s got a smaller screen than the usual flat-screen TV that now seems to be the norm for hotels. Both wired and Wi-Fi Internet access is free. The Wi-Fi signal was good for PCs, iPhones, and iPads throughout the hotel. The hotel personnel are cheerful and made checking in an easy process, even though we arrived before noon. Everyone seemed pleased to help, which is a nice change from the dour attitude that is sometimes met in other hotels. We had a room overlooking the canals and Central Station square. The rooms on the other side of the hotel overlook the railway line, which isnâ€™t so attractive. In our case, we could still hear the noise of the trains as they passed over a steel bridge en route into the station until approximately 1am. The rooms are small and compact, which is what you expect in a city center hotel, but they are comfortable and clean so they are a nice place to spend a couple of hours relaxing while you figure out what to do next in Amsterdam. The beds are very firm and seem to be a small queen rather than king size, which might be important to some. Like many hotels the contents of the mini-bar should be avoided unless you delight in spending large amounts on items such as EUR4.50 for 0.5L of water (sparkling or flat). There are supermarkets close to the hotel where you can stock up on items at a more appropriate price. The breakfast buffet is a tad expensive at EUR24/head (the continental breakfast is EUR14/head). Cheaper breakfasts (less than EUR10) can be found if you take a short walk across the bridge in the direction of Dam square or you can grab a pastry and coffee in the Central Station. Alternatively, you might be able to book a rate that includes breakfast and save some money that way.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Chilled59
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in August and greatly enjoyed our stay. Booked a club room but on arrival found that we had been upgraded to a suite because they had overbooked their club rooms! Can't complain in this instance as we benefitted from their mix up!! The hotel is situated about 5 minutes from Centraal Station which was ideal for me as it had been some time since my last visit to Amsterdam, so wanted somewhere nice and central. Its in a great location for sight seeing as you can get to all the attractions quite easily. Everywhere is easy walking distance. We didn't have to wait too long at check in and the young lady who sorted us out - I think her name was Samantha was extremely friendly and helpful. The Suite was a little on the small side but ok for us. It had two MACS which was good one for us to watch television if we wanted to and the other to keep the children occupied. Food in the hotel is very expensive but there are lots of good places to eat nearby but watch out for one or two the shops over the bridge almost opposite the hotel as they overcharge greatly. For example a grocery shop beginning with "L" opposite charged 8 Euros for one packet of crisps and 2 milky way bars!! So watch out! The best thing to do is stock up on provisions from the supermarket situated in the station, can't remember the name but know the initials are AH. The hotel is a non smoking hotel but whilst we were there someone was probably smoking in their room which set off the fire alarms which meant everyone having to leave their rooms. It was good to see that the staff were calm and in control of the situation and once everything was checked out we were soon back in our rooms - so well done there! All in all a good hotel which nice helpful staff and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: YG1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mint hotel for a week long seminar (held at the hotel). Location was ideal as it was 5 minutesâ€™ walk from the main train station and close to the bustling â€œRed lightâ€� district. The hotel is located at a modern, brand new building, and the views from the south side (facing the old city) were stunning. Hotel facilities were awesome, including a modern gym, very nice public area and a great dining hall which served a superb, fresh breakfast. Enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend this to any business traveler visiting Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Made our weekend extra special!”
Reviews.Author: JacquiO32
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic weekend in Amsterdam which was made perfect by our choice of hotel. The Mint hotel is a modern, trendy, clean, friendly hotel which is excellently located right beside centraal station. We were made feel like royalty for the duration of our stay. Our room was brilliant with Imac and all mod cons and a view of the city. We were given a complimentary drink in the sky lounge upon arrival as it was a special occasion for us and we were immediately impressed by the breathtaking views from here over the city. The staff couldnt have been nicer and the 'guest services' provide a wealth of advice and information on how best to sample the city highlights!We were just a walk away from the bustling red light area and Dam square and also from all the boat trips which set off from here to all points over the city. Our only complaint was we ran out of time to do everything we wanted to this time but it means we've an excuse to return again. We will definately stay in the mInt hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “New property, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rakeshrg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for a business trip for 4 days. The hotel overlooks the Canal and the city. It has a Skylounge on the 11th floor with a splendid view of the Amsterdam city, canals and the Centraal Station. The first day, they offered me a room that faced another wing of the same hotel, I asked them to move me to a city facing room and the did that the the next day! I got a room on the 7th floor with a view similar to the Sky lounge! it was just superb... The hotel seems new and the rooms are modern. Every room in the hotel has an iMac that can be used as a TV as well! The hotel is located just 5 mins from the Centaal Station and the city centre, location wise this was the best to have! I was very happy with my stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Jack M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late November. Located next to the Central Train Station, and within walking distance of most other attractions. Hotel is new with modern facilities and very clean. Excellent staff who are very helpful and knowledgable. All trams lead back to central station, so you can go anywhere and then hop on any tram to head back to the hotel. would stay here again, and recommend it. Can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Snomel
Reviews.Content: I really loved everything about this hotel. Every single member of staff we encountered was extremely friendly and welcoming. The location was very convenient, easy to get to and from the airport and also great for sightseeing, only a short walk from all the major tourist attractions. There was a large range of delicious food for breakfast, and very high quality food offered in both the Lobby Bar and City Cafe. The views from the Skylounge Bar are stunning (although the drinks were a little out of our price range...). The room was extremely comfortable, woke up feeling so well-rested every morning. Loved having the iMac and the wifi access as well. Would definitely love to come back at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: ln0ah
Reviews.Content: There were some real pluses to this hotel: (1)Location is right next to Central Station so whether it was trains, buses, canal boats, bikes...everything was right there. (2)You are in easy walking distance to just about everything. (3)Hotel staff is exceptional and also very helpful in planning your entertainment and sight seeing. (4)Fitness room was adequate. (5)Rooms were very clean and well maintained. (6)Rooftop Lounge was extraordinary. (7)You have an option of adding breakfast into your rate. (8)Coffee service is complimentary and in your room. (9)Free wifi that is fast (10)Mac Computer in your room which allowed for tv watching to internet sleuthing. (11)Views from the room was very nice. But.... The train noise is significant and quite evident. The rooms seemed to have good sound proofing, but we were at this location a week....for the first few days we did OK and then it became very irritating. The hotel is very contemporary in its decorating style and so does not give you that "comfort" sink into a chair feel. I would not make this hotel my first choice for a "resting" vacation, but it was great for sightseeing. We were on a "resting" and sightseeing vacation. I gave this hotel a 3 because it was not a restful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: uktotheworld
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The location is perfect for exploring the city. We rented bikes and cycled out to the country from the hotel which was very scenic and a must do! The hotel is brand new and in great condition. The two highlights were the full breakfast in the morning which was fantastic with excelent service, the other was the spectacular views from the SkyLounge a definate must see even if you are not staying in this hotel. We will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a stones throw from Old Town”
Reviews.Author: use_online
Reviews.Content: Mint hotel stands up to its name; it was in Mint condition in all aspects. The rooms were amazing with great views over the railway station and a new canal, one could spend hours just watching the trains go by and boats/ferries scurry across the canal from your room window. The rooms are well furnished with all modern amenities including an iMAC with over 30 TV channels from 5 different countries! The iMAC is ideal for surfing net, emails etc too. The sky lounge is beautiful but a bit expensive; everything is new, shiny and clean. One has to use their key card to active the lift too! The staff are helpful and always offering advice on things to do or see. I cannot think of anything negative to say except the cost, breakfast is 24 Euros but what can I say other than â€˜you pay for what you getâ€™. I have travelled extensively especially as a child/teenager, but this was the first and only hotel to ask for a credit card deposit to stay there in addition to the room rent. Who could blame them it is in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: DashaNova
Reviews.Content: Had to take a point off for the service. Waited at the reception to check in for 15 min as a couple of the reception staff were flirting with someone not even looking like a client. The staff in the restaurant was a bit slow too. Apart from this, it is an amazing hotel. Very conveniently located right next to the central station and whithin minutes from the main sights. Newly build, stylish, clean and modern hotel. Macs in every room! And the top rooms have an amazing view over the city centre. The price was very reasonable for the hotel of this level as well. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond words”
Reviews.Author: Jonycold
Reviews.Content: Balcony worm is worth the extra mile. View is breathtaking. Gorgeous rooms. Superbly adjacent to Amsterdam Centraal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5* quality”
Reviews.Author: TERRY5NFFC
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations! We were visiting Amsterdam for the weekend (19/11) but only stayed the one night with breakfast. The rooms are very airy and spacious, modern and amazing views overlooking the canal and city. The staff are very friendly and provided a good service during our stay. The breakfast is well recommended, you have a choice of either continental, English or both! And can eat all you want- it was delicious and so much variety available. We shall certainly return again when we visit Amsterdam. Our friends stayed in another hotel and were very disappointed with theirs. This hotel is right next to the train station so easy to find and not that far from the centre really. A perfect choice for us by far!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Impressive, thoughtful and contempory new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dhxdh
Reviews.Content: Impressed so far! Checked in earlier today for a 4 night stay. Having stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam I must say this tops them all! Despite previous reviews, I found the check in process to be very efficient, with a warm welcome and helpful face! Guest service staff also very helpful. The room itself is well presented, and benefits greatly by the forward thinking approach to design and technology. The addition of the IMac is fantastic, wifi fast and mobile phone reception excellent. Services such as exterior window blinds make for thoughtful approach to room privacy on lower level floors (3rd floor room) and ice machines in lobby's very useful. Only downside, is that despite emailing the hotel prior to my arrival to request a smoking room, this was not allocated, however after contacting reception I was advised they could offer me a room change tomorrow, for my remaining three nights. I'm off to sample the food and drip cocktails available in the Skylounge bar, and will review this and the other hotel facilities upon checkout when i have returned home! So far, very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great spot.”
Reviews.Author: chcharlie
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days holiday here with a room with a view of canal and swans from the 6th floor. Good facilities and helpful staff. Got a good deal by phoning direct the day before and beating the late booking sites for cost. Ideal location for seeing Amsterdam as near trams, trains and boats. Found some super dining places using Rough Guide to Amsterdam borrowed from hotel library. Room was very well soundproofed and could not hear any other guests or much outside noise. Great iMac system wher we watched UK tv and also used iPlayer to catch up on missed programmes. Also Skyped friends in Australia via the iMac. Wifi also good with a measured speed of 4Mbps download and upload.

Reviews.Title: “very good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardBristol
Reviews.Content: The Mint Hotel has now become my no.1 choice in the city as it's modern, clean, well appointed, in a good location and reasonably priced. Over the past 3 months I have stayed their 3 times and always had good service at reception and in the restaurant. My last stay saw me upgraded to a club room, which is the same as the standard, but on a higher floor and with views of the city. Whilst this was great, it also meant I was woken by the building site next door. If parking at the hotel you need to use the underground entrance at the opposite site of the building site to the hotel! I spent an hour and a half discovering this and lost a wing mirror! The Sky bar is pretty cool, with great views. Some of the staff are a little snooty though.... Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1212check
Reviews.Content: We chose the MINT because it was only 400 metres from both the Central Railway Station and the berth for the Rhine river cruise ship we would board after our three day stay at the MINT. The MINT is a big, modern hotel with a very good restaurant. Our room was large, minimalist and spotless but sadly, our large window only provided a view of a wall that was just metres away. The hotel was close to a tram line hub and, with the advice of the concierge, we found trams an easy way of getting around the city. Memo to staff: many North Americans prefer real coffee and a coffee maker in their room rather than a kettle and a package of instant coffee.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuthouse45
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel,very modern and friendly staff. We didn't eat in the hotel only as its very central we wanted to savour the delights of lots of eating places The room we had was clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: MinMallorca
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 2 mins from train station. Ask for room overlooking the city and the swans! Lovely stylish rooms with imac for TV/computer. I only discovered the kettle & tea/coffee the morning when we left as it's tucked away in a deep drawer. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “great night and excellent infrastructure”
Reviews.Author: Entropalpy
Reviews.Content: good place, very near to the amsterdam centraal station. new hotel with Imac entertainment system in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel with IMacs and bikes!”
Reviews.Author: soupysales_11
Reviews.Content: Right next to Central Station and all the activity of Amsterdam! Brand new with all the ammenities you'd expect plus an IMac! wow! Wifi also in the room. Our room overlooked the train tracks, but that was ok, the rooms are well sound-proofed! And they rent bikes for 15 euros/day...that was really fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Siddharthmurgai
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were on our honey moon, a friend of our recommended this hotel to us. Excellent location , walking distance from the Amsterdam railway station. staff is very help full and friendly. Rooms are nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “freezing; poor quality services”
Reviews.Author: Mihaela A
Reviews.Content: Although it is a very new hotel, the room have ugly furniture, very small bathrooms. The worse was that I was freezing; they do not have central heating and the air conditioning was fixed to get a maximum temperature of maximum 20 degrees Celsius. The housekeeper did not replace the shampoo and the other used products. they also wanted to charge me twice for the room. The room was paid by the agency but when I checked-out they asked me to pay once again also my colleagues at the lower floors could not sleep at all because of the noise from the trains (the central railway station is just behind the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SJJG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very short walk from Centraal Station, you can see the Mint sign if you look left as soon as you come out of the station. Check in was easy and informative and the room was exactly as specified. The Apple TV & Internet access was very useful, though the WIFI could be a bit patchy sometimes. The Guest Services Staff were very helpful and I would certainly stay here again. The bar service was very good, the views great but drinks expensive for this city, it was about 16 euros for a cocktail!! The whole stay was great the location is very central and everything is in easy walkable distance, however the trams and trains are a short walk away should you not want to walk too much. If you are flying in to Schipol, the train is about 17 minutes from the airport to Centraal and only costs 4 euros much cheaper than taxis which are a shade longer for the journey and cost 40 - 45 euros.

Reviews.Title: “From which planet are some of these guests?”
Reviews.Author: Albert C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exceptionally large with more than 500 rooms and is right next to the central railway station. A really efficient way to get from the airport. 30 min door to door! The hotel is also only 200m from the historic city centre with it's china town and red light area. Great restaurant on the ground floor and many different ones within walking distance. Staff is friendly and accommodating, the front office can get a bit busy but work it out if 200 rooms want to check out at 11.45..... Overal great location pleased I didn't use the car though the municipal parking garage under the hotel costs 45.00. That probably is normal for public parking in the heart of a European capital city. The rooms are not very large but pleasant and certainly sufficient for a comfortable stay. The personal Mac in the room is certainly worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb hotel...”
Reviews.Author: shan69
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at the Mint Amsterdam, you will not go wrong. Located a few minutes walk from central station it is very convienient to get all around amsterdam. Hotel itself was fantastic, one of rooms was facing the city which gave us great views. Free use of the imac and unlimited internet use also for free was very handy. Although there is a gym located in the basement there is no swimming pool or spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Super service - great location”
Reviews.Author: ArildOpsal
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is located in the city centre. The hotel is modern and "minimalistic", a good bed, nice view, but the best feature about this hotel is it's employes: They realy made my stay. The service was great, we could borrow umbrellas, ask for advice, rent bicycles in the reception, order roomservice 24/7. They truly know how to treat their customers. I'm going back to Amsterdam, and I know I'll stay at Mint Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic, noise iisues and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: BabylonBaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed weekend 5th November with my wife and another couple. In summary: Positives Good location next to the Central Station; new hotel; free Wifi and great view from the Sky Lounge. Negatives Bedroom very basic and bland ; had room on 7th floor overlooking train lines; unbelieveably noisy and felt like trains were actually in the bedroom; breakfast food quality very poor and if payinf 26 Euros would be very disappointed; check in girl not very friendly; overall very overpriced for standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a week-end stay”
Reviews.Author: BaroqueW
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for one night with a friend so I have not had the opportunity to try out all the facilities of the hotel. This being said, the hotel is brand new and the rooms feel very fresh. They are very modern (an iMac in a hotel room is something I had never seen), you have free internet as well in the room and the loby. The room was not very big, but since the hotel is very well located (just a stone's throw away from the city center and most tourist activities), I trust you did not plan to spend your entire stay there. It's also very close to the central train station which connects to the airport. The only negative point I could think of is the lobby. It's quite spacious but it is always crowded with groups and customers checking in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, very clean, excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: Teeps18
Reviews.Content: The first point to make about the hotel is its proximity to the Central Station (about 10 mins train journey from Schipol Airport), it's about a 3 minute walk once you step out of the station and as far as a starting point to explore Amsterdam goes, it's pretty well placed. The room was very clean, comfortable bed and a great shower. They also had an iMac there for both free internet use and watching a fairly wide range of TV channels. Overall, I would highly recommend staying here if you'd like some guaranteed comfort and an easily accessible hotel with a very well positioned spot in the city centre. P.S. The lounge bar restaurant is worth checking out, portions are as expected (small) but it was very tasty and quality service.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel and very modern but lacking”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: good clean hotel and very modern but lacking character free wi fi is a bonus good location booking in is a pain as it takes to long

Reviews.Title: “Go away !”
Reviews.Author: Leodium
Reviews.Content: 4 stars? really? In this case, 4 stars mean they have found fancy ways of stealing your money. Very expensive minibar (4,5 euro for half a litter of water, are you completely insane ?). The room is very small, the bathroom also and it doesnâ€™t even have a bath tub, the TV is very small since itâ€™s an imac, the wireless internet is not working (business travelers, avoid this place). All together, I cannot find anything positive about this place; the IBIS next door is better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaumT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a month back for a friends wedding. Hotel has very smart rooms, everything one needs there. Didnt try the food, but location was very close to the train station and in general was a good experience for the price paid. Staff was a bit slow with advice or maybe just got the wrong person. Its a bit of a walk to the center, but perfect for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JAYLAURA30
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location next to Central Station. Friendly staff, Would definatley return Next year.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Jill1976
Reviews.Content: Good location - right next to the station (not as picturesque as the canal hotels obviously but v convenient). Modern rooms - small, but well appointed and clean. Rooms at front suffer a bit from train noise. Staff pleasant and efficient although waiting time at reception occasionally slightly frustrating. Good bikes available to hire for small charge which was very handy. Sky Lounge on top floor definitely worth a visit, even if you're not staying here - amazing views and good food. We ate in the restaurant on one evening - the food was very good but the service was not great - a mix up meant one of us got the wrong main course and had to wait for the correct one, but the other main course was left so we ate at different times - a small point but shouldn't have happened given the prices being charged. Overall, would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Many good things but some badly trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: germanyguy1957
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel,next the chief railway station in Amsterdam. So it's very convenient if you come in the train. IUnfortunately I came in the car! This caused me such problems. When I arrived in the location recommended by Google maps there was no sign of the hotel! It took me over one hour to find the hotel. I walked there, (it was quite near). When I reached the hotel a member of staff explained to me to drive into the underground parking (the parking was not marked as the Mint Hotel). This got me to a basement door (not properly in operation) and it cost me 12 euros for the very expensive parking just to unload my car! (I had to go out again in the car later that day. I parked it finally at my work destination and came back on the tram! Then, I learned that actually you CAN drive to the front of the hotel to unload. I paid 12 euros for nothing. The staff didn't know how to direct me so they just told me to go to the car parking beacuse it was easier for them. I think the staff should really know about their own hotel and how to reach it!! This is truly unbelievable for me. Check in was very slow. Maybe it was the first day at work of the booking clerk, I don't know. But this took me nearly half an hour. Then I got into the elevator and it didn't work! It didn't go up to the room. I tried anohter elevator. Same problem! Then, another guest told me to put my room key in a little slot near the ground. (less than 1 metre from the ground) This makes the elevator work. I never heard of this system before. I met several other people who were having problem with the elevator and I had to explain to them what to do. But it should be the job of the slow check in clerk to tell me important things like this. I had already spent an hour trying to find their hotel because nobody thought to tell me there was construction work when I booked. What are these staff trained to do? When I reached my room it was quite pleasant, and modern, it had an apple computer and free wifi. Nice bathroom, all new but shoddy. My drawer did not close properly even though it was brand new. And then, no sound insulation! it was like sleeping IN the railway station. :) The price is not cheap for this hotel. Yes, it's a really good location. The breakfast was very good. The staff, though inefficient, were friendly. It was nice and clean. But is it worth this price? I don't think so. They must either reduce their price or else choose more intelligent staff who understand that their visitors are strangers in the city, and visitors do not know everything that is to be known. ESPECIALLY how to get to the hotel in a car!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views of Amsterdam from the terrace bar”
Reviews.Author: HendrikM
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel which aspires to be a chich and luxury hotel. Being very new and nicely design it almost gets there in terms of facilties: well appointed rooms, nice spotless bathrooms with great power showers, slick communal areas - except the long, narrow and bleak corridors that feel like a mental institution! However, the service is not as good as expected from a top hotel and I could see that the novelty factor could wear down if the don't raise their standards. The check-in is extremely slow and for a business traveller this is a very important consideration. The views from the top bar are sublime but the staff are not the most engaging and servicial. I stayed at the hotel the night of the official opening - it had been open for 4 months but they were throwing a party - and was appalled that guests were not welcomed but actually not allowed to join on the celebrations. It felt really rude.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 circles would be more apropo. Some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: OutofRange331
Reviews.Content: First things first - The location is primo. Smack dab next to Centraal Station. The rooms are a nice size (especially by European standards), modern and have Mac computers in them. The free Wi Fi is a huge asset for those who burn the midnight oil and hate paying upwards of 20 Euros for an internet connection. Great bathrooms with all the usual amenities. Oh, and the hair dryer was a real hair dryer with a diffuser attachment (what can I say? I'm a sucker for hotels that think of us curly tops). The lighting in the bathrooms wasn't the best, but what can you do? Breakfast was really yummy with lots of options, hot and cold. The wait staff was still a little rusty, and they would forget simple requests, like milk for coffee. They did, though, have a thing with toast and brought us more toast than we could handle during breakfast for four people. If you like toast, this is the place for you! The Sky Lounge was a great place to grab drinks after a long day with a great view and a cool vibe. It also seemed to attract more than just hotel guests, but I didn't exactly poll everyone there, so maybe I'm wrong. As this is a newer property - it opened about six months ago - there were some concerns, though: - Climate in the hotel was totally off. Cold without the option to turn off the AC...IN OCTOBER. Then, all of sudden, on the next to last day, my room was hot as could be. - Service was lukewarm. Check in was a nightmare and not enough people to handle the check in of a very large group. When I had to deal with the front desk for another issue, they were kinda useless. - Restaurant - the restaurant in the hotel is a bit pricey. When four of us had lunch upon arrival, three of us got our food and the fourth person had to wait FOREVER for a Caesar salad. Annoying... - It's not finished! The hotel is still being worked on! There were people still painting when we arrived and they are still constructing part of it. The place opened SIX MONTHS ago. Delayed timeline what? It seems like the Mint has plenty of potential, but here's hoping they reach that soon so others can have an overall pleasant experience, not just one with plenty of pros but also lots of cons.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, good city view.”
Reviews.Author: zygholiday
Reviews.Content: I had 3 nights stay in Mint Hotel Amsterdam. The location is good, the rooms are clean, the hotel is so new. The free internet connection and Mac in every room was very useful for us since we were in a business trip. Since the hotel is new, there are also some problems: I had first a room that the key card did not open when I returned to the room in the afternoon. The staff informed me that the lock was out of order and changed&upgraded my room to a new one. In that room the TV channels and the iron were not working, but I didnâ€™t have the neccessity to tell and change the room again. And the key card needed to be re-loaded in the reception in every time I left the room. The staff mentioned that it was because I kept it near to my mobile phone, but this do not occur in other hotel cards, I didnâ€™t understand the prolem. Both of the rooms I stayed had so good city views, and the windows until to the floor made it more beautiful to watch. Eventually I would reccommend this hotel for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel good location.”
Reviews.Author: annagray17
Reviews.Content: Right next to the river and the central station. Hotel is clean, modern and friendly. Enjoyed drinks in the sky lounge with fantastic views of amsterdam. Only downside room was quite small, no bath and we had a view overlooking the other rooms. Would recommend as a central, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aerdna1881
Reviews.Content: I am here now and I have to say I love it. The staff are professional and courteous. The room is very clean. The shower is amazing. The Apple computer doubling as a tv is not only ingenious but a godsend. We also enjoyed the restaurant downstairs and love how comfortable our stay has been here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night I added at that hotel level”
Reviews.Author: bengi92
Reviews.Content: I have been there for business with colleagues. The hotel look good, rooms are not really big but quite correct and decoration OK. BUT my room was just above the Amsterdam Central rails, and in Amsterdam you have train all the night. I had the feeling that I was sleeping on the rails ! (windows closed of course). For 200â‚¬ per night it's not normal. The breakfast was also not really good for so much amount. My colleagues that add room in calmer place (looking to the city or internal Patio) was quite happy of this hotel ! So hotel could be good If you are not on the rail station !!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and new, friendly but lacks warmth and personality. You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: MattFletcher
Reviews.Content: The hotel had been open about 3 months when I stayed in early October 2011. My first impression was one of regret. The building is modern and grey, not at all inviting. Check in was uneventful. I had booked a standard room which turned out to be tiny and dark, with a view of a machine room wall. I complained and was moved into a room facing the river and old city. This room was much better. The Apple media centre pc's in every room are really cool but the bed was uncomfortable and the bathroom small. Breakfast was overpriced with a seriously understocked and underwhelming buffet choice. Room rate was ok but you can do better in any of a number of more comfortable and better established hotels. New is not better.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent”
