Reviews.Author: erin n
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Mint for a long weekend and thought the location was awesome - the trams at the central station next door will take you anywhere quickly and cheaply and after spending days and nights roaming the canal it was nice not to be in the absolute middle of things when it was time to sleep- though the place was hardly off the beaten path. The Sky Lounge has a stunning view of Amsterdam - you should have a drink there whether or not you stay in the hotel - but you will pay a very steep price for the view/cocktail, which I suppose is to be expected. The room was nice, neat and clean. It's not a cheap place, however, and I expected a bit more from the staff - the heavily populated front desk group is capable of pointing one in the right direction but they seemed distant and weren't engaging - same for the restaurant and bar staff. Most of all - make sure they don't put you on the 10th floor, directly under the Sky Lounge. The actual noise of the bar doesn't penetrate the room but the sound of heels and chairs scrapping overhead really does - and it starts early in the morning. Overall, I'd expect a bit more at this price level.......I'm not sure whether I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “A few things to work out...”
Reviews.Author: NJJEBarber
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Mint Hotel for a few days and it was okay. Its quite attractive exterior is in contrast to the relatively plain floors of rooms with quite narrow hallways. I was pulling two suitcases on wheels and had to be careful not to bump walls on both sides as I went down the hall to/from my room. When I first entered my room, the multipurpose iMac was on some music channel. While this was fine, I soon discovered that it was permanently stuck on that channel. Not wanting to do a hard reboot, I called the helpline. The helpline is not part of the hotel or associated with the hotel chain -- it is a separate company and when they ask you where you are, they literally mean "where in the world are you" -- I discovered this at the end of the phone from a fairly rude helpdesk person. In the end, the helpdesk could not help me, told me they'd call back later and never did so. A hard reboot got the iMac back but I had to do this a couple of times in my three-day stay. While I don't care much about the TV, it was great to have an iMac in the room and not have to pull out my laptop or iPad. I was able to make it to the rooftop bar once during my stay and the view of the city was spectacular -- I highly recommend going up if you stay there and get the chance. The location was great and very convenient for walking our on quick excursions. The Mint Hotel Amsterdam was "okay" -- but I was expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a long weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bennett-griffins
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent stay in this new hotel, which is in a superb spot just 5 mins walk from the central station, which cuts the mucking about after arriving from the airport on the train to central station to an absolute minimum. Everything felt brand-new and the rooms,decor etc were high quality, stylish and roomy. After spending a couple of days shopping around for similar level, i.e. well-reviewed 3/4 star hotels, in this beautiful city we went for this one as the deal we got (after making direct contact with the hotel rather than via a booking site) worked out around Â£200 cheaper over 3 nights than places more 'romantically' situated on the canals, even though it's only a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel to get to the nicer canal belt area to the west of the station, avoiding the seedier central area. The room (which we requested to be higher up for better views) enjoyed a commanding vista over the city, though lighter sleepers should consider requesting a room away from the station side, but this is just a minor point. The rooftop 'sky bar' is the real icing on the cake for this hotel though - it seems to be a very cool destination and is probably as good as it gets view-wise in the city, though on the downside there seemed to be a big corporate-banking function going on there on one night that excluded hotel guests, which we didn't appreciate. We didn't bother with the expensive breakfasts as there are plenty of good places to get good food & coffee close to the hotel - particularly the excellent 'Winkel' bakery/cafe. In all, we'd highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for a quite basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: Good points: - Very central - 50m from Central Station, 100m from the Red light district, 500m from Dam square - Clean - Apple computer/TV in every room - Good and fast service - Sky bar with a great view on the top - Free Wireless Not so good points: - Many rooms overlooking railways - DO NOT TAKE THEM! You can hear trains like they are in your room - Too expensive for a hotel that charge additionally for a shaving kit, for example (that should be for free) - During the traffic rush you need a lot of time to reach other parts of the city - if you are there for business - It's huge hotel - rooms are sometimes not cleaned until late afternoon (6pm) Good for tourists. There are better options if you are there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonAlexanderOng
Reviews.Content: It has taken me some time to finally write a review for my trip to Amsterdam back in August, but as they say, better late than never! My partner and I decided to head over to Amsterdam (our first time can you believe!) for 4 days during the middle of August and had a thoroughly enjoyable time over there, helped by the fact that we stayed in a fantastic hotel. The Mint Hotel, which is located only minutes from the Amsterdam Central station was clean, a stress-free experience, with service that was very helpful and friendly. We touched base with Daphne before we arrived in Amsterdam to request a quiet room with a good view, as well as gathering information from their Concierge on recommended activities for both us to do during our short stay there. Both of these requests were handled by them and we indeed got provided with a fantastic room giving us a view of the main town across the river with no noise distraction. The availability of having a Mac in all rooms was also an added bonus, which now makes me think why other hotels don't have something similar to this as it is something which is far more useful than you would think! Watching TV, surfing the net, and hotel information all on one device. One thing I recommend to people staying in the hotel is to check out The Sky Lounge - a spectacular place at the top of the hotel to relax and/or unwind after a long day out and about the town and can see why it is a popular setting! Overall, our stay at Mint Hotel was fantastic and will definitely be looking to stay here again on my next trip there. Another tip for those staying here is to book the hotel bicycles in advance of checking in. Amsterdam is a popular bicycle city, probably one of the best (if not THE best!) in Europe, and thus are in big demand. Unfortunately, there were none available to book when we were there, but we booked with a local rental company and only wished we hired earlier to use around the City!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel - still getting the kinks out”
Reviews.Author: dianet123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite new, the facilities are clean and modern, and the views are fabulous. If you can upgrade to the Club room with Balcony it is well worth the extra money. The rooms themselves are on the small side, with very limited storage space, but the balcony is large and usable, and ours had a fabulous view overlooking all of Old Amsterdam. Though it is not really in a neighborhood (it is near Central Station, across the tracks from all of Amsterdam), the location was OK, because of the view and also because the trams all converge on Central Station, so it is easy to get almost anywhere in town. On the downside, when I was there the hotel was understaffed. The first day, my room did not get cleaned until I returned back in the evening and called down to request it. Even on later days, cleaning did not occur until very late afternoon - often at a time that was inconvenient for me. There was usually a bit of a wait at the concierge desk, and the quality of the staff was mixed - they had some excellent people, and also some who were not very helpful at all. and some design elements were just not well thought out. For example, the only phone was located next to the bed, and this was a corded phone. So if you should want to place a business call while sitting at the desk, you would need to use your cell phone - the cord won't reach.

Reviews.Title: “no ...there absolutely anything better”
Reviews.Author: samodagreat
Reviews.Content: No...I have never had (and am still having) a 5 star over all treatment from any hotel anywhere. Being a very picky well traveled American, most are annoyed at the difference of European hotel standards and ratings, this is one of the finest AMSTERDAM hotels in oh so many ways. With THE MINT I receiving a 5 star treatment for a price of a 4 star (prices in Amsterdam the time of travel), by taking advantage of one of their many deals. In twenty years of travel to Amsterdam, I have never been ever been treated in Amsterdam like I wanted to TOTALLY be treated, until now. Thank you to the total staff and management during my stay at the end of September

Reviews.Title: “INCOMPETENT, DISHONEST, SELF-SERVING STAFF...”
Reviews.Author: swjad1
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel but after staying there for eight nights I need a holiday. Yes, it's in a good location with good facilities but let itself down by having uncomfortable beds (I changed room due to several rooms being blah-spots for wifi and mobile reception.) and unhelpful, badly trained staff who have obviously never worked in a supposed 4/5 star hotel before. Here's a list of incompetence and self-serving that is jus not acceptable: - My bag was lost changing rooms. - Taxis are called by the front desk as they take a commission on every fare. Call the local company it's cheaper and quicker by about 15mins on average. - Beds are uncomfortable â€“ too hard. - Room charges from other people on my room. The response from the girl on the front desk, "What do you care your company's paying for it." WOW...! - The Sky Bar â€“ I asked a waiter if he could bring my drinks outside onto the roof terrace. He replied, "It's too cold, we're not aloud to go outside because it's too cold." But wait it gets better. Moments later a waitress came out onto the terrace, no not to serve someone because remember it's to cold, but to have a fag break. Yes, a fag break. Next to paying guest who have been told their staff can't provide a out service because it's too cold. So really, the fact that it's in a great location and has a great view was overshadowed, by incompetent, dishonest, self-serving staff. What a shocker. Would I stay there again, ONLY IF THEY CHANGE MANAGEMENT, STAFF AND THE BEDS... TERRIBLE...!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: tareva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. The hotel was very modern. The staff were especially friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was exceptional with alot of choice. The iMac in the room was great with free wifi. The hotel is central to everything in Amsterdam and we never had to use public transport. We arrived early for check in and this was not a problem we were given a room straight away. Loved staying here and would stay here again if visiting Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rates location and service”
Reviews.Author: foxyroybelfast
Reviews.Content: Booked for myself wife and two grown up daughters for a weekend. Hotel is easy walking distance of central rail station. Not too many guests as newly opened. Rooms were good but make sure you book room with a view over the canals and not internal walls. Staff very friendy and quick to help. Had problems with Mac/tv and there was someone at door to rectify situation wihin two minutes.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: The Mint hotel is just a short walk from the central station, We had no queue on arrival, and i asked for a sea view and this was complied with. Our room was a good size, and the provision of an apple mac that could be used as our TV and an on line computer was wonderful. Staff are very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to be of assistance. do not miss out on the sky lounge experience and the afternoon apple pie. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, you will not be disappointed, dont let the building going on near by put you off we did not even hear it. Well worth the excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “A central location, friendly helpful staff,and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Javabeandog
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam in July without any hotel reservations, and was very happy to find the Mint Hotel. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and modern. There is free wi-fi in the room and an Apple computer/tv was very helpful to have without having to pay for additional computer time. Since I travel with a small budget, I went out to breakfast instead of going to the hotel's restaurant which was out of my budget. My room faced the railroad track but the noise was never a problem, and I am a light sleeper. Walked to the train station, less than a five minutes away, and took the train to the airport. The location is great and walked everywhere. I would go back to this hotel when back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “well located, comfortable for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: naina6
Reviews.Content: The Mint Hotel is very well located - just a few minutes walk from the main train and tram station. The room we got overlooked the city and was comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside we faced was at breakfast time. We opted to eat at the hotel. The service was slow and shoddy. Apart from that our stay at the hotel was good... perfect for the 4 days were there.

Reviews.Title: “over priced!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubblegum5131
Reviews.Content: Totally regret staying here.. we thought we'd pay more for a (what seemed like) a more up-market, comfortable hotel... well!! We had to wait ages to check in.. I get that.. Then we gave our card payment details etc and left our luggage so we could come back later when our room was ready. When we came back later on it took at least 15 mins to see us and get our luggage.. Also they had to book us in again and also asked for card details etc again!! So we explained that we had done all this before so it must be on their system and if not then where?!? Anyway, the first time we booked in we (two couples) were offered adjoining rooms to which we accepted and was pleased about however our rooms ended up being on the complete opposite side of the hotel!! No apologys off the rude staff.. Me and my partner were pleased with our room even though we had hand lotion in the bathroom and that was it.. Also we didn't have a double bed!! Just two singles pushed together. We had a good view over the river though.. My brothers room was awful though!! Just one window (we had 3) and it over looked train tracks!! Same thing with the single beds pushed together. Also weird thing is he had all the toiletries why didn't we?!? He had shampoo, conditioner, lotion etc!! It was in a good location.. (ish) and the food was quite nice but that's it!!! For the money we paid we could of gone to a much nicer hotel, maybe even grand nh rather than the awfully over priced Mint hotel!! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “good for all travelers”
Reviews.Author: Siam-Orchids
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September, 2011. Hotel is ok, easy to spot from the train station and just a short walk. Very convenient due to its location near every tram in Amsterdam. Room is kind of small, but adequate. Bathroom is ok but they should give larger bars of soap. Not too many amenities but it doesn't claim to be the Four Seasons. All in all, a good convenient hotel, perfect for business or tourists. I'd stay there again. I upgraded to a Club room on the 10th floor. Mistake. Their 11th floor has a disco and the party ends at 2 AM. The noise was horrible with loud bad music and a DJ with a microphone. After the party ended, I had to listen to chairs being dragged along the wooden floor. Of course, I complained. The night duty manager that I spoke to was not very customer service oriented. His response to my complaint was absurd and totally unprofessional and I hope that senior management sits him down for a talking to. He was totally incompetent and instead of making me feel a little better, he just made me angrier. But the next morning, when I spoke to the front desk about the previous night's unpleasant events, they admitted that they had many complaints, that the party was a mistake and they credited that nights lodging and adjusted my bill immediately. The front desk ladies were very apologetic and customer service oriented and I left feeling good about the Mint Hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern hotel perfect for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: I was initially put off this hotel due to proximity to the train station, and although it isn't the most salubrious area I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely return. Very comfortable and spacious rooms, clean and new. Free Wifi throughout (hurrah!) and good value and reasonably healthy in-room dining options for those nights where you have to work late. I really enjoyed the smoked haddock fish cakes. Continental breakfast is very reasonable when compared to other Amsterdam hotels. Very friendly reception staff. Visit the Sky Lounge on the 11th floor for stunning views over Amsterdam. My room was very quiet on the 4th floor overlooking the square (as opposed to the station side - I can see how overlooking the station may be noisy).

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but only showers”
Reviews.Author: danromeo
Reviews.Content: Good location, except when you try to get there by car which is nearly impossible. Rooms are adequate if you take care to ask for a room NOT FACING THE RAILWAY TRACKS because in those you will not be able to sleep. There are no bathtubs, just showers and a little cramped at that. Don't pay too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities not worth anything when you can't sleep”
Reviews.Author: Gemnabarclay
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel at the moment. Rooms have wonderful facilities and the staff seem friendly enough. However, all the facilities and extras mean nothing when there is a nightclub playing dance music until 3 in the morning on a Friday and Saturday. All I need from a hotel is somewhere to sleep and this hotel does not even manage that.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good but watch out for check in staff”
Reviews.Author: colsy54
Reviews.Content: stayed here first 4 days in september,check in made rather awkward by a rather rude girl at reception who forced a fairly shoddy room on us.We needed twin beds but she said a queen bed was all that was available, if we wanted twin beds we would have to wait , we reluctantly agreed ,on arriving in the room it was clear it was a single room with a (very small) double bed in it .Also curtains would not close and air conditioning would not switch off. We went back to complain and she told us she was busy and waved us away , went to another point and got a lovely twin room witha great view from a much nicer man . This was the only problem , hotel is good overall but watchout for miss twisted face at check in .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: djhenryhall
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new property located centrally in Amsterdam about 3-5 minutes away from the train station. The hotel has a very trendy vibe with well dressed guests. Although the rooms were not spacious, my room did come with a iMac attached to the desk. This made it very convenient to look up information, check email, etc. and not worry about connecting my laptop to the hotel's wireless connection. The roofdeck has great view of the city and the restaurant food was good. I would definitely stay here the next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel and great location but get a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be decent and liked cleanliness as well as location. Service was polite too. Yet my first room was on the side with the railroad tracks. Avoid at all costs. Even though I was on 7th floor, it was unbearable. Switched to other side on 9th floor and it was far better. The rooms are all the same, fairly generic but efficient. Breakfast was a disappointment though. Poor selection and unappealing food. Seemed like it sat out too long an selection was poorly and mostly unhealthy options. Also found the pricing, both for rooms and breakfast to be way out of proportion to what you got....come on, â‚¬16 for a buffet breakfast with this junk? I guess you pay for the location. I'd probably not come back here but you could also do much worse in Amsterdam I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay except check in/out”
Reviews.Author: ktmp13
Reviews.Content: This brand new property offers very nice, modern accomodations, as evidenced by the hordes of young, well-dressed patrons. The rooms are of average size, comfortable with few furnishings. The free in-room internet use was a nice perk. Everything is very clean and crisp. The location is great because it's near the train station. For what you get, I personally think this place is overpriced. We only stayed here because we went to tourism services near the train station and were given a superb deal. I don't think I would EVER pay the full price here (or nearly anywhere that charges that much). Check in and check out are a complete nightmare. If you have a flight to catch, I highly urge you to leave half an hour of extra time just to wait in line at the desk. The staff does the best they can, but rarely have I ever seen such lines at a hotel. I'm not exaggerating when I say it's typical to have upwards of 15-20 people in line ahead of you. There is a balcony on one of the upper floors for guests to lounge, which gave wonderful views of the city. The bar also has great views. Drinks are pricey and service spotty, but if you're in the mood for that, it's fun. I'd stay here again, but only if I got another fabulous deal.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, but what about firedrills?”
Reviews.Author: Daffe
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this is a very good hotel, and that I agree with all the other reviews that says the same. But if you look beyond that, what if there was a fire at this place? I'm asking because the fire alarm went off at about 0130 am the second night I was there and the staff seemed to me like they were not trained to handle this. We evacuated our room quickly and took the stairs down from our floor (8.) My girlfriend was first and when she came one floor down she met one of the staff telling her not to worry and return to the room. You don't do that when the alarm is telling you to evacuate! There was no sign of panic, people were going in an orderly fashion. On our way down the alarm stopped. When we came down to the lobby one of the staff from the reception came and said that there was probably not a fire and that the elevators would start again soon. After a few minutes the elevators started and we took one up to the eight floor. On the way up the alarm started in what I assume was the fifth floor as we were passing. That's not a good feeling when you are going up. Coming up to our floor one staff member was standing there in the hallway saying that it was probably nothing, and if it was anything it was that someone had smoked in the room. He said we could go back to our room as the alarm only went off on the floor that would have an actual fire. As far as I know the alarm usually goes off in the entire building to alert everyone. This was not reassuring. We took a quick check in the hallway and stairs to see if we could smell any smoke and waited 15 minutes in our room to be ready if the alarm came on again, witch it didn't. This incident showed me that this was something the staff needs to practise on. Besides from this we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Beautiful_life23
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend through British Airways at the last minute and recieved a good deal at the Mint Hotel. As other reviewers have noted, the property is brand new and everything is in top conidition. The location is very easy from the train station and close enough to be able to explore this wonderful city. The room was comfortable although a little sparcely furnished, and the staff were pleasant. The roof top bar is a wonderful vantage point but we experienced very poor service and were asked to move twice as various parts of the bar were closing (well before midnight which was strange). Overall, we would probably stay at a different hotel next time in Amsterdam - it was good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: smd28970
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things to say about the Mint Hotel that I am not quite sure where to start. My husband and I stayed at the Mint hotel in the middle of our trip around the world. By the time that we checked in we had been traveling for close to 50 days and so all hotel rooms started to look the same. I was a little hesitant to book it at first because Expedia had no images because its a new hotel but I am sooo glad I did. The location is perfect. Maybe a 3 minutes walk to Central Station. It is also about a 10 minute walk from the red light district. The staff is amazing and give a 5 star level of service at a very reasonable rate. They have Mac computers in every room and the beds are very comfortable. Also, have a great night lounge area at the top of the hotel that its amazing to look at the sky line of Amsterdam. One of the first days of my stay I got sick and they found me a doctor at 3am in less that 30 minutes. In addition to that they found me a taxi driver to pick up my prescriptions so that my husband could stay with me. The concierge was on top of all of our needs. The restaurants recommendations where also right on point. I highly recommend you visit the Bakers Winkle while you are there since it has great breakfast at good prices. Honestly, we have stayed in Ritz Carltons in the past and in hostels and the reason why this hotel is the best I have stayed at is the overall value. I actually missed the hotel after we left.

Reviews.Title: “polite staff and comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: pendyWirral
Reviews.Content: good quality hotel polite staff took forever to check ou though!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: gali f
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 days at the mint hotel, and let me just say, it's defiantly the best hotel I've ever been to in Europe . We arrived to the hotel in10am, the receptionist was very helpful, and when I asked her in she can give me a room with a window to the city, and not to the central station ( after reading about the noise in the rooms that turnes to the station here), she told me that if she'll have a room with a view to the city, she'll give it to me. We left the hotel, and came back on 3 pm, to receive our room. The rooms are spotless, it's a new hotel, so everything is still very clean. In the room you have a computer (iMac ) that also turns into tv. You also get bath row, and slippers, the bed Is the comfiest I have ever slept in, the shower is crazy!!! You can choose the exact temperature you want the water to be, and just turn it on. You also have safe in the room, a mini bar, a coffee and tea kit ( 5-7different kind of tea, an instant coffee, some milk, sweeteners and sugar. Also in the room is an iron and an iron bad, and a little office desk. The breakfast was more that enough for us: you have a tray with 3 kind of cheeses, 5 kinds of cold Meets such as pastrami, salami, prechuto, bacon etc', you have 2 kinds of sandwiches( one croissant with tomato, butter and cheese, and one with tomato and lax), you have 4 kind of breads, some crackers, brioche, muffins, fruit salad, fruists, plane yogurt, muzzli, dried fruits, cereals, milk, fresh squeezed orane juice grapefruit and apple juice, tomato juice, jams, honey, basically you don't need more, Location: when you cross to other side of the road, you get to the bars, coffee shops,restaurants, everything is there. Dam square is 3 minutes walking, you don't have to take any tram, just walk to the other side. One tip!!! The central station is right next to the hotel, you have resturnts,burger king, Starbucks, supermarkets, everything you need there, the city is very expensive, and there you can fibe cheeper things. Overall, the best hotel you can find in Amsterdam city center

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous surprise! This is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: LadnerLady
Reviews.Content: The magic words "free WiFi" greeted us at the front door and then, surprise surprise, an iMac in every room! Wow. The iMac's make great TV's and of course with the keyboard and mouse, an easy way to work on line. Beyond the technology, the location on the harbour beside the train station is really convenient. The hotel room has everything you need; kettle for and tea and coffee, hair dryer, nice bathroom, comfy beds, desk and chair and a safe. It's a new place and I hope the hotel keeps things neat and clean as it could look shabby easily with basic white walls. As much as I love the old hotels in Amsterdam, you can't beat the new Mint for convenience. This is a gem. Make sure you go up to the rooftop restaurant and bar for a splendid view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing modern Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ell23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a very good location. Was a few minutes walk from the station and the city centre. The hotel was. Very clean and the rooms very tidy. Really loved the apple mac in the room. Although hated the two single beds pushed together. The sky lounge was Superb with a wonderful view and great atmosphere. Although the drunk prices were very expensive. We ate out every night as the food was very expensive to. I would definatly recommend this hotel for all couples.

Reviews.Title: “In Mint Condition”
Reviews.Author: Triciatravel930
Reviews.Content: Location, location! Mint certainly hits the spot with its prime location; a short walk from Central Station. Customer Service has been given a high priority here as all the staff are incredibly friendly,welcoming and helpful. Long may this continue as it does make a difference. Given that space can be at a premium in Amsterdam hotel rooms, bedrooms and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. Position the shower carefully as this area can get quite wet. Toiletries are of a generous size. The Sky Lounge is amazing, with fantastic views of the cityscape and a very lively vibe! It's a good evening venue although wine, in keeping with the rest of the city, is expensive. Food in the restauraunt, at dinner, is well presented, imaginative but minimal in size; the bread is excellent. However, eating out in Europe is now more expensive. Our wake up alarm call did not happen but perhaps we were just unlucky on this occasion. Would definitely return and hope that the high standards of service are just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it & will go back”
Reviews.Author: orliemac
Reviews.Content: on arrival to this hotel, we were met by very polite, courteous & well dressed staff who all spoke excellent english. while waiting to check in, we were offered iced water but the wait for check in was no time at all. the rooms are spacious, very clean and modern, equipped with robes, etc. the staff were helpful at all times, providing information on excursions and sight seeing. on check out, again there were no delays even though the queue was quite long and as we were not flying until that evening, we were able to leave our bags in the hotel while we went out for the day, the staff also arranged a taxi to bring us to the airport. the only negative, & its a small complaint, would be the price of the food in the restaurant compared to what can be found locally but then you are paying for the service, atmosphere, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel and the service and the staff and location! I will definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Noa3205
Reviews.Content: Great generouse breakfast! Bicycle rental service, nice and patient hotel staff. No activities in the hotel. We had the rooms with the bad view, and also the window was tiny!!! and a lot of noise from the train down stairs. small rooms with nice place to sit and computer with WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “Very contemporary hotel with the best views of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: G C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in August and had a really good time. Location: The location is perfect, just a few minutes walk from Centraal Train Station. Rooms: Every room has an imac which has numerous tv channels and complimentary wi-fi - a real plus if you forgot your time out guide and want to do some research! Be sure to get a room with a city view or you might be overlooking the train tracks at the back of the hotel. The rooms are quite compact but sufficient for a couple. Service: Very good indeed. Polite and friendly without the pretentiousness of most contemporary venues Food: Very good. They had a 2 course lunch with a glass of wine for â‚¬15 which includeed a lobster and fennel salad follwed by halibut. Fantastic. Other wise the food is a little pricier. Best feature: The Sky Lounge on the 11th floor has fantatstic views of the city with floor to ceiling windows and two outdoor areas. It is great to visit day or night and â‚¬4 for a bottle of heineken is pretty much what you pay in most bars in the city. In summary, if you are looking for a reasonably priced contemporary 4star hotel this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chalk35
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel. It looks very impressive from the outside with it's full length windows and a bonus being only a 5 min walk from central station. On arrival, the staff were very friendly and welcoming offering any information (if needed) on getting around Amsterdam. We had a minor glitch on getting the key cards to work in the elevator and on returning to reception (twice)! they were very aplogetic and gave us a new set of keys. The room was exactly as described, with the modern deco, including an apple iMac in each room (living area separate from bedroom). The room was serviced each day, even when we didn't go out til later one day. Also, after returning back late one evening we decided to have meal through room service. It was wonderful! The service was prompt and courteous and the food was amazing!!! The price was even less than what we had paid at an 'average' restaurant the previous night.. I was very impressed! All in all, a fantastic experience in a hotel with a great location. Central...but not smack, bang in the middle of it all. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Celan Modern Room ,Slow Service , Bad Smell of drug duirng the night inside the room ,Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Farshad74
Reviews.Content: I was in this Hotel from 25 to 28 Aug Positive : 1-very good welcome service from Mr Leon in Front Desk ( a tall and handsome Man ) . special thanks to him as they gave me very good room and a lot of information about city ,he respects all the guests and he has smile all the time to guests which is good .he did respect to me like a king 2-very good service in the resto from Mr Kim ,Mr Toni ,Mr Martinj ,Mrs Erika , Mrs Stephanie 3-Very Good View in my Room ( room 527 ) 4- Good location ,near central station and Hop on hope off bus and canal bus 5- clean and good quality room ,modern room and technology 6- free high speed internet 7- free umbrella for you in a rainy day in amsterdam from front desk which was a good gift. 8- a welcome drink from front desk Negative : 1-expensive price for room . 2-very expensive breakfast 3-smell of drug during the night from other room !!!! which was a bad memory as it is normal in Amsterdam . so the hotel should use a good system to reduce the bad smell to make a good air for the rooms and guests who dose not like to smell drug . 4- it was a 15 euro card for resto for lunch as advertisement and the resto team didnâ€™t inform me about it ,so I paid more than 30 euro 2 times and the last day I could find this cards on the front desk and used it . so It is good that you ask this cards from front desk to save money . 5- the team in sky bar are not friendly and dose not have smile and they didnâ€™t show me a good welcome 6-the housekeeping forgot 2 times to put shampoo and bath gel for me and I called them 2 times and wait for it 30 minutes . 7- the service for check in and check out is slow and you have to wait and wait 8- the reception dose not answer the phone and you have to call and call and call â€¦â€¦ 9- very slow service from houskeeping . 1 day they didnt clean my room ,untile the time that i called them , however i put the card on the door to clean the room . Finally I would like to recommend this hotel for Location and Clean and modern room . Choose the train from airport to central station for 5 euro and it takes 15 minutes . Choose hope on hope off bus if you like to see amstedram from the top as when you are in the Canal bus ,you see everything from the river and when it is rain ,the window of Canal bus is not very clear to take photo Special Thanks to Mr Leon in Front desk and Mrs. Erica and Mr. Kim in Resto who gave me a good hospitality and respect me all the time very good .

Reviews.Title: “New, Modern, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: checkincheck0ut
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at this brand new hotel for 3 nights. We were a big family so we had a few rooms booked at this hotel. When we arrived, we didn't have much of a first impression, other than the fact that there were still some construction around the area, and that the main entrance was at the back where we had to pass some construction looking area, but I'm sure that'll get cleaned up soon. When we proceeded to check-in, it was very crowded. I think there was a tour checking in or checking out right before us, so that was quite a wait. The interior lobby is very modern, not the classic stuff that you'll see in Paris, but very clean and new, which is what we were looking for. The hallway of the rooms or the lift didn't scream luxury, they were in fact very basic. The rooms also had that same theme but there were a few things we really loved about the hotel rooms. First of all, the iMac desktop each room had. The system was nice, you could watch TV, surf the internet, play music, etc from the desktop, it was very easy to use and a really nice touch. The free wi-fi in every room was also a huge plus. I think hotels that charge for internet are very outdated, so this should set a good precedent. Service in general was top notch. They had receptionists of various nationalities all speaking very good english and were very helpful, even though the hotel was often crowded with people checking in or out. The breakfast was excellent. They didn't have huge varieties, but everything they had was good quality and very generous. It was buffet style, and for drinks you could have coffee, tea, hot chocolate, or any of the fresh juices on tap. If you book this hotel, you should get the breakfast included, it really makes your day, and starts it off well. The bathroom was very minimalist, but most importantly, was spotless and clean. In fact, you couldn't tell that its ever been used, which was perfect. They had pump liquid soap for shower which was a nice touch. It doesn't have a bathtub and was compact, however it was sufficient. Location was also good, 5 minute walk to Central Station which is the hub of Amsterdam. And calling taxis was easy and convenient. Trams and buses are also nearby, giving you many options for transportation. The Sky Lounge was decent but didn't really eat or chill there so can't really comment. If I had any complaints, it'd be the following : The gym was alright, didn't have any windows, so running on the treadmills, you'd be facing a concrete wall. And it isn't as nice as those 5 star hotel gyms in Asia, but then again, Mint isn't a 5 star typical hotel, its more of the high-tech boutique hotel of modern feel. Secondly, I don't think there was a pool, so that was that. Overall, loved this hotel, really made the Amsterdam visit very pleasant. I had walked past a few other hotels nearby with good locations, they were all very dated. This was really the best option if you're looking for a clean and new hotel, one where you'd happily step on the carpet or the bathroom barefeet without that instinctive desire to curl your toes to avoid grimes. Definitely recommend this to any Amsterdam visitors. P.S. The Guest Services were also awesome, they had tickets for any shows or daily excursions, and they handled restaurant reservations very efficiently. I don't know if Dutch efficiency is the reason, but this Hotel was definitely very timely and efficient in their service.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt recommending Mint Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rpmartins
Reviews.Content: On arrival, stands out the very impersonal style of the lobby, with a colder ambiance than an airport. Staff is dressed in black with (few) green stripes that give the impression they are soldiers of MintÂ´s army, but the receptionÂ´s service is very good in very well spoken english, guessing what we wanted without needing to ask, like taking care of luggage after checking out till departure time. All common spaces were clean but some specific zones looked like they were in repair works: air ducts visible, puddles on the tile floor near big windows, elevators hall being painted in the afternoon, but nothing that interfered with the functionality. First impression of the room was very good: spotless and with sober decoration. WiFi works very well and the hotel's Mac with radio and TV broadcast with remote control is useful and looks nice with the decor. Our room overlooks railway lines, but itÂ´s almost at the same level of the trains (3rd floor) and I expected noise. Really it was no outside noise at all, because the thick glass walls and the unique small window that could be opened and closed closed the external sounds, like trains or music in the courtyard, were muted and we could "enjoy" the continuous murmur of a ventilation or any other system different than the AC in our room, because with the AC switched off the sound continued without interruption. Air conditioning system should be malfunctioning because always produced a light cold breeze even in the hottest position. Fortunately the air openings arenÂ´t over the bed and the room was comfortable with the AC off, so it didnÂ´t became a problem. The morning we checked out the AC panel is blinking, probably informing that is really damaged. The bed mattress is too smooth for my taste, giving the feeling of sinking. I prefer stiffer ones. The pillows are very good. I need to be well covered while sleeping otherwise I get cold very easily. Nevertheless the bed cover was very very hot, making me sweat with t-shirt and shorts pajamas. Should be excelent for winter but not for summer nights, dispite the rain and the 14ÂºC temperatures in the outside. Right in front of the glass walls of the bedroom there is a courtyard with ambient music being played, accessible from the third and fourth floor. Could be used to breath fresh air or to smoke. ItÂ´s all uncovered so itÂ´s a useful place if it isnÂ´t raining. The ambient music should be at a lower volume, because itÂ´s too imposing in the bedrooms near if the window is open. Bathroom has a good shower. The lavatoryÂ´s flat design difficult residues draining The room is equipped with hair drier, iron and ironing board, refrigerator, water boiling pot ,safe box and only one robe (strange for a double room). We chose this hotel essentially because itÂ´s near to Centraal Station (5 mins walk) and we donÂ´t regret. Arriving to a unknown city and getting so easily to the hotel without additional transportation or doubts about where to head is fantastic. Altogether, weÂ´ve no doubt recommending this hotel for a visit to Amsterdam (value for money, convenient location, helpful staff). ItÂ´s not an hotel to create romantic moods but for that thereÂ´s the streets and channels of AÂ´damÂ´s city!

Reviews.Title: “New, Stylish but Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: peetzs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 day visit to Amsterdam. The location is very good, being right next to Central Station, but can be a little far from some of the tourist spots such as the Museums, Leidseplein and Jordaan. The hotel itself is very well presented, and staff very polite. However, on one day we left the room at around 10am and returned at 4.30pm to find that the room had not yet been cleaned (even though we had left the 'clean me' tag on the outside of the door). We had to ask at reception 3 times for the room to be cleaned, and over and hour and a half later it eventually was. The towels that we were promised immediately upon complaining turned up over 2 hours later. At no point were we offered anything to appease us, staff simply apologised and were ineffectual, although polite. This was disappointing, as apart from this, the stay was extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Our great trip”
Reviews.Author: eviefo
Reviews.Content: 3 day trip to Amsterdam the mint hotel is lovely and very central pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel next to Central Train station”
Reviews.Author: NWDEE
Reviews.Content: Had great stay for 5 nights with 10month old son. Really enjoyed stay in this new and modern hotel. Loved the iMac and it was a new experience for us. Hotel staff was really friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was ok but only cold items. If you want anything hot and warm ( eggs, sausages etc) you have to order separate and I found them bit expensive and not worth (just a scramble eggs will cost you 8.50â‚¬). Otherwise cafe staff gave great service and took care very well. Even the hotel is located just next to the main train station, inside the hotel it is quite and no disturbances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location but train noise ruined it a little”
Reviews.Author: NCL19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mint Hotel in Amsterdam for 3 nights in August 2011. The hotel is very close to the main station which is great, easy walking distance to all of the main areas of Amsterdam but the down side is the railway at the back of the hotel. We requested when booking a room at the front of the hotel as advised by other reviewers but were told this would not be guaranteed unless we paid extra which I didn't think acceptable so we risked it and unfortunately we ended up with a room on the back which meant the noise of the railway! Apart from the railway noise which could keep a light sleeper awake or disturb their sleep, luckily I always pack ear plugs when staying in hotels, everything about the hotel was very nice and I would definitely recommend to anyone wishing to travel to Amsterdam. Only flaw was the housekeeping of the bedrooms. We left our room at 11am on the first day and got back at 5pm to find out room still hadn't been cleaned and towels not been replaced etc. The cleaner knocked on our door at half past 5 to clean the room which we turned away because we were relaxing before going out for the evening and only got her to replace the towels. The next day we got back at 6pm and the room had been cleaned and beds made etc but small things like replacing the used dirty glasses with new clean glasses and leaving extra toilet roll hadn't been done. We ordered room service on the first night which was excellent food but portion on the small side, breakfast was excellent, best I've ever had continental style and we had lunch on the day we left in the Lobby Bar which was very good but again on the small side. All in all I would recommend but not so much if you are a light sleeper! Bed comfy, just a little too soft for me though.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: athenaeastbourne
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this fantastic hotel and cannot praise it more highly. The staff were absolutely delightful...so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was varied and excellent but rather expensive so would suggest a bed and breakfast package. Location perfect being about 2 minutes from the station and canal trips; and 5 minutes to the centre of Amsterdam. The free use of an Apple imac computer / television in your room was an added bonus. The bedrooms are a good size and en-suite spotless; Mist free mirrors and fab power shower. We asked for a city view having noted previous comments about the noise of the station, and were not disappointed..but if you are not bothered about the trains the view over the river is also stunning. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “New is Nice”
Reviews.Author: dansingdan
Reviews.Content: Travelling alone, this was a weeknd getaway from my business in Germany. Check-in was slow. Since a large group showed up just before me, I was willing to be patient. Several other staff were moving in and out of the reception area but never looked to see how long the queue had become. It would also help if they had an area marked where one line can form and check in people in the order of arrival. Was given room #909. Nice but very noisy due to trains and the steel-on-steel noise of their wheels. After an hour I requested a different room and, though reluctant, was given #425 which faced the front. What a difference, beautiful view and completely quiet. Tried to rent a bycycle on Saturday but they had run out. Visiting the city was wonderful, a good place to learn how to enjoy life. Did not eat in the Hotel but did go up to the Skylounge to take in a spectacular view. Overall it was a good experience - a modern facility with a very young and freindly staff trying their best to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor experience”
Reviews.Author: bjames81878
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mint Hotel from The 18th through the 21st of August. I made the booking based on the recommendations of other Trip Advisors and thought I'd leave some leeway for service being a little below standards due to the fact they were new. But they pushed the bar even lower! My wife and I booked a Club Room with a Balcony. Upon arriving at 10am our room was not ready (which we were fine with) and we were given a voucher by Frank (who was very nice) to sit in the city cafÃ© and have a drink while we waited 20 minutes. That 20 minutes turned into 6 hours!! We ventured into the city and got absolutely soaked, came in dripping to find that now at 4pm (well after check-in time) our room was still not ready. So, Mandy and Frank at the front desk did the right thing and upgraded us to a Club Suite. The Club Suite was clean and came with fruit and water (minus the bottle of bubbly Frank mentioned we'd get because it was my birthday but hey ho). But from here the service just continued downward. We asked for our room to be tidied. We walked past the cleaners at 3pm expecting that they'd been. We had to call to ask for service and the cleaning staff waited until 5pm to tidy our room and once they did, they put the fruit discards and plates outside our door and there they sat for 24 hours! When they finally took the plates (after a few phone calls) they took the cutlery and set it on the windowsill outside our room. It was still out there when we checked out! May I remind you, these rooms are one step down from their super-swanky City Suites with massive balconies. You'd expect at least good service in this level of suite. I understand they are a young hotel but 4 stars is a huge reach! Excellent front desk staff, great location, poor cleaning and floor management. At 4 stars, you'd at least get a turn-down service in the evening... nothing! We did get a random guy at 10am, knocking because he wanted to inspect our minibar, I asked him to wait until we'd left for the day. The iMac system is nice and the view (we were in room 710) was gorgeous! But sadly, everything else felt like a typical mid-range Holiday Inn and we were sorely disappointed. Of course, I didn't let it ruin my Birthday. But just don't go in expecting anything you would in an actual 4-star hotel. As much as I travel to Amsterdam, it would be a hard-sell to get me to spend that much money for that level of service again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Antsgoneout
Reviews.Content: Nice modern room, great bathroom and the iMac which i'm writing this on is v good. Location by Centraal Station. However I've just been incessantly queue jumped whilst waiting for guest services and its given me the hump, some better process would help. Waiting twenty minutes for coffee at breakfast didnt help either.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hopping hotel. Good disabled room.”
Reviews.Author: abu-noah
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location seem central (near the station and all)... It is not really in the middle of the happening Amsterdam . The hotel is new, clean, fresh, and that alone is good for Amsterdam. The lobby is totally uninspiring and railway station looking, but efficient. The rooms are nicely appointed (love the iMac as tv/Internet terminal!!!) and the facilities are good. At checkin , at 6pm, the room was not ready, so after a bit of hassle and arguing, the room was suddenly declared clean and we were given a few drink vouchers for the bar at the top. Nice gesture. All in all, good hotel. (and yeah, parking costs 45per day... But that is Amsterdam! It's everywhere!)

Reviews.Title: “new and fancy...”
Reviews.Author: BozzyNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two weeks after their opening and therefore we were forgiving for small flaws. I have to say for the first time in Amsterdam I stayed in a decent size room. iMacs for TV, dependable WiFi, good house keeping. They were having trouble with the breakfast service when it was crowded only because they were insisting to give a face to face service. Just give people their coffee as soon as you can and it will be fine... Nobody will complain...

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: littlefairy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend at the end of July. We booked the hotel on a special deal as they were obviously trying to encourage visitors as it's such a new hotel. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, we checked in quickly and were given a room when we arrived at 10am, which was great. The room is lovely, it felt like we were the first people to use it! Being new, it was immaculate - super comfy bed, great shower, tea facilities, bath robe, safe, etc. Views could be good depending on location, we could actually see into other rooms out of our window, which isn't ideal. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because it wasn't included in our package and was VERY expensive (â‚¬16 for continental, â‚¬26 for cooked...crazy!). The location is good and bad - very close to the main train station, so excellent for coming in from the airport, but that is also the furthest north you're likely to want to visit in the city, so for the southern attractions, eg Van Gogh museum, it's quite a way. We were happy to walk everywhere, but it was a good half an hour to the southern side of the city. The Sky Lounge bar on the top floor of the hotel is AMAZING - you should visit even if you aren't staying at the hotel (which you can) as the views are the best. Brilliant at night looking out over the city. Overall, we would visit this hotel again at the price we paid, but I don't know how likely that would be! We definitely wouldn't pay more. It is very nice as it's so new, and the location is convenient for the train station. Liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 5kinnydip
Reviews.Content: we were on a weekend away with friends and we stayed for 2 nights, it was really lovely and not far from the center. The staff were friendly and helpful and not imposing throughout our stay. The sky lounge bar is fantastic has great views and has a good vibe in the evenings although the service is slow if you are sitting on the terrace. The rooms were spotless and have floor to ceiling windows. The only real down side to this hotel is, it is next to the central station so you can hear the trains, having said this we will definitely stay here again if we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 4cranbourne
Reviews.Content: great new hotel in amsterdam, only 5 minutes away from the train station. We had a great experience in the amsterdam: the hotel is brand new, extremely clean and the rooms are very comfortable and quiet with no noise coming from the outside corridors. The staff was very very friendly and helpful, always with a smile on their face and ready to assist and give suggestions on the best way to enjoy the city. The breakfast was great: good choice of pastries and fruit and everything you would expect in a continental breakfast (that was included in our rate). The staff, again, was very friendly and all the environment helped to have a pleasant start of the day. The only negative note is the room cleaning: once we went for breakfast and at 9 the cleaner was in the room - a bit too early. the following mornings we left the `please do not disturb sign on the door` as we saw others so and this little issue was avoided. I would definitely go back to this hotel in a future trip in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but be alert in all communication with staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Daemen
Reviews.Content: When we visited the hotel was open for a week. It felt like we were the first to sleep in our room, which was nice. We had two rooms next to eachother with a connecting door. This is far better than a regular family room, we usually get with in most cases extra beds of lower quality cramped into it. We had a quite big room for ourselves (817) and a smaller one for our children (818). The rooms had a panoramaview on the city which was very nice to just look around at night. I suppose there are rooms on the backside (where the trains pass, so ask for a frontal room). We arrived a quarter of an hour early and got a welcome drink at the bar. In the meantime they brought our luggage to the room. During unpacking room service brought over 2 bottles of water, which was very considerate considering it was rather warm in Amsterdam. Breakfast was ok, being included in the price. When I would have paid seperatly for it, probably I would be somewhat dissappointed (16 euro/person). There is a possibility to have warm extras (scramled eggs, sausages,...) for a 10 euro surcharge. I did not witness anyone opting for it. At the buffet you'll find cereals,juices, pastry, fruit, yoghurt,... The only way you can clearly see that the hotel has just opened is the different standards of experience of the staff. The fact that there is a IMac on the room that can also be used as tv set worked out fine for us. The kids (7 & 9) played some online games as we rested a bit. For Belgian clients, there are no Belgian tv-chains available (which you will normally find in the Netherlands). No real problem for us. You can follow some stuff via streaming (I followed soccer Belgium-Turkey via radiostream). For guests coming by car. Parking can become very costly in Amsterdam. We parked our car at P+R Zeeburg which is just a 10 minute tram ride to Central Station (which is litterally next door). They charge 8 euro/day and you get a return tram ticket for max 5 persons. All this would normally make me quote the hotel at least very good. Why Average? Their administration is not up to the standards of a 4-star. First I had to renegociate a rate I found on the Mint-website. But as I was open for a compromise we managed. What really is unacceptable is that after our stay they asked by mail for a confirmation that they could charge our creditcard. They said they forgot on checkout. No problem. I pay for what I have gotten. When my creditcard details arrived suddenly we seemed to have been charged two times. Ok, they paid it back with excuses but I think compensation would have been appropriate. So I can recommend this hotel but always stay alert and look for sharp prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: djalan-djalan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new so everything was very clean and in good shape. There's an apple computer which you can also use to browse the internet and to watch tv. The bed however, it consists of 2 single beds with wheels so when you put them together, it can move and feels unconfortable. The location is a good advantage as well as a disadvantage. As it is located next to Amsterdam Centraal, of course it is easy to reach the city centre within walking distance. However every 15 minutes, you can hear the loud sounds of the train passing in front of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahlovescats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the hotel. The staff were great, could not do enough. The room was big and had great facilities such as an apple mac/UK TV, safe and ironing board. As it is a new hotel the decor was still very clean and in a good condition. Graet loaction on the edge of the city, easy to walk into the centre, get to the station, access the canal bus and there were numerous bars and eating places all around. Did not eat in the hotel but used the sky lounge - very modern and dark with music not to all tastes but the younger crowd but service was good. Number of bars and places to eat in the hotel and a room service too. Mini bar very pricey. Would definately go back if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, new lux hotel...staff still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: Harvard2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late July / Early Aug 2011 for the end of a European "girls trip." They have only been open a month, and despite being right next to the train station, the hotel is nice, clean, modern and luxurious. The rooms are really big - particular for European hotels - and we really appreciated the ability to rent bikes from the hotel to explore the city. As in most hotel restaurants, the food was way overpriced for the quality - particularly on the roofbar (though great views!!). The staff was all obviously new and still working out service kinks, but despite some hiccups, everyone was really eager to serve the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: hannahsmith4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights with my boyfriend (28th-30th July) and I was very impressed!.. The room was spotless, clean and very impressed with the free Wi-Fi! Very modern and comfortable. Our room faced the railway and yes you could hear the trains untill about 11pm/12pm and in the mornings but the soundproofing was great so no different to if you live on a busy main road really!?.. Slept well :) We didn't eat in the hotel, as we preferred to go out and about. Had a few drinks in the sky lounge, great view! We arrived expecting to not be able to check in untill 3pm but our room was avaliable so we were able to have it straight away which was great. I would definately return to this hotel, staff were friendly and welcoming :)

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestYorksMags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsderdam Mint as had previously stayed at the Leeds Mint & enjoyed the experience. The Staff were very helpful & friendly, had made a note on booking form was our Wedding Anniversary + my birthday received a bottle of wine in room, also complimentary Continental breakfast each day. Hotel very central, more hotels being built nearby so maybe some disruption? Although we didn`t have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Playful modern hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Haroutioun
Reviews.Content: What a fun experience... this is a well-designed hotel with plenty of public spaces to sit and enjoy a coffee or a beer, and the rooftop terrace is a must (even for non-guests). With free wifi throughout the hotel, it's easy to get some work done while enjoying a great view on the rooftop terrace or while people-watching in the lobby cafe. The standard room was one of the biggest rooms I have had in Amsterdam, and it was very comfortable and clean. I loved the iMac "entertainment system", where you could listen to streaming radio and other on-line media. The fitness center in the basement is a little gloomy, but it does the trick to get a quick workout to make up for all those stroopwafels I ate. The only possible issue with the hotel is the location near Central Station. It is convenient for the train, but also not the best area to return to late at night. Otherwise, this is an excellent hotel for the price and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: lubinv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 3 nights in July with my girlfriend. The location is perfect short train ride from the airport, 3 min walk from the central station, at walkable distance from the center of Amsterdam. Room was comfortable, free iMac and wifi inside . The breakfast buffet was diverse and tasty, staff was usually very helpful. On the down side , the maximum temperature inside the rooms is 22C, a bit cold if you're from country with warmer climate and not used to this kind of room temp'. Seconedly, i was charged falsely on my credit card quite a large amount. After i contacted the customer services they corrected the billing in couple of days, still this was some what of an inconvenience , being charged without giving you a reason why.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCPohlman
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam a couple of times a year and tried the Mint Hotel this time. Great experience - good price, nice rooms and great restaurants/lounge. The location is very convenient - right next to the Central Station in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, modern, clean with Imac, good hairdryer and white company toiletries...!”
Reviews.Author: BudBristol
Reviews.Content: Located right next to central station however don't be put off you can't hear the trains at all ! The hotel is pretty much new and is therefore very modern and clean and the rooms have everything you need from white company toiletries, a good hairdryer, Imac tv & free internet in the room, wifi,safe, iron and London Tea company tea bags......what more can you ask for......the bed was comfy too! We caught the train for about 3.7 euros from the airport into central station which took about 15 minutes -all very easy. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from central station and then for getting around, all the trams leave from central station too so the location is very good. The only complaint would be the reception check in/out is abit slow but the staff are very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: a15lek
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at hotel as I write this review. On arriving staff were very helpful I had requested a quiet room at front of hotel with a nice view on arrival not available I was shown/offered 2 other rooms neither were really what I wanted staff said the would notify me whwn another room became available. I was offered a club room within 15 mins lovely room great view and quiet. We had dinner at the hotel last night the food was outstanding! Also visited the sky lounge we left after 25 mins having not been served by this point I had asked 2 members of staff for service they said they would serve us shortly it did not happen! Other than this I would def come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not so good...”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachBosco
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Mint in Amsterdam. It just opened for business 4 months ago, so I'll give them a pass considering. Arrived and they had the wrong category, different than I paid for. Had to pull up my confirmation to show them. Although I booked a King Club, there were none available until the next day. Slept in a tiny room and the following day, they upgraded me to a suite. Very basic. They tout Mac TV and computers in every room, it was more difficult to navigate the TV than a normal remote (and I am a Mac user). The safe did not work, the phone didn't work, the meals from room the restaurant were great, but expensive and very small portions. Although the staff was very nice, they didn't follow through with fixing anything. I would return but I'll give them some time to work out their kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: erinmills
Reviews.Content: Five minute walk from Central station to the Hotel. Close to red light district and canal boats. Only problem is if you don't like trains request a room on the side facing the city rather than the train tracks. Ask for the 9th floor. There is a terrace that you can sit out on and have a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “W-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: thedoodlegirl
Reviews.Content: I'm at the Mint right now. I chose it for 3 reasons, price, it's new and free computer/wifi. I'm married, but traveling solo and am finding this hotel quite nice. Pros: See above. Also, staff is friendly. They allowed me to check in when my flight landed at 10am, which is several hours before actual check in. Soundproofing is another positive. Located next door to Centraal Station, but haven't heard a single train. Cons: While this locale is defintely close to sights (5 minute walk to Red Light District and more), next time I'm in town, I'll stay in Jordaan. I'm a New Yorker so I'd prefer being in the West Village as opposed to Murray Hill, but that's just me. Soundproofing - haven't heard a train, but I sure do hear doors close in my hall.

Reviews.Title: “All the great Mint hotel facilities.... but the service ?”
Reviews.Author: Paulbearuk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few Mint Hotels, and the facilities at the Amsterdam Mint Hotel are certainly up to the Mint standards. The public areas are spacious and well decorated, the Sky Lounge has fantastic views, and the bedrooms spacious (particularly for Amsterdam standards) and very comfortable. The power shower was one of the best i've experienced in a hotel, and the standard IMac was present. And the free wi-fi was particularly helpful to avoid having to pay roaming fees on my phone. However...... be prepared for a long wait at reception - both to check in and out, it's not a 5 minute job and not normal Mint standards. Another poster had made comment about the staff in Sky Lounge, I have to agree - plenty of staff (too many?) but not many of them doing anything. Watch the bill that you don't get charged for things that never arrive. Oh and one other thing - the room chamber maids - absolute STARS - friendly, hard working and very good at their jobs. Getting to the hotel from the airport - trains every 10 minutes and only 3.70 euro and get a tram card (24,48 or 72 hours) a bargain or an Amsterdam card which covers trams and museum entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb !”
Reviews.Author: norfolklad
Reviews.Content: From the moment I booked the Hotel the service has been Excellent. Sent an Email to Hotel to confirm our booking and room requirements, and had a reply within 5 minutes! from Marsha at the Hotel. The Hotel is very clean and tidy as it is quite new, and the decor is very modern with a superb power shower! Staff are very helpful (And Attractive !)....And the location is Excellent as it is only a 5 minute walk from the Central train station. A further 5 minute walk and you are in the center of this Amazing City... Superb location and lovely Hotel...See you soon !

Reviews.Title: “Very good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: glenabbey3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mint Hotel 22 July - 24 July and would definitely recommend! The hotel is located right beside central station so very easy to get to on arrival (2 min walk) and also beside the main tram stations so getting around the city is very easy. I recommend buying a 24 or 48 hour tram pass from the ticket desk across the street from central station. You swipe the pass getting on and off the trams. Try to buy a guide book that has a tram map which clearly shows both the tram numbers and the names of the stops and you will have no problems getting about. Our twin room was quite small but very modern with a great little bathroom and everything you could possibly need. The room overlooked railway lines and although it was quite noisy with the window open the room was well sound proofed once the window was shut and the trains stopped around midnight anyway. Check-in and check-out was quite efficient and Kelvin was particularly helpful regarding a late check-out. We did not eat at the hotel as the prices were quite high but we did have a few drinks in the skylounge on the 11th floor. This is well worth a visit for the view alone. The drinks are relatively expensive (hotel prices generally are) and the service is poor (lots of staff doing very little) but the location/view is fabulous. The staff here need some serious training in how to look after customers. If the staff were more attentive the customers would probably buy more drinks. Also, reserved tables should be clearly marked for the benefit of both customers and staff. All in all a very good hotel in a great location and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: BentDenmark
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at MInt Amsterdam our GPS didnÂ´t find the street, and the entrance doesnÂ´t appear very easy to find/interesting, but the hotel.... Probably because of the newly opening there were waiters, receptionists etc all over. Everything functioned 100 %. The rooms are nice, very cosy and modern with an Apple tv/computer in every room. You really feel at home. Free wi-fi without password. We didnÂ´t find the coffeemaking facilities till the second day, when we had a look in the bottom drawer.... Breakfast buffet is fine, but eggs, baqcon etc. are extra. Even at breakfast table service - coffee and different kinds of toast. At the top deck you find a wonderful terrrace. The hotel is situated only few hundred metres from the inner city. We brought bikes, but they can be rented as well. Only minus: Parking is extremely expensive - app. 45 â‚¬ a day...... And watch it - drive in at the public parking Oosterdok - it is connected directly to the hotel. The recpetionist knew nothing about it when we arrived. We bought the stay as a promo, but even at full price it is a good offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & view, outstanding service & staff”
Reviews.Author: RaniaMagdy
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay. The staff are amazing and very efficient. The hotel is sooo clean and neat. The location and view of the room are phenomenal. It is just a 2 minute walk from central station and 5 minute walk to Damrak street. Very modern hotel in the heart of the old city. My husband was on a business trip and i stayed all the mornings in the hotel and didn't get bored for a second. The iMac in the room was very entertaining and the sky lounge on the 11th floor was breathtaking. Will diffidently come back. Thank you all at Mint Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff really need to step up to the plate”
Reviews.Author: CarstenThue
Reviews.Content: Overall is about average for a brand new 4 star business hotel which this clearly is. The hotel is pretty new, and still needs some finishing touches, however this will probably turn out to be a pretty decent hotel, once management and staff gets up to speed with how to run the show. We came a bit early for checkin and was not able to get our rooms, was offered to leave our bags at reception, and went out to se the city. Upon return at 1500 (earliest time for check-in) we were stunned by the waiting time and the complete lack of efficiency by the staff at the front desk. Once our turn we were taken good care of, only mishap was that we were told that out booking was without breakfast, this beeing completely wrong. The rooms are great and i love the touch with the iMac on every room. Location is both good and bad, just 5 min walk from the central train station and 10 mins off the redlight district. Now the bad about the location is that half the rooms faces the trainstation, and even on the 10th floor were we stayed it was very noisy at night. We also had the same experience as one of the other guys with the Sky bar, the staff are very ineffective, had to wait for a long time as one of two customers in the bar despite the fact that there was 7 or 8 on shift, and it seemed like only the one bartender wanted to work (the one helping out the other customer) Once you get your drinks the wiev from the sky bar is amazing and almost worth the 30 eur we paid for two drinks. Parking is 45 Eur per night - seems a bit steep, however this has nothing to do with the hotel since the city sets the rate. The first morning we had a knock on the door at 8.30 from an employee who just wanted to check if we had taken something from the minibar, fair play... we had'nt put the do not disturb sign up but anyways, why not let the maid check for minibar usage when making up the rooms? The Continental breakfast is a bit dull and if you want eggs and bacon you have to pay through the nose, there isnt much room to accomodate all the guests, and again the staff was very slow to get the tables cleaned up to accomodate new guests.

Reviews.Title: “Booking blind more than paid off”
Reviews.Author: TOsimon
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel 2 days before arrival. The pictures looked great, there weren't many reviews so we were apprehensive, but the worst thing that could happen was we needed to change hotel. The location is phenomenal - 2 minutes from Centraal Station on the island. Modern, immaculate, great clean lines, immpeccable service for the rooms. The only downside was the Skylounge, which despite being great to look at, the service was slow and a bit iffy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ELLEN130785
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the mint hotel,absolutley thrilled with our time there. The room was bright modern and very clean,wardrobe large and enough drawer space for a couple for a few days. Bathroom small but perfectly formed,shower powerful and large,toiletrys 'White company' very nice.Bed amazing! iMac in room as tv and computer very good.(I now need one at home) Although the hotel is next door to central station it is silent! Never heard a peep! Only takes 5 mins to walk into town,perfectly located! The only downside and it was a very small thing is that check in/out was a little slow! But I'm sure this will be rectified with time. I would definatley recommend and stay here again,looking forward to staying in other mint hotels The only
