Reviews.Title: “bad expirience in mint hote amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: massimiliano64021
Reviews.Content: I suggest everyone do not go to mint hotel Amsterdam because in the heart of the night ( 01.30 a.m. ) i was waken up from someone that opened my room ant tried to come in..fortunately i was able to close the door and immediatelly i called the reception , The receptionist said was a person of the hotel came to check the room.. at last: my girlfriend and I did not sleep all night and to be angry. ladies and gentlments go somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect for a couple's retreat”
Reviews.Author: JMTNorth
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel in the middle of Amsterdam central! Exceptionally friendly staff in reception, lounge bar and sky lounge. The room was on the 9th floor, excellent view. The room was very clean and everything was easy to find. Wonderful bathroom with a roomy shower and enough fresh towels. Very modern look all in all. Hotel elevators are fast and spaceous. Location excellent - five minutes walk from the Red Lights District, two minutes from the Centraal Railway station. All restaurants and shops nearby. We liked the friendly staff best and the dinner in lounge bar (do taste the tapas!). Computer/TV in the room was a lifesaver when we wanted to find up-to-date info on Amsterdam lightlife etc.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Simples77
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on trip advisor we were a little apprehensive about our choice, but all I can say is ignore the negative comments! The room was great, clean and well stocked with apple mac with full Internet, tv channels, radio etc, the bathroom was perfectly cleaned everyday and the bed was even comfy! We found the staff very accommodating from bar staff to the ease of guest services ordering us a taxi on request. I couldn't recommend this enough, with another great plus was the location. As soon as you leave central station you can see it on the left, this was the easiest traveling we have ever done!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: nasarlatif
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel week commencing 18th July 2011. After having trawled my way through various hotels in amsterdam i found one which meets most if not all of the requirements. The hotel is situated just around the corner from central station approx less than 5 mins walk - easy to spot. The check in was a bit slow however they were quite busy. The hotel has good sized rooms some people have moaned there is no room between the bed and the wall to walk - this is not true. The rooms are a good size. There are the things you would expect from a hotel but dont necessarily get in Amsterdam - such as a kettle with TEA and milk (not creamer), an apple mac computer which also is a tv, a power shower, an iron and ironing board, room service, a mini bar - though i have to say some of the prices are expensive - this isnt really a problem as you can buy most things from the train station anyway (albert heijn the supermarket is also here). My room didnt have a splendid view all i saw was a corridor so i complained and was told ill be moved tomorrow to a sea view. The sky bar at top floor has a splendid view. Staff are well mannered and polite and quite accommodating. The hotel only opened in late May 2011 therefore there are some tweaks which are required. I told them i was a business customer who travelled to amsterdam every two weeks, however there wasnt much of an effort made to value my custom - i put it down to lack of experience. All in all based on my experience of hotels in Amsterdam (ive stayed in the basic to the top ones) I would definitely say this is my number one - best for location, slightly higher prices than others, however you get all the stuff you would expect from a hotel so there is nothing really to disappoint you. I would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Starlight1985
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for one night on Saturday. We were very impressed with the location, the hotel is right beside the train station and very close walking distance to main attractions in Amsterdam. We stayed in a club balcony room and it was amazing, we were on the 8th floor an our balcony was huge! It overlooked the best view of Amsterdam. The room was spacious and clean with a lovely big bed, the bathroom had a separate shower and bath. Best of all the room had a free iMac to use and free wifi throughout the hotel. The only negatives I would have to say about the hotel would be that the reception were very slow on check in and check out, staff were very apologetic about this and as it is a new hotel I presume this will improve over time. The desk staff were very accommodating when ever we spoke to them and gave us use of umbrellas when we were heading out for the night as it rained all Saturday. Be sure to hang your "do not disturb" sign on your room door as between the hours of 9.30-11 am housekeeping came into the room twice. I would advise checking out early as at 12pm the queue was extremely long but we were in no hurry to leave Amsterdam as we did not have flights to catch. Staff offered to hold our bags and we came back to the hotel to check out once the queue had eased. We hope to return to the hotel sometime and have told all our friends how much we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 nights wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shotta4u2nv
Reviews.Content: Love the location near central train station and red light district with beautiful views despite not having a room with a view I saw from rooms while house cleaning was being performed maybe next time they will give us a room with a view! The rooms small n cozy the bathrooms are amazing staff are wonderful still new I could tell they are now getting used to the operation and each other! Only fault food servings way to small 21 euros for 3 small prices oft lamb however good tasting it might be! which it was :) also stingy with the alcohol lol but that's ok I guess can walk across bridge and drink for cheap at a local bar!

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt by lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Gayguys_55
Reviews.Content: A recently opened hotel in a very convenient location - less tha 5 minutes from the main station. Situated alongside the railway track but with excellent sound-proofing so no noise whatsoever. What would otherwise have been an excellent experience was somewhat spoilt by little niggles eg. having liquid soap in the bathroom - I had booked an Club floor room so I would have expected better than this. Would also have expected bottled water in the room. Web site mentions welcome drink for Club floor rooms but none offered. Bed extremely comfortable but experience spoilt by lack of feather pillows Housekeeping leaves a little to be desired. Requested reception to arrange for shower (liquid) soap to be replenished on leaving the hotel one evening - returned to find that towels had been changed but no shower soap not replaced! Maid service needs to pay more attention to detail - used coffee cup not washed when room serviced and half empty glass of water left by the bed. With a little more attention to detail, this hotel could be a welcome addition to the Amsterdam hotel scene.

Reviews.Title: “As if Built by Ikea”
Reviews.Author: Adri0809
Reviews.Content: Because The Mint is so new and has few reviews, I feel a responsibility to write a thorough review. The Mint Hotel is newly constructed; located a 5 minute walk from the central tram station. And another 10 minute walk from the main activity areas of Amsterdam. The corridors to the rooms are long & narrow. There are almost 100 rooms per floor. The rooms and bathrooms are tiny but efficient. In general, the rooms, bathrooms, and hotel spaces are very clean. If you are looking at the most basic room, expect about 4 inches separation between the end of the bed and the wall. The beds are close to the ground and the sheets are rough. A huge plus is the the free wifi throughout the hotel and a free to use Mac in your room. It doubles as your TV screen and general information center. I read a review that said the Mac was difficult to use. I found it user friendly. Breakfast was included in my room rate. The variety of food provided was appropriate. Not lavish. Some Glitches: 1. Upon check-in the reception person was providing a lesser grade room than what we'd paid for and then said breakfast was not included. After my correcting, they reassigned the room and included breakfast. 2. Breakfast Area: The hotel needs a bigger area to accommodate the breakfast items, more staff, and fix the load slamming door staff goes in & out every 5 seconds. 3. Guest Services desk needs more than 2 people to man it. There are simply too many guests needing help at any particular time. Additionally, the Guest Service personnel need more training or experience. 4. On our last day, housekeeping never made it to our room. Beds were never made and had use our towels from the previous day. Also, room service trays are frequently left 24 hours in the hallway. The Mint has potential, I hope they get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Improve your staff asap!!!”
Reviews.Author: lienepien
Reviews.Content: I had a friend over from spain whom i liked to show around. I heard about the mint hotel and their supposedly superb roof terrace... I must say the view is breathtaking but that is all. It took more tan 20 min for a waiter to arrive.. So we asked for a menu (why arent these on the table?) then it took another 10 minutes to get it. The first time he arrivd we asked about the free wifi, how it worked and if we needed a code... He didnt know and would ask a colleague. The colleague never came back nor did he. We asked another waiter again 10 minutes later, she didnt know and finally another colleague gave us the answer, it is free withouta code......was that really that hard to tell?!?!? Then looking at the menu, alcohol free cocktails for 10 euros, would you like champagne inn them it is 17,50 euro, these are prices for upper class establishments, i have no problem with that but make sure that the service is upper class as well. We ordered simple sodas and even in an airplane they are served with more flair. I ordered tomato juice, the bartender premixed it spicey, which was very nice, but the drink was served without a slice of lemon, no coaster or napkin etc.... It is just not what i expect looking at he prices on their menu. Also the huge amount of touists just coming up to look at the view.... Imagine you sitting their trying to be posh with you 17,50 champagne cocktail, being run over by kids, staff taking 30 minutes to come at your table.... You must admit the prices are complete out of proportion. I would advice a sign saying: entrance for guests only.... We were sitting next to a huge latino family wit kids playing all over the place.... It just doesnt mix in with the guests you try to sere (looking at your menu) and please teain the staff about the wifi for instance.... How com nobody knew the answer to such a simple question? Also some umbrellas would be nice and maybe some decoration. I do understand you just opened so i hope this is just some start up problem.... On the other hand, you re already serving guests so make sure they get a nice experience wouldnyou want them to come back.....

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
HotelInfo.Address: Oosterdoksstraat 4, Amsterdam 1011 DK, The Netherlands (Formerly Mint Hotel Amsterdam)
